Cape Verde is home to a greater number of musicians per square kilometer than any other country in the world. The former Portuguese territory was once a key location for the transatlantic slave trade, a target for 16th century pirates and a refuge for exiled Jews.
"Double Falsehood," a play first published in 1728, was written more than a century earlier by William Shakespeare. Two scholars analyzed 33 plays by Shakespeare, nine by Fletcher and 12 by Lewis Theobald to create a "psychological signature" of each author. They compared those profiles to the language in the play and determined that the play's first half was almost entirely written by Shakespeare.
Kenya has frozen 86 accounts linked to suspected terror supporters, a government spokesman says. The government is tracking the finances of people suspected of ties to Al-Shabaab, the militant group that claimed responsibility for the attack.

Currently parents can opt out of vaccinations for medical or religious reasons, or by stating they are "conscientious objectors," and still receive taxpayer funded child care benefits.

Japan's 48 nuclear reactors are offline in the wake of the Fukushima disaster in 2011, when a tsunami triggered by a massive earthquake sent a wall of water crashing into the power plant. Earthquakes are a fact of life in Nepal, with tremors of magnitude 4 or 5 occurring several times each year, geologist and science journalist Kate Ravilious says. The last major earthquake to affect this part of the Himalayas was in the 1500s, and Kathmandu was badly damaged in an earthquake that occurred farther east in 1934.

Tornadoes touch down near Dallas on Sunday, causing street flooding. There are reports of damage, including many roofs ripped off.

The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) will launch in October 2018 on an Ariane 5 rocket from French Guiana. JWST is being designed to study the first stars and galaxies that formed in the early universe. The new telescope requires a huge mirror of 25 square meters (about 270 square feet) and a golf ball of gold.
Liberland is the world's newest micronation, founded on a firm belief in liberty and noninterference from the powers-that-be. A tiny, 7 square-kilometer parcel of land, marked on maps as Gornja Siga, abuts the Danube on the border between Serbia and Croatia.

2015 may be remembered as the year the term "transgender" fully entered mainstream consciousness. For decades, trans people, as many transgender people like to be called, rarely saw themselves represented in popular culture.

He decided to quit the job and come up with an idea to help poachers make a living -- a plan that didn't include killing wildlife. He took all his savings and divided it to poachers to rent land, buy seeds and start farming.

Blackwater workers Paul Slough, Evan Liberty and Dustin Heard are sentenced to 30 year each, plus one day. Nicholas Slatten is sentenced to a term of life in prison, mandatory for his first-degree murder conviction. Blackwater lost its $1 billion contract with the State Department to protect American diplomatic personnel in 2009.

The New South China Mall is the biggest shopping mall in the world in terms of leasable space. Opened to the public in 2005 in Dongguan in the south of the country, the goal was to attract 100,000 visitors a day. It was classified by industry analysts as a "dead mall" and became an unflattering symbol of China's runaway speculation.
ISIS fighters seize several districts in the Iraqi city of Ramadi, an official says. Ramadi is about 70 miles (110 kilometers) west of Baghdad.

Brian Rogers and Caitlin McGuire own the Breckenridge Cannabis Club, a recreational marijuana dispensary in Colorado. The couple started their business as a medical cannabis dispensary in 2010, but when Colorado became the first state to allow the sale of recreational marijuana, they saw a once-in-a-lifetime business opportunity.

It is a regional logistics hub for the Afghan police force -- a generous facility that was originally intended to resupply the entire east of the country with uniforms, ammunition, even fuel.

A drone carrying traces of a radioactive material was found on the roof of Japan's equivalent to the White House. Police say the drone was equipped with a small camera, smoke flares and a plastic bottle containing small traces of radioactive material. The discovery is raising concerns about the potential for terrorism involving drones.
UltraHaptics creates tactile three-dimensional shapes literally out of thin air, using ultrasound. Technology creates sensations through an emission of sound waves, projected through the air and to the user. Changes in air pressure are perceived as suspended tactile surfaces, creating invisible -- but tangible -- interfaces.

Google Maps has been at the center of a few April Fools' Day pranks. This year the company rolled out the Pac-Man game Tuesday.

China has launched a smartphone app starring its current leader, President Xi Jinping. The app features the latest news about Xi and allows users to access the traditional texts that Xi quotes from. Xi is keen to be portrayed as a strong leader and as a man of the people.
Aaron Hernandez is known for his swagger when he's on trial for murder. Aaron Hernandez is a former rising star for the New England Patriots.

The Weekly Newsquiz tests students' knowledge of events in the news.

Norway is slated to become the first in the world to phase out FM radio in two years' time. On FM, Norwegians can only find five stations. On the Digital Audio Broadcasting network, there are four times that number.
O.C. Marsh first named the Brontosaurus in 1879, after he received 25 crates of bones discovered at Como Bluff, Wyoming. Paleontologist Elmer Riggs concluded in 1903 that it was a young Apatosaurus, and therefore must go by that name. Emanuel Tschopp, a paleontologist at the Nova University of Lisbon, Portugal, led the study.
Al Qaeda offers 20 kilograms of gold to anyone who kills or captures Houthi leader Abdelmalik Bedrudin Al-Houthi and former Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh. AQAP is one of several factions fighting to control Yemen.

But it's no longer enough for them, says a study published Friday. They've developed a new IT weapon and have attacked servers outside their borders, including in the United States.

David Moore, 25, went berserk with road rage after leaving his home in Burnley, Lancashire. He punched Rafal Cegielka, 45, who was picking up his child from St John's Primary School. Moore then jumped out of his car and punched the father through his open window. He then ripped away a fencing panel from a nearby garden and chased the victim's vehicle with it. Finally, he armed himself with the hockey stick from his home, and shouted: 'I'll f***ing kill him'Moore admitted assault by beating, destroying £100 worth of fencing and damaging his car. He was given 16 weeks in prison, suspended for two years and ordered to pay £650 compensation.

The crew was ordered to put on immersion suits and abandon the schooner, according to a press release from the Coast Guard. Amazing pictures have emerged of blue fluorescent algae lighting up Australia's east coast. The images were taken in Jervis Bay, the south coast of NSW, as the neon glow illuminated one of Australia's popular beaches. Photographer Andy Hutchinson described the sight as a 'beautiful supernatural scene' caused by millions of plankton omitting light. A similar display was shown in Sydney's Manly Beach back in August 2014.

Michael Thorpe, 55, was convicted of showing Premier League games on foreign TV channels. He said he could not afford to pay Sky TV's rates for football matches, and opted instead to show Albanian transmissions. But he was convicted, fined and ordered to pay costs eight years ago, when screening the matches was still treated as a criminal offence. Mr Thorpe launched an appeal against his conviction soon after his trial, but the case was delayed by a similar test case which went as far as the European Court of Justice.

Reading supporter, whose team were 3-0 up at the time, did four front flips on the pitch, landing on his back each time. He is now facing a potential three-year ban for carrying out the stunt. The order, due to be decided on April 30, would stop him going to all Reading's future home and away matches.

Brittany Huber, 23, and John Redman, 25, were driving from Dalton, Georgia, to her hometown of Mobile, Alabama when Redman lost control of his Lexus in a rainstorm in April 2014. The car blew a tire, hydroplaned and smashed into a bridge column on Interstate 85, killing the 23-year-old bride in impact. Redman survived, but his body was left shattered and he was told by his doctors that he was likely to spend the rest of his life in a nursing home, confined to a wheelchair. The Dalton Roadrunners beat Westmont College of California 71-53 in Kansas City on March 24.

Property also boasts a swimming pool, tennis court, stables, library, wine cellar and billiard room. It is thought the Regency home could attract A-list buyers as the secluded grounds offer residents complete privacy.

A study has outlined that 30 percent of Australians complain about their lack of sleep on a daily basis. The average amount of sleep for an adult is around eight hours, with a range of seven to nine. Any less than six hours or any more than ten hours is unusual for the standard person.

The clip, uploaded to Facebook today, show an angry woman unleashing a racist tirade over her fence at a group of men who appear to be of African descent. The woman then appears in her neighbour's front yard brandishing a metal crowbar, verbally abusing the men and swinging the weapon at them. It is believed the lamb had been shipped to a company at Darwin Airport, and would then be sent on to the Tiwi Islands 100kms to the north. The stash would have been worth $2000 if it had been sold, about four times the normal price of the drug in suburban Australia.

Two people have been formally identified for allegedly throwing bottles as they continue to investigate the incident. Dug and his owner, Lindsay Castro, were hiking on the Jurupa Hills trail in Fontana, Canada, on Thursday when they heard a rattling sound. Lindsay backed away, but Dug ran up to the reptile - and suffered the consequences. The snake bit Dug in the face, and his face instantly ballooned to twice its size.
Jose Mourinho could return to manage Real Madrid one day, says Alvaro Arbeloa. Mourinho left Real Madrid in 2013 amid rumours of bust-ups with senior players, including club captain Iker Casillas, Sergio Ramos and Pepe. Mourinho is said to be considering a £40million move for Raphael Varane.
Liverpool lost 4-1 to Arsenal at the Emirates on Saturday in the Premier League. Manager Brendan Rodgers admitted his side are unlikely to qualify for the Champions League. Mario Balotelli withdrew himself from the squad to face Arsenal after picking up a knock.
Inter Milan drew 1-1 with bottom-of-the-table Parma at the San Siro on Saturday. Roberto Mancini cancelled his players' day off and ordered them into training on Sunday. The first team trained at 8:30 a.m. local time, watched by club vice-president Javier Zanetti and sporting director Piero Ausilio.
Paul Parker's old passport was listed on eBay for an eye-watering £5,000. The item was listed earlier in March and bidding ended on Tuesday. It is unclear whether anyone actually stumped up the sizeable sum being quoted.
Paddy Morrall noticed the full-length Christ on a snapped scaffolding board in Inverness, Scotland, on Wednesday. The 31-year-old builder, from Keighley, near Bradford, has kept the board.
Ondrej Duda scored after the interval to lead Slovakia to a 1-0 victory over the Czech Republic. The 20-year-old midfielder struck with a low shot from outside the penalty area in the 49th minute. It was the third victory for Slovakia in the 10th match against the Czechs.
Karim Benzema posted a video of him singing along to Tupac's classic track 'Check Out Time'Benzema has scored 20 goals in all competitions for Real Madrid this season.
Tycoon Harvey Boulter has already given £30,000 to Ukip candidate fighting Fox in Somerset seat. He is also spending another £30K to try to defeat Tom Tugendhat in Tonbridge and West Malling, Kent. Fox resigned from Cabinet in 2011 after revealing Fox's close friend, Adam Werritty, accompanied him on overseas trips.
Sergio Bus opened the scoring for Sheffield Wednesday in the 86th minute. Substitute Ishmael Miller equalised for Huddersfield Town just a minute from time. Sheffield Wednesday were reduced to 10 men for a spell when Joe Mattock went off injured.
Stuart Dallas scored twice as Brentford beat Fulham 4-1 on Good Friday. The 23-year-old spent three months on loan at Northampton last season.
A new Facebook graph reveals the favorite baseball teams in the country by sorting through people's likes and breaking down winners by county. The New York Yankees and Boston Red Sox come in first and second respectively in terms of the number of people who claim them as their favorite. The graph, created by Facebook, uses profile likes and then breaks the individuals down by country to determine a winner.
Trey Moses, a senior at Eastern High School in Louisville, Kentucky who will play for Ball State next year, asked Ellie Meredith to be his date to the upcoming prom. Moses, who volunteers with teenagers with learning disabilities, surprised her during her P.E. class with a bunch of flowers and a sign reading: 'Let's Party Like it's 1989' - a reference to an album by Taylor Swift, Ellie's favorite singer.
President Barack Obama took a break from being the real president on April Fools' Day to impersonate a fictional one, House of Cards' conniving Frank Underwood. Underwood is played by Oscar-winning actor Kevin Spacey and frequently speaks Shakespearean-style monologues to the audience. The real president slipped into his normal voice by the end of the 12-second impersonation.
Ludovic Obraniak was substituted during Caykur Rizespor's match against Fenerbahce. The Poland international was taken to hospital with a suspected heart problem. The 30-year-old is currently on loan at the Turkish side from Werder Bremen.
A 1973 E-Type Jaguar has been involved in a head-on collision with a Toyota Kluger. The crash happened on Warringah Road in Frenchs Forest, northern Sydney at a traffic light intersection. Nobody was hurt in the collision, however all three adults were taken to hospital as a precaution. NSW police said they are still investigating the circumstances surrounding the devastating collision.
Residents from Lijin village in Dongying city carry the explosive in bags as long as six metres on rickshaws. This reckless behaviour has been reported on as early as May 2011 in Zibo city in Shandong.
Tiger Woods has been spotted practising at Augusta National on Tuesday. The former world No 1 has not played on the PGA Tour since withdrawing from Farmers Insurance Open on February 5 with a recurrence of his back problems. Woods has dropped out of the top 100 in the world rankings for the first time in 19 years.
44-page document was commissioned by executives at the BBC who hired an agency to research how smiley faces could be used in news stories and on social media. Emoji designers were also told to make graphics for the faces of popular stars such as Gary Lineker and Graham Norton. Bosses at Radio 1 and Radio 1 Extra were sent the guide earlier this week.
Moses Kipsiro is a regular training partner of Mo Farah. The 28-year-old is the 10,000m Commonwealth champion after defending his title in Glasgow last summer. He says he was approached by five female athletes at a training camp for the African Cross-Country Championships last year. The Ugandan Athletics Federation deny the allegations.
Patrick Kluivert has helped Curacao progress to the next stage of 2018 World Cup qualification. The Caribbean island team advanced to the second qualifying round in CONCACAF for the 2018 tournament.
Brady Eaves, 18, was filmed biting the head off a live hamster during a drunken spring break party in Florida. He has been expelled from the University of Mississippi, where he was on a scholarship, and submitted for mental health tests. His stepfather John Arthur Eaves Jr, who was the Democratic candidate in Mississippi's 2007 gubernatorial elections, and mother Angel Eaves told the press: 'The actions that appear in the video go against everything that our son has been taught, and we can assure everyone that his actions are not what he believes in his heart, nor are true to his character'
Sri Lanka's Kumar Sangakkara retired from limited overs cricket on March 18. Sri Lanka's sports minister Navin Dissanayake has asked the batsman to reconsider his decision. The 37-year-old has accumulated 14,234 one-day runs, second only to Sachin Tendulkar.
Dougie Fife, Alasdair Dickinson and Ross Ford were all rested for last week's Guinness Pro12 26-15 win over Scarlets in Llanelli. But the trio have been recalled by head coach Alan Solomons.

Sixth-form student Silhan Ozcelik, 18, went missing from her Kurdish family’s home in north London last October. She travelled on the Eurostar with another man to Stuttgart, Germany, where the Kurdish Workers’ Party (PKK) youth movement have its headquarters.
Esteban Cambiasso joined Leicester City on a free transfer last summer. The Foxes are rock-bottom of the Premier League, seven points adrift of 17th placed Sunderland.
Manchester City are six points clear at the top of the table with a game in hand. Alan Pardew believes the title race is far from over despite Chelsea's lead. City overtook Liverpool with one game to play last season and Sergio Aguero's injury-time winner against QPR in 2012 sealed the title.
Hull City have reapplied to the Football Association to have the club name changed to Hull Tigers. The move angered fans who believed they had won the battle to keep their current when the FA council voted against it by 47 votes to 27.
Swansea City host Hull City at the Liberty Stadium (Saturday, 3pm)Jefferson Montero suffered a muscle strain during Ecuador's 1-0 defeat by Mexico in a Los Angeles friendly on Saturday. Leon Britton and Kyle Bartley are both back in training after being absent in recent weeks. Tom Carroll is definitely out after damaging ankle ligaments on England Under 21 duty and might not play again this season. Tom Huddlestone is suspended while Nikica Jelavic and Robert Snodgrass remain sidelined.
John Bramblitt, 42, had epilepsy from the age of 11 which caused him to lose his eyesight. He decided that an inability to see should not prevent him from painting. He uses a special technique to help him translate his visions onto the canvas. Despite never seeing his guide dog, he was able to create this highly accurate painting.
Stoke City host Chelsea at Stamford Bridge (Stamford Bridge) on Saturday, 5.30pm. Diego Costa may not be risked following a hamstring injury for the Blues. John Obi Mikel will not be considered despite recovering from his knee problem. Jonathan Walters is expected to shake off a calf knock in time to be available for Stoke. Marc Muniesa is set to return to the matchday squad after missing five games with a hamstring problem.
Stuart McCall's side face Hearts at Ibrox on Sunday. Hearts have beaten Rangers 3-1 and 2-0 on three league visits to Govan this season. The Tynecastle side won 2-1 on their previous trip in August, while Hibernian have also beaten Rangers. McCall believes a significant home victory over Hearts would be ideal.
Ronny Deila's side are now eight points clear of Aberdeen at the top of the SPL. St Mirren are currently bottom of the table and four points from a play-off spot.
Charles Piutau will join Ulster on a two-year deal from 2016. The 23-year-old has won 14 caps for the All Blacks and can play full back, wing or centre. He has played for the Auckland Blues in New Zealand since 2012.

Juventus beat Empoli 2-0 to maintain their 14-point lead at the top of Serie A. Carlos Tevez opened the scoring shortly before the interval and Roberto Pereyra added a second in stoppage time. Roma strengthened their grip on second place thanks to a 1-0 win over Napoli. Miralem Pjanic's 15th-minute goal was enough to earn Rudi Garcia's men all three points. AC Milan picked up their first win away from home since mid-October, beating Palermo 2-1.
Kevin de Bruyne has been linked with a move away from Wolfsburg. The midfielder is wanted by a host of clubs including Manchester City and Bayern Munich. De Bruyne's agent Patrick De Koster has denied a deal is in place for the midfielder to leave. But he admitted that a number of clubs are keeping an eye on the Belgian.
Swansea City host Hull City at the Liberty Stadium on Saturday. Garry Monk's side have yet to pick up a point after an international break this term. Swansea have eight more games to collect the five points needed to beat 47-point mark.
Ronaldo is a co-owner of second tier United States side, Fort Lauderdale Strikers. The 2002 World Cup winner is also a target for ex-Barcelona and Real Madrid star Lionel Messi. Ronaldo says he 'would pay from his own pocket' to sign Messi.
George North will miss Saturday's European Champions Cup quarter-final at Clermont Auvergne after his latest head injury. North has been knocked unconscious three times in recent months, including in last Friday's 52-30 win over Wasps, and was on Wednesday being assessed by a neurologist. North is the top try-scorer in the competition with seven this season.
Cesar Azpilicueta is counting down the games until Chelsea win the Barclays Premier League title. The Blues sit top of the table ahead of facing Stoke City at Stamford Bridge on Saturday.
Mohamed Diame will make his long-awaited return for Hull City on Saturday. Midfielder has been out for more than four months with a knee injury. Hull are currently just three points above the relegation zone with eight games remaining.

Swansea's Tom Carroll faces up to six weeks on the sidelines due to ankle ligament damage. The 22-year-old scored the winning goal for England Under 21s against Czech Republic last Friday. Carroll has made 18 appearances for Swansea during his season-long loan spell from Tottenham.
Franck Ribery says he has no chance of playing against Borussia Dortmund this week. The Bayern Munich winger limped off against Shakhtar Donetsk with an injury at the beginning of last month. The French winger is hopeful he could be back for Bayer Leverkusen in midweek.
Bayern Munich face Borussia Dortmund in the Bundesliga on Saturday. Franck Ribery, Arjen Robben, Javi Martinez and David Alaba have all been ruled out. Philipp Lahm could make his first Bundesliga start since November 18.
Michael Duff believes Sean Dyche could one day take charge of the England team. Dyche has improved Burnley's fortunes since he took charge at Turf Moor in 2012. The 37-year-old has played in eight different divisions before taking on the likes of Manchester United.

Roy Hodgson has confirmed the Tottenham striker will be in Gareth Southgate's squad for the tournament in the Czech Republic. Kane is also set to travel to Australia and Malaysia this summer ahead of the championships. Mauricio Pochettino has given Kane his blessing to play in the competition.
Alvaro Morata joined Juventus from Real Madrid for £15.8million last summer. The 22-year-old has scored seven goals in 22 Serie A matches for Juventus so far this season.
More than 30 Premiership and Championship games set to be affected this weekend. More than half the games will be affected by delays and disruption, forcing fans onto the roads. All routes to and from London Euston - serving the main west coast rail line between the capital and Birmingham, Manchester and Liverpool - have been hit. There will also be no trains available for the thousands of Liverpool fans wanting to get home after the Arsenal versus Liverpool match on Saturday.
Brentford beat Fulham 4-1 in the west London derby at Craven Cottage on Saturday. Stuart Dallas scored twice to put the Bees in a commanding lead at half-time. Alan Judge and Jota completed the victory for Brentford. Fulham boss Kit Symons admits his side aren't yet safe from relegation.

Chelsea vs Liverpool and Manchester United vs Arsenal are arguably the standout games from the live batch. The Quick Silver P-51D Mustang is some 70 years old and reconstructed from more than 200 parts by a father-and-son team. Bill and Scooter Yoak restored the plane as a tribute to American servicemen who have died in combat.
Natal's Dunas Arena is being sold by owner Grupo OAS. The company is also trying to sell the 50 percent share it owns of the Fonte Nova arena in Salvador. OAS spent 591 million reais (around £126 million) on rebuilding the old arena.
13 U.S. senators have written to FIFA calling for Russia to be removed as host of the 2018 World Cup because of its role in the Ukraine crisis and occupation of Crimea. The lead signers were Senator Robert Menendez, the top Democrat on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee and Senator Ron Johnson, the Republican chairman of the foreign relations panel's Europe subcommittee.

The Renault 16 was the world’s first ever hatchback unveiled in April 1965. Now it accounts for two thirds of all new cars sold in Britain and a majority of those sold in most other markets from Europe to Japan.

The 34-year-old was arrested after Connacht's 14-7 defeat by Gloucester in European Challenge Cup. He is accused of assaulting a woman in a crowded bar in Cardiff city centre in March. He was held in cells overnight before being questioned for more than six hours by detectives.

Diaby has suffered 42 injuries during his Arsenal career, keeping him out of action for a total of 226 weeks. Wenger said he has made it clear how he envisages the future for Diaby.

Police in Rhein Erft, Germany received a bizarre phone call explaining that a large kangaroo was spotted 'happily' hopping through a field. They immediately assumed it was a April Fools prank and dismissed the strange call. It wasn't until the caller was questioned in detail and provided'very believable' answers, that the police realised that they were telling the truth.

Wayne Rooney, Andros Townsend and Ross Barkley all received seven out of ten. Italy manager Antonio Conte and Southampton striker Graziano Pelle receive high praise.

Brendan Rodgers insists Raheem Sterling will not be leaving Liverpool this summer. The 20-year-old admitted in a TV interview that he is not yet ready to sign a new £100,000-a-week contract with the club. The England star said he was 'flattered' by interest from Arsenal as his contract talks are put on hold. Rodgers said Sterling was still young and'sometimes makes mistakes'He added that Liverpool were a'superpower' in world football and didn't have to sell star assets.

A group of eight contracted workers broke into the 52-metre slide at the Sydney Royal Easter Show on Saturday night. Five staff members sustained serious injuries after taking a joy ride down 'the Super Slide'The slide was closed after heavy rain made it too dangerous. A 22-year old woman broke both her legs, a 60-year-old man suffered broken ribs and internal bleeding while a 23-year, woman also broke her leg. The slide underwent a safety check Sunday morning and was cleared for use, as long as there wasn't another downpour.

Manuel Pellegrini admits Manchester City will have to buy young talent. Raheem Sterling would fit the bill if his impasse with Liverpool isn't resolved. City have been linked with Arsenal's Jack Wilshere and Everton's Ross Barkley.
National Union of Teachers is expected to call for a vote on industrial action this weekend. The ballot of its 300,000 members would take place after the election, with strikes possible from September. The last time teachers across the country went on strike was in July, when 21 per cent of schools were forced to close.

Kevin Sinfield will leave Leeds Rhinos at the end of the season to join Yorkshire Carnegie on an 18-month contract. Former Leeds and England coach Tony Smith admits he was shocked by Sinfield's decision to switch codes. Sinfield is closing in on third place in rugby league's all-time scoring list with 3,997 points.
Residents of Beckley Club Estates in Dallas, Texas, say that they saw a man approach a male peacock, who was in the middle of its mating ritual and had unfurled its full plumage, before quickly snatching him up on Saturday. Footage from the home of Lisa Solis shows the thief grab the animal by both its claws before shoving him in his black SUV.
Tortoise casanovca is seen trying to mate with a female at Kiev Zoo, Ukraine. But instead of getting lucky, the blundering reptile somehow manages to lose its balance. The amusing moment was caught on camera, by Ukranian photographer, Vadym Shevchenko.
A farmer has captured the adorable moment a duckling groomed a lamb's woollen coat in a 'heartwarming sign of trust and friendship'The lamb named Winter stands very still with its head lowered towards the baby duck. Walking around to the front of the lamb, the duck begins pecking at the lamb's head and neck.
The Glass House in Chislehurst, south east London, was built in 1951 as a secret Cold War bunker for civil servants in the event of a nuclear attack. Site was chosen due to the surrounding wooden area, which afforded it a degree of secrecy and the house was built with five foot thick concrete walls. Now it has been transformed into a contemporary luxury home, complete with a swimming pool, a stunning atrium and a magnificent glass staircase.
CCTV footage shows the thieves in action at the Shell fuel stop along Ygnacio Valley Road in Walnut Creek. While one man distracts a cashier at the window, another leads a cable from the back of a white pickup to the cash machine. Sparks are caught flying into the air as the large device is dragged across the tarmac.

Alliss, 84, said legislation designed to stop golf clubs discriminating against female members has instead prompted decline in women's membership. Some clubs had previously only allowed female members if they played at restricted times in return for discounted membership fee. But Equality Act 2010, drafted by the previous Labour government, ruled that this was illegal discrimination.

Reading supporter, whose team were 3-0 up at the time, did four front flips on the pitch, landing on his back each time. He is now facing a potential three-year ban for carrying out the stunt. The order, due to be decided on April 30, would stop him going to all Reading's future home and away matches.

Lucy Garrod, 27, was left partially blind in her right eye after bacteria began growing underneath her contact lens, causing an ulcer known as a corneal abrasion. Doctors said the ulcer was growing on the surface of her eye, millimetres away from permanently blinding her. She feared she would not be able to carry on with her photography degree. But she learned to take photographs with her left eye and passed her degree with first class honours.

Footage shows them inquisitively inspecting the piece of sports apparatus and standing tall on their back legs. As the motorized plush bird bounces up and down and pops out an egg, the infant can barely believe her eyes. When the first egg emerges she cries for joy and with the third delivery she lets out a big scream with her arms waving around.

Mrs Craig was meant to return to the UK on March 9, but she only arrived back on March 24 - having spent more than three times what she had planned. Ryanair refused to let her fly home over fears she was an illegal immigrant.

After noticing a foul odour in the yard of his home in Clifton Beach, northern Queensland, Bakvis found a bloated scrub python which contained the remains of the family feline. Bakvis said he had never seen pythons on the property in 15 years of living there.

Research was carried out by scientists at Brown University in Rhode Island. They pitted nine frequent gamers against a control group of nine people who game rarely, if ever. Subjects were shown an on-screen ‘texture’ of either visual or horizontal lines and had to quickly point out - in a fraction of a second - the one area where an anomalous texture appeared. Gamers were shown to be more successful when learning both tasks than non-gamers.

Jack Johnson beat Tommy Burns to win the world heavyweight title in 1908. Johnson's victory caused consternation in America because he was black and a black man had never held sport's greatest prize. His skin was deemed the wrong colour and a great cry went up from white America to find a white challenger — a 'Great White Hope' who could unseat the new champion.

The 5.45 acre estate in San Clemente, California was bought by the former Commander in Chief in 1969. Nixon entertained 17 heads of state at the home, which was built in 1926 and overlooks the Pacific Ocean. Among his guests were Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev and Secretary of State Henry Kissinger. The home is made up of a 'grand pavilion' measuring 9,000 square feet, and boasts several satellite residences for staff.

Alaska Department of Fish and Game Biologist Tom Seaton led 100 wood bison to freedom on a snowmobile. The land mammals were freed from a temporary pen, where they had been kept for just over a week during the transition. They journeyed for a distance of about a mile and crossed the Innoko River before reaching the grass meadows of Lower Innoko, which is surrounded by the Yukon River.

Consumers could soon have to pay goods and services tax (GST) on their movie and music downloads. Treasurer Joe Hockey said the states had agreed to work toward applying the 10 per cent GST to movies and music downloaded from streaming services such as Netflix and Apple. The changes may also affect consumers buying any products for less than $1,000 online from overseas, thus affecting companies such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and eBay. Choice says tech-savvy consumers might be able to avoid the tax by concealing their location through virtual private networks.

Analysts at US intelligence agencies like the CIA, NSA, and National Counterterrorism Center watch graphic videos all day to gain clues about where terrorists are and what they have planned. Intelligence agencies employ special psychiatrists and therapists to help the analysts cope with the 'extraordinary toll' the work can have. Analysts often suffer sensations of sickness, bouts of grief, periods of depression and experience anger.

The Broward State Attorney's Office reported on Thursday that they had already dropped 12 felony cases, 19 criminal misdemeanor cases and one juvenile case involving one or more of the officers. The cases, which include burglary, cocaine possession and aggravated assault with a firearm, are no longer on the police force. All of the four officers committed misconduct involving racist texts 'exchanged among themselves and former police officers', Fort Lauderdale Police Chief Frank Adderley said. The officers sent each other 'racial, sexist and ethically inappropriate' images and other content, including offensive comments against both Hispanics and homosexuals. They also 'criticized their coworkers' grammar, appearance, work ethic and referred to an entire shift as lazy (expletives'
Jia Binhui, 25, cannot afford hospital treatment for leukaemia. He built a human barbecue in his garden in Yunlong County in southwest China's Yunnan Province, which he lies on above a fire below. Claims experts advised him that temperatures higher than 42 degrees Celsius can kill the cancerous cells in his body.

Richie Benaud died peacefully in his sleep surrounded by his wife Daphne and family members. Benaud had been receiving radiation treatment for skin cancer since November when he was admitted to a Sydney hospice on Thursday. A veteran of 63 Test matches, Benaud played a pivotal role in the formation of World Series Cricket in the 1970s and was one of the world's most recognised commentators. Prime Minister Tony Abbott has offered Benaud's family a state funeral.

Video footage shows Blaine Taylor from Aberdeen, Scotland, competing against his older brother, Cody. But as he goes to roll his egg down a grassy hill, he accidentally steps on it with shell and yolk mushed into the ground. Immediately Blaine starts wailing with tears welling up in his eyes.
Arnold Palmer hit the ceremonial opening drive of the 2015 Masters at Augusta National on Thursday morning. The 85-year-old legend, who won seven majors, defied an injury to hit his tee shot. He was joined by Jack Nicklaus and Gary Player as the honorary starters.
Natasha Jonas is the first female boxer to represent Great Britain in an Olympic Games. The Liverpool-born 30-year-old made history when she took on eventual gold medallist Katie Taylor.
Novak Djokovic beat John Isner in straight sets to reach the final of the Miami Open on Friday night. The No 1-seeded Serb will take on Andy Murray in Sunday's final.
Mauricio Pochettino could be the saviour of English football thanks to his faith in homegrown talent. The Argentine has gathered a considerable reputation since arriving in England just over two years ago. Harry Kane, Andros Townsend, Ryan Mason and Kyle Walker all played for England.
Nico Rosberg and Lewis Hamilton visited Mercedes' Brackley base on Thursday. The pair are hoping to find a winning formula for the next race in Shanghai on April 10-12. Mercedes were beaten by Sebastian Vettel at the Malaysian Grand Prix on March 29.
Formula One supremo Bernie Ecclestone has not been able to guarantee the future of the Italian Grand Prix. The German Grand Prix has been axed from the 2015 schedule due to financial problems. Jackie Stewart says there should always be a place for 'essential' races in Germany, Italy, Britain, France and Monaco.
Lewis Hamilton was invited to Nelson Mandela's 90th birthday party in 2008. The Mercedes driver wanted to meet Hollywood actor Will Smith when he stepped on Clinton's foot. The 30-year-old revealed the incident on BT Sport's The Clare Balding Show on Thursday.
Work has started on repairing the roof of the Silverstone motor racing circuit. Part of the 'Wing' - the three-story corporate building at the host venue of Formula One's British Grand Prix - was affected by the winds on Sunday and Monday.
Lewis Hamilton features on the front cover of the May 2015 issue of Men's Health. The Mercedes driver discusses the meaning of his tattoos and the physical demands of F1. Hamilton finished second to Sebastian Vettel at the Malaysian Grand Prix last Sunday.
Jason Robinson has revealed he contemplated committing suicide. The 40-year-old scored in England's 2003 World Cup final win against Australia. Robinson was arrested for affray, assault and criminal damage. He credits then team-mate and Samoa star Va'aiga Tuigamala with turning things around.
Zimbabwe are willing to tour Pakistan for five one-day internationals. Pakistan haven't played a Test nation since the attack on Sri Lanka's bus in Lahore in 2009. Chairman of the Pakistan Cricket Board Shaharyar Khan hopes the tour will go ahead next month.
Tim Sherwood has revealed he is still in touch with Tottenham Hotspur chairman Daniel Levy. Tottenham sacked Sherwood as head coach at the end of last season and brought in Mauricio Pochettino. Sherwood was relieved of his duties and walked out of White Hart Lane with his head held high.
Alex Rodriguez returned to the New York Yankees line-up for the baseball season's opening day. Rodriguez returned from a suspension that spanned all of the 2014 season for admitted to receiving and using performance-enhancing drugs from a Florida clinic.
Yorkshire will be looking to defend their Division One title. Kevin Pietersen will hope his runs help Surrey to promotion from the second tier. Nick Compton has joined Middlesex from Somerset with a point to prove to England selectors.
Burnley drew 0-0 with Tottenham Hotspur at Turf Moor on Sunday afternoon. Burnley defender Michael Duff was pleased with the way his side subdued Kane. The Clarets tried to press high up the pitch as a way of neutralising Kane's threat.
Jordan Henderson toiled as a wing back in Liverpool's defeat against Arsenal. John O'Shea only sprinted 11.9 metres during Sunderland's 1-0 win over Newcastle. Sean Dyche picked an unchanged side for the 16th time this season against Tottenham. Steven Caulker made 20 clearances for QPR against West Brom.
Nedum Onuoha is wanted by Hull City, Everton and West Ham United. The QPR centre-back is one of several players poised to leave if the club go down. The 28-year-old has 15 months left on his contract at Loftus Road.
Harry Kane captained Tottenham for the first time against Burnley on Sunday. The 21-year-old scored on his England debut against Lithuania on March 27 at Wembley. Kane is the youngest captain in the Premier League this season at 21 years and 251 days. Mauricio Pochettino believes Tottenham can catch Manchester City and finish fourth.
Diego de Girolamo is leaving Sheffield United at the end of the season. The Italian Under 20 international is out of contract and has an offer from Juventus also. Benfica have made an enquiry for the forward who is on loan at Northampton Town.
Queens Park Rangers beat West Brom 4-1 at The Hawthorns on Saturday. Bobby Zamora, Charlie Austin and Eduardo Vargas put QPR 3-0 up at half-time. Victor Anichebe scored a consolation goal for Tony Pulis' side in the 58th minute. Joey Barton added a fourth goal in added time to give QPR the win.
Andy King scored his 50th goal for Leicester City against West Ham on Saturday. King says his goal against the Hammers may turn out to be his most important yet. Leicester remain at the foot of the Premier League table and four points from safety.
Neil Taylor is wanted by West Bromwich Albion this summer. Swansea are willing to listen to offers for the 26-year-old left back. Tony Pulis is keen for Taylor to fill in at left back, where he has struggled.
Leicester beat West Ham 2-1 at the King Power Stadium on Saturday. Midfielder Esteban Cambiasso scored the only goal of the game in the 12th minute. Leicester boss Nigel Pearson has praised the 34-year-old's performance.
Daniel Agger has been banned for two games for violent conduct. The Brondby defender elbowed Mattias Jorgensen in the head. The incident happened during the hotly-contested derby against Copenhagen.
James Tomkins hopes to return to action with West Ham before the end of the season. Tomkins dislocated his shoulder in the gym last month and has undergone successful surgery.
Haris Vuckic has thrived at Rangers under new manager Stuart McCall. The 22-year-old admits any possibility of staying at Ibrox beyond the end of this season would be an immensely attractive option. The Slovenian has denied a report on Tyneside stating he had already declared his intention to quit St James Park.
Harry Kane lined up against Etienne Capoue, Nabil Bentaleb, Eric Dier, Roberto Soldado, Danny Rose and Christian Eriksen. Spurs currently stand sixth in the Premier League and it appears they'll be in a straight shoot-out for fifth place with Liverpool.
Ronny Deila admitted that the first six months in charge of Celtic were tough. The Norwegian was unsure whether he was cut out to be the boss of the Bhoys.
Real Madrid beat Rayo Vallecano 2-0 in La Liga on Wednesday. Cristiano Ronaldo was shown a yellow card for diving in the penalty area. The decision means Ronaldo is suspended for the game against Eibar on Saturday. Real Madrid want the yellow card shown to their star forward to be rescinded.
Jeremy Peace is ready to shelve the sale of West Brom if a deal is not in place by July. The West Brom chairman has fielded enquiries from consortia in America, China and Australia. Peace owns 77 per cent and is looking to sell the club for between £150million to £200m.
Manchester United host Manchester City in the Premier League on Sunday. Rio Ferdinand believes United are at their best with Wayne Rooney in attack. United have only lost twice in the league so far this season and are third in the table. Ferdinand praised Van Gaal for moving Rooney further up the pitch.
Glenn Murray has scored a goal on average every 91 minutes this season. Harry Kane and Diego Costa are locked on 19 goals but rank fourth and fifth respectively. Papiss Cisse and Olivier Giroud have had their seasons interrupted by injury and suspension. Frank Lampard has a marginally better ratio than Sergio Aguero.
Peter Quillin faces Limerick's Andy Lee in the WBO middleweight title on April 11. The American has a 71 per cent knockout ratio in his undefeated record. The 31-year-old has been out of the ring for 12 months since his last title defence. Quillin revealed he took a sabbatical to deal with the conflicting emotions of welcoming his first child.
Atletico Madrid beat Cordoba 2-0 in La Liga on Saturday. Antoine Griezmann scored the opener in the fifth minute. Saul Niguez doubled Atletico's lead in the 39th minute.
Alan Pardew believes he is better than many of the Premier League's big-name managers. The Crystal Palace manager has no immediate plans to leave Selhurst Park for a top-of-the-table side.
Billy Joe Saunders and Chris Eubank Jnr were involved in a war of words at a press conference on Thursday. The pair are set to fight at Wembley Arena on May 9 but not against each other. Saunders will have a warm-up 'international contest' ahead of his challenge for the WBO middleweight title mooted for July.
Ander Herrera scored a brace as Manchester United beat Aston Villa 3-0. The 25-year-old has established himself in Louis van Gaal's first team plans after missing out in previous months.

Anthony Joshua stopped Jason Gavern in the third round on Saturday night. Joshua dropped Gavern twice in the second round and twice in third on his way to victory. Joshua was returning from a five-month lay-off after suffering stress fracture in his back.
David Templeton spoke out about his former managers Ally McCoist and Kenny McDowall. Rangers boss Stuart McCall has delivered a sharp rebuke to David Templeton. Former Hearts star Templeton claimed McCall had introduced a brand of coaching and tactical preparation which had been lacking under the previous management.
Dereck Chisora is being lined up for a summer comeback against David Price. 'Del Boy' has not boxed since he was stopped by switch-hitting Tyson Fury at London's ExCeL Arena in November. He has been regrouping and recovering from an eye injury sustained during the 10-round beating.

The South African-based businessman hopes yesterday's decision will now convince the SFA to pass him as 'fit and proper'King won around 85-per-cent shareholder backing to return to the Rangers boardroom last month.

Xavi has managed just five starts for Barcelona in 21 games since the turn of the year. The 35-year-old recently travelled to Qatar to discuss a possible switch to Al Sadd ahead of next season. Xavi assisted Jeremy Mathieu's winning goal against Celta Vigo on Sunday.
Celta Vigo forward Fabian Orellana has been handed a one-match ban by the Spanish football federation. He was shown a straight red card for throwing a lump of grass at Barcelona's Sergio Busquets. The midfielder grabbed his eye after the grass struck him on the back of the neck.
Borussia Dortmund have failed to score in four of their last five league games. Jurgen Klopp's men face Hoffenheim in the DFB Pokal on Tuesday.
Franck Ribery says he turned down a move to Real Madrid in 2009. The French winger says he was told he was as important to Bayern Munich as Lionel Messi is to Barcelona. Real Madrid wanted him after he fell out with then-head coach Louis van Gaal. But he was convinced to stay after being sold on his importance by Bayern's elite.
Antonio Di Natale says Alexis Sanchez is the best strike partner he's ever had. The Arsenal forward spent five years playing alongside him at Serie A side Udinese. Sanchez has scored 20 goals in all competitions during his debut season with the Gunners.
Roma have been ordered to close part of their Stadio Olimpico stadium for their next home game against Atalanta on April 19. A banner displayed during Roma's 1-0 defeat of Napoli caused outcry for insulting the mother of a Napoli fan who was killed in violent clashes between supporters last year. The taunts were aimed at Antonella Leardi whose son Ciro Esposito died after violent clashes following last year's Coppa Italia final in Rome.
Alan Stubbs is among the front-runners for the manager's job at Wigan. Malky Mackay was sacked on Monday after a dismal run of results. Gary Caldwell is expected to be handed the job on a temporary basis.

Ian Poulter has two top 10 finishes at the Masters in his 10 attempts. The Ryder Cup hero has never won a strokeplay event on US soil.

The 28-year-old is theoretically out of contention as an exile abroad, but he invoked the 'exceptional circumstances' clause in the RFU selection policy.
Paul Casey has returned to the PGA Tour to get back into the world's top 50. The former world No 3 says he is desperate to play in the Ryder Cup again. But he is unlikely to rejoin the European Tour in time to earn Ryder Cup points this season.

Harry Redknapp believes Sterling should focus on his football rather than his contract. The former QPR boss insists that Sterling is not ready to move to Real Madrid.

The 21-year-old has 29 club goals under Mauricio Pochettino this season and is the main reason Tottenham have lasted the pace until now.

The pair are credited with guiding some of the brightest young talents at Spurs and helping them break into the first team. The bond is strong even if Sherwood is blocking Ramsey's mobile phone calls.
Brendan Rodgers insists his relationship with Raheem Sterling is as strong as ever. Sterling has never said he wants to leave the club, according to his manager.

Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho says he would sell any player if they did not want to play for the club. Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers insists Sterling will not be sold this summer.

Owen, like Sterling, started his senior career at Liverpool but eventually moved on to Real Madrid. But he says the 20-year-old is not good enough to make the same move to the Spanish capital.

Unbeknownst to the women, those negative remarks and self-body shaming were turned into a script. Dove recruited two undercover actresses to read the script.

Advertising entrepreneur John Singleton is selling his breathtaking beach house on the central coast of New South Wales. The five bedroom abode offers sweeping views of the Pacific Ocean and the adjoining National Park. The property still holds a suburb record of $4.25 from 2007, with the highest sale since then being $2.7 million.

Manchester United sit above Manchester City in the Premier League table for the first time since November 23, 2013. United have only sat above City twice - in the post Sir Alex Ferguson era - having played the same number of games. The last time this had happened United sat sixth on 20 points, one ahead of then ninth-placed City after 11 games during the 2013-14 campaign.

Ibrahimovic has never played in the Premier League and is considered one of the finest strikers of his generation despite his volatile demeanour.

Kevin Pietersen has lashed out at Graham Gooch for commenting on his attempted England comeback. Gooch appeared on BBC Radio Five Live on Sunday morning and took a broadly supportive stance of Pietersen. The 34-year-old re-signed for Surrey in an attempt to stage an unlikely Test return. Pietersen wants to end his England absence that started after the 2013-14 Ashes whitewash.
Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta and Abou Diaby are set to feature for Arsenal Under 21s on Tuesday night. Steve Gatting's young Gunners take on Stoke City at the Emirates Stadium.
Barcelona beat Celta Vigo 1-0 in La Liga on Sunday evening. Jeremy Mathieu scored the only goal of the game in the 73rd minute to put Barcelona ahead. Celta striker Fabian Orellana was shown a straight red card for throwing a lump of grass at Sergio Busquets.
Kevin Pietersen has re-signed for Surrey this summer in an attempt to win an unlikely England recall. Incoming ECB chairman Colin Graves said domestic form would help Pietersen's cause. The 34-year-old has indicated that his campaign will start with a three-day warm-up against Oxford MCCU on April 12.
Diego Costa limped off with a hamstring injury during Chelsea's 2-1 win over Stoke City. Blues boss Jose Mourinho said he would only turn to Costa if absolutely necessary. The £32million striker was required to stop Chelsea squandering the opportunity to open a seven-point advantage over their title rivals.
Manchester City have been limited to a net transfer spend of £49million in the last two transfer windows. Manuel Pellegrini is hoping the restrictions will be lifted at the end of the current season. The reigning Premier League champions have only paid money for Fernando, Willie Caballero, Eliaquim Mangala and Wilfried Bony.
Brittany Lincicome beat Stacy Lewis in a play-off to claim her second ANA Inspiration crown. The 29-year-old eagled the final hole on the par-five 18th to win the tournament in California. Former champion Lewis could still have claimed the win herself when, playing in the final group, had a chance to birdie the last but her effort from 10 feet sneaked past on the low side.
Sean Dyche has impressed in the Premier League with Burnley this season. Former England boss McClaren has been linked with a move to Newcastle at the end of the season.
Darren Bent could still return to Aston Villa in the summer. The 31-year-old is on loan at Derby until the end of the season. Bent has scored nine goals in 13 games for the Rams.
Tim Sherwood and Chris Ramsey know each other inside out. The pair worked together at Tottenham Hotspur with Les Ferdinand. QPR can go above Villa with three points on Tuesday night. The reverse result would take Villa out of the relegation zone.
Liverpool are eight points behind Manchester United in fourth place in the Premier League. Jordan Henderson has urged his side not to give up on their hopes of finishing in the top four. The Reds face Blackburn Rovers in an FA Cup quarter-final replay on Wednesday.
Aston Villa host QPR at Villa Park on Tuesday night in the Premier League. Tim Sherwood admits he does not have the players to grind out results. Victory would move Villa five points clear of the drop zone but they will return to the bottom three if QPR win.
QPR drew 3-3 with Aston Villa in the Premier League on Tuesday night. Chris Ramsey's side remain two points adrift of safety in the relegation zone. Clint Hill scored his first Premier League goal in the draw at Villa Park.
Sean Dyche has been tipped to replace Steve McClaren at Derby. Dyche says he is enjoying life at Turf Moor and is not looking further afield.
Chris Ramsey believes Tim Sherwood will keep Aston Villa in the Premier League. Ramsey and Sherwood worked together at Tottenham. The pair live within 10 minutes of each other.
QPR drew 3-3 with Aston Villa at Villa Park in the Premier League on Saturday. Tony Fernandes was watching the game on his iPhone away from the game. Matt Phillips had given QPR the lead in the first half but Christian Benteke equalised. Charlie Austin looked like he might have scored a late winner for Rangers.

Melissa Wilson and her team-mates are on the brink of making history. On Saturday, at the 161st Oxford-Cambridge Boat Race, the women’s crews will battle the same Thames course as the men. After decades of campaigning and 88 years since the first women to race were jeered by male spectators, they get equal billing.

Oxford University Women's Boat Race team were overcome by choppy waters. Crew members from the Chiswick RNLI station came to the assistance of the Oxford crew and their cox. They were training for the Boat Race which takes place on Saturday, April 11.
Wasps will appeal against the three-week ban handed to Nathan Hughes. Northampton wing George North suffered a third confirmed concussion in four months against Wasps last Friday. Hughes was given the suspension after being found guilty of striking North in the 52-30 defeat.
Nemanja Matic and Cesc Fabregas are one booking away from a two-game ban. The pair could miss games against Arsenal and Manchester United if shown a yellow card. Chelsea face QPR at Loftus Road on Sunday in the Premier League.
Leeds beat Castleford 26-12 in front of a sell-out crowd at the Mend-A-Hose Jungle. Rhinos captain Kevin Sinfield announced he is to switch codes at the end of 2015. Ryan Hall was sent to the sin-bin for the first time in his career in a frenetic opening. Joel Moon and Adam Cuthbertson scored tries for Leeds.
Northampton have ruled George North out of their game against Clermont Auvergne on Saturday. The Wales and Lions wing has been removed from the firing line by his club ahead of the biggest game of their season to date. The 22-year-old was knocked unconscious when struck by Wasps No 8 Nathan Hughes's knee as he was scoring a try at Franklin's Gardens last Friday.
Hull FC beat Widnes 22-8 to make it back-to-back wins for the first time since last June. Lineham scored a treble in a losing cause at Castleford last month but his efforts on Friday night settled a drab contest at the KC Stadium. Jamie Shaul went over late on to make sure of the two competition points for Hull, with tries from Kevin Brown and Patrick Ah Van unable to prevent Widnes from falling to a fifth away defeat out of five.
George North suffered a third confirmed concussion in four months against Wasps last Friday. The Wales and Lions wing will be reassessed at the end of April and could face an even longer spell on the sidelines if specialist consultants are not convinced that he is ready to return to action. Saints medics will monitor his progress throughout the stand-down period.
Huddersfield forward Jacob Fairbank is set for a spell on the sidelines. The 25-year-old was injured in Halifax's victory over Hunslet on Easter Monday.
Jonathan Trott failed twice with the bat during England's warm-up in St Kitts. The batsman looks set to open the batting with Alastair Cook in the first Test against West Indies. England completed four days of low-key, uncompetitive action in Basseterre on Thursday.
Ben Stokes took three wickets for 10 as England dominated St Kitts & Nevis XI. Alastair Cook and Jonathan Trott put on 158 for the first wicket to put England in control. Stokes described Cook as one of the best batsmen in the world after his return to form.
Richie Benaud, 84, who died on Friday, revealed last year that he had skin cancer and was receiving radiation treatment for his skin cancer. The cricket legend said he believed the cancers were caused by playing cricket in the sun without a hat or sunscreen. 'When I was a kid we never ever wore a cap,' Benaud told the Nine Network about growing up in Australia in the 1930s and 40s. 'I recommend to everyone they wear protection on their heads,' he said.
Loic Remy scored the winner in Chelsea's 2-1 victory over Stoke on Saturday. Diego Costa left the game with a hamstring injury and is set for a spell on the sidelines.
Former Olympic gymnast, Louis Smith, MBE, is constantly sharing images of his honed torso with an endless stream of topless selfies on Instagram. The Strictly Come Dancing star shot to fame after winning both a bronze and silver medal at the 2012 London Olympic Games.
Kyle Walker sustained the injury during the 0-0 draw with Burnley on Sunday. The 24-year-old suffered the injury in a collision with Kieran Trippier at Turf Moor. There were fears the England defender may have fractured his foot. Scans have revealed that Walker has not broken his foot and will hopefully return soon.
Cameron Thomas Philp graffitied and spat on the side of a police forensics van in 2013. He pleaded guilty to wilful damage of police property in Brisbane Magistrates Court on Friday. He was fined $300 but avoided a conviction.

Says: ‘I’m a strong, independent woman,’ she says in new interview to promote role as Mulberry’s new muse. Interview follows release of a short film featuring Miss Bonas dancing round an old court house and English country garden in £1,800 dress.
Kevin Pietersen is gearing up for his first county championship action since June 2013. The 34-year-old is determined to restart his Test career after he was sacked in February 2014. Pietersen cancelled his Indian Premier League contract in order to play domestic cricket for Surrey.
Kevin Pietersen believes Michael Vaughan is the right man to lead England Cricket. The former team-mates were England team-mate before Pietersen was axed by the ECB. The 40-year-old has previously kept his distance from a formal role with the ECB, preferring to focus on his burgeoning media profile and business interests.
Arsene Wenger won the Premier League Manager of the Month award in March. It is the 14th time Wenger has won the accolade and he has won it 14 times at Arsenal. The last of Sir Alex Ferguson's 27 awards came in October 2012, not long before he announced his retirement.
Alec Stewart has expressed his interest in becoming the new Director of England Cricket following the sacking of Managing Director Paul Downton. Stewart played in a record 133 Tests for England and is currently director of cricket at Surrey. He has not yet been approached by the ECB but said: ‘When England come calling, you shouldn’t say no’

The Aston Villa manager is keen to get Ramsey on his coaching staff if he leaves in the summer. The pair forged a close bond during their time together at Tottenham.
Francis Coquelin wants to follow in the footsteps of club legend Patrick Vieira. The Frenchman has thrived in the centre of Arsenal's midfield since returning from Charlton. The 23-year-old is determined to prove himself at Arsenal and hold down his place in the starting XI.

Jeanetta Riley, 35, a mother-of-three daughters was killed last July after she brandished a knife at two cops outside of a hospital in Sandpoint on the evening of July 8, 2014. The troubled Native American woman, who was addicted to meth and alcohol, had been taken to the hospital by her husband, Shane, 44, following threats she made to kill herself. She pulled a knife from under the car seat featuring a three-and-a-half-inch blade, and was confronted by police before she was shot and killed. Officers Michael Valenzuela, 27 and Skyler Ziegler, 29 were cleared of any wrongdoing following the incident and the case was closed in November.
Georgina Rojas-Medina, 41, and her common-law husband, Gerardo Tovar, 44, were shot and killed by their 4-year-old daughter just after midnight on Saturday. The couple had been together for 13 years and had two other children, ages 10 and 12.
Children who share iPads in class do much better in early literacy tests than those who don't, researchers claim. Courtney Blackwell, at Northwestern University in the US, found that in tests, kindergarten children who shared iPads in classes over an academic year significantly outscored their peers who were in classes that had no iPads or in which each student had their own device.
Dr Seuss fans flock to Alaska to visit this 12-cabin-high structure that looks like one of his illustrations. The house was built after a forest fire swept the valley clean of trees.
Todd Phillips, a front-outside tire changer for Dayle Coyne Racing, was struck by the car of Francesco Dracone, who had come in on Lap 25 for tires and fuel. Phillips was taken to the infield care center for treatment where he has received stitches for a cut on his leg and has been released.
Four-seater Cessna 172 crash-landed on Autobahn 28 near Hatten, Oldenburg. Three passengers have been taken to a nearby hospital, local police said. One man, believed to have been co-piloting the plane, is in a'serious condition'
Manchester City captain Vincent Kompany has slammed Financial Fair Play regulations. The Premier League champions were last year deemed to have breached regulations, before being fined £50million and ordered to operate with a £49m transfer kitty this season. City are debt-free, mainly thanks to the vast wealth of owner Sheikh Mansour’s heavy personal investment.
Right-handed reliever John Axford was placed on the family medical emergency list by the Colorado Rockies. His son Jameson, 2, was bitten twice by a rattlesnake last month and requires more treatment. Axford said the toes of 2-year-old Jameson 'look fine,' but doctors are trying to improve mobility as they combat infection.

But delegates from the country including Khaled Abdel Aziz stayed in an adjoining hall inside the hotel. A video of the performance has since gone viral online.

Three middle-aged men talked openly about erectile dysfunction and another spoke about his fears about having a kidney transplant.

Poor visibility at the makeshift 800m strip beside the Russian operated Camp Barneo first caused an aborted landing. The experienced pilots were then forced to break harder than usual when a crack appeared on an ice floe near the runway.

Richie Benaud died peacefully in his sleep surrounded by his wife Daphne and family members on Friday. He had been receiving radiation treatment for skin cancer since November when he was admitted to a Sydney hospice on Thursday. Prime Minister Tony Abbott offered his family a state funeral, calling Benaud's death the 'greatest loss for cricket since the loss of Don Bradman'Benaud played a pivotal role in the formation of World Series Cricket in the 1970s and was one of the world's most recognised commentators.
Diane Blankenship, 45, charged with unlawful sexual activity and lewd battery. Allegedly had sex with a 14-year-old boy in the backseat of her car while her friend drove them about town. She has been placed on administrative leave from her role at Dayspring Academy in Tampa, Florida.
Australian artist George Gittoes has just been awarded the Sydney Peace Prize. The 65-year-old was named as the recipient on Saturday in recognition of his 45 years chronicling conflicts around the world. The jury recognised him 'for his courage to witness and confront violence in the war zones of the world' and for 'enlisting the arts to subdue aggression'He will receive the prize at a November ceremony in Sydney.
Orana Wildlife Park is the country’s only open-range zoo. The video was captured by Ekant Veer, 35, an associate professor at the University of Canterbury. The people inside can be seen recording the many lions from their phones, while another holds itself up against the cage and chews on some meat.
Two police officers have sustained injuries after attempting to close down an enormous 1000 person rave in Sydney's East. Police received a number of complaints about a dangerously large party at an abandoned industrial area on McPherson Street in Botany. Most of the partygoers were moved from the scene relatively easily, but a number began to throw glass bottles. A 26-year-old woman was arrested after she allegedly assaulted an officer.
Four men have been caught on CCTV robbing a service station in Tecomba, Melbourne. The men filled a doona cover with $38,000 worth of cigarettes. However they failed to get the large loot in the boot. They decided to drag it alongside the car instead and lost a third of their loot. They are all wanted by Victoria Police for a series of break-ins in the area.
The crash occurred at Moorabin Airport, near Melbourne, shortly before noon on Saturday. It is believed one of the planes had issued a may-day warning and attempted to make an emergency landing when it smashed into the other plane, which was idling on the runway. Ambulance Victoria confirmed three people were injured in the incident, including a man and a woman in their twenties.

She was left with a broken nose, broken toe, and many other bruises and scratches. Victoria Police have released an image of the man they believe to be a suspect.

He believes groups of up to 10 men - aged in their 50s and 60s - are trying to relive the 1980s by arranging fights with rivals prior to games. He said violence at matches has increased recently as older men return to watching their team play in their retirement.

A federal jury found Tsarnaev guilty on Wednesday over the terror attack that killed three people and wounded more than 260. The Jungfrau railway runs from Kleine Scheidegg to Jungraujoch and stands at an elevation of 2061m and 3454m respectively. The video was taken from the point of view of a train driver on the 9km long electrified track.
Monkey snatches banana from woman's hand and begins scoffing it down. Video was filmed in the Thai town of Kanchanaburi.
Steve Harmison is doing a fine job with Ashington AFC. The 36-year-old is a boyhood Newcastle fan and is doing well with the non-league side. Harmison took 226 Test wickets for England between 2002 and 2009.

He clutches a glass of homemade illegal brew in the clip, which also shows a stash of drink bottles, biscuits and crisps on a window ledge, before it was shared with friends on WhatsApp. Prison officers reportedly turned a blind eye to the partying, which happened in the run up to Christmas in December last year.

Dave Tyler, 72, built his own observatory in his back garden in High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire in 1977 and now uses powerful telescopes to observe and photograph the solar system. The amateur snapper is able to capture sunspots, solar prominences, coronal loops and solar flares.
Brendan Rodgers insists there is no crisis at Liverpool despite defeats by Manchester United and Arsenal. Reds boss has denied suggestions that a training-ground meeting on Sunday was designed to quell dissent among his players. Wednesday's FA Cup quarter-final replay at Blackburn represents Liverpool's best chance of making progress this season.

Men aged 65 and over are ten times more likely to be diagnosed with malignant melanoma than those of their parents’ generation, Cancer Research UK research shows. Around 5,700 pensioners are now diagnosed with melanoma each year in the UK compared with just 600 a year four decades ago.

Linesman Ivan Nunez caught a replay of the incident on a nearby cameraman's monitor. Velez manager Miguel Angel Russo said: 'Delfino has every right to change his decision. But by his own decision, not off the television'

The club's vice-captain wants to stay at Anfield but he is approaching the final year of his current deal. An improved offer worth £5.2million-per-year will be enough for Henderson to stay, according to Sportsmail.
Manchester City have shelled out for six coaches to transport 3,000 fans to Selhurst Park. The move was made after TV scheduling for the 8pm kick-off made it virtually impossible for supporters to return home by either train or plane on the same night.

Ben Cousins handed himself in to police on Thursday morning after failing to make a court appearance over traffic charges. The former AFL star was charged with reckless driving, failing to stop and refusing a breath test. He was arrested on March 11 after allegedly leading police on a low speed chase from Bicton to Mosman Park. Cousins was due to appear in court on Wednesday morning but failed to show up. His lawyer claimed the former West Coast Eagles captain had conflicting medical appointments. Magistrate Steven Malley told Cousins his decision not to front up was the wrong one.

The 43-year-old was told of the decision during a brief meeting with new chairman David Sharpe. Gary Caldwell is expected to be handed the job on a temporary basis.

ISIS fighters can be seen hammering and drilling away at sculptures and stone slabs believed to be some 3,000 years old in the ruins of Nimrud, located near the Islamic State-controlled city of Mosul.

Nik Wallenda, 36, said Monday at a New York City news conference that the Orlando Eye will be moving when he attempts his feat April 29. The Orlando Eye, part of a new entertainment complex, will offer views of central Florida from inside 30 enclosed, air-conditioned glass capsules when it opens to the public on May 4. Wallenda previously walked atop a Ferris wheel in Santa Cruz, California, but he said the size of the much larger Orlando wheel sets this stunt apart.
Seven baby foxes were discovered in a cardboard box in a car park in Pennsylvania. They were discovered by a woman who noticed the box next to a clothing donation bin. The cubs were taken to the Pocono Wildlife Rehabilitation and Educational Center in Stroudsbury, where they are now being cared for.

Milan were back level on 74 minutes when Nigel de Jong's spectacular effort was headed straight for keeper Emiliano Viviano but found the back of the net off Alfred Duncan's leg.

If found guilty, Luna faces a maximum sentence of life in jail without the prospect of release. The trial is expected to last between seven and 10 days.

The group of friends then reportedly went on a shopping spree after the mass giveaway. Police recovered $7,000 of the man's savings, as well as some of the items bought with it.

This practice of 'invisible tax' is not only found almost everywhere, but it is entirely legal in almost every state in the US.

Celebrity chef Matt Kemp's anger management issues cost him his first marriage and his business. Kemp was so enraged he unleashed an expletive-ridden tirade on his then-wife Lela Radojkovic, who was carrying their first child, while filming at Sydney's Restaurant Balzac in 2004. The 44-year-old said he would work himself into a 'frenzy' because of his uncontrollable rage.
A 75-year-old man was playing golf at the Palmer Sea Reef Golf Course at Port Douglas in Far North Queensland on Monday when he was bitten on the leg by a crocodile. The man drove himself back to the clubhouse in a buggy after the 1.2 metre reptile 'nipped' him. He received a deep laceration to his shin and puncture wounds to his calf. Palmer United Party leader Clive Palmer took to his Twitter account to send his well wishes to the man.

When they sought help from the principal and Clatskanie District police chief, they were told they would be charged. All three girls have subsequently moved to new schools.

Eric Harris, 44, was allegedly caught trying to buy drugs and a gun from cops in Tulsa, Oklahoma, on April 2. Deputies chased after Harris, first by car then on foot, in nearby parking lot. Once they catch up to Harris, they tackle him to the ground and order him to lie on his stomach. Robert Bates, 73, then yells, 'Taser! Taser!' - but takes out his service weapon and pulls the trigger. After firing one round into Harris, Bates drops his gun from the recoil and says in shock: 'Oh, I shot him! I'm sorry'Harris then starts yelping on the ground, while pleading for help.

Stewards threw out the group who were said to be attempting to taunt home supporters by making airplane wings in a sick reference to the 1958 tragedy. 23 people perished after a plane carrying Matt Busby's talented young side crashed during a take-off attempt from Munich.

Michael Owen claims Raheem Sterling is a better player than Mesut Ozil. The former Liverpool forward made the claim before Arsenal's 4-1 win against Liverpool. Owen believes there should not be a debate about whether Sterling is more talented.
Bayern Munich beat Borussia Dortmund 1-0 at the Signal Iduna Park on Saturday. Robert Lewandowski scored the winner on his first visit back to the club he left on a free transfer last summer. Lewandowski spent four years at Dortmund, leading them to back-to-back league titles during that period.
Mateo Musacchio fractured his fibula and dislocated his left ankle during his side's 1-1 draw at Getafe in the Primera Division on Sunday. The 24-year-old underwent successful surgery hours later in Madrid. Santi Cazorla tweeted: 'A lot of best wishes to my friend Mateo, I hope it's not too serious'
Bayern Munich face Bayer Leverkusen in German Cup quarter-final on Wednesday. Bastian Schweinsteiger picked up an ankle injury in their 1-0 win over Borussia Dortmund on Saturday. Midfielder missed the opening four months of the season with a knee injury. Bayern are already without top scorer Arjen Robben, David Alaba, Holger Badstuber and Franck Ribery.
Bayern Munich travel to Bayer Leverkusen in the German Cup quarter-final. The Bavarians are through to the Champions League last eight where they face Porto later this month.
Manuel Pellegrini says Manchester City's academy players are not ready for the first team. Premier League regulations require clubs to carry at least eight homegrown players. City's current group of home-grown players will be reduced in the summer when Frank Lampard departs. Everton's Ross Barkley and Arsenal's Jack Wilshere have also been linked with a move.
Wigan drew 2-2 with Fulham at Craven Cottage on Friday night. Gary Caldwell admitted his first taste of management was 'crazy' following Wigan's draw. Caldwell replaced Malky Mackay on Wednesday and is the youngest manager in the league.
Gary Hooper came off the bench to snatch a dramatic stoppage-time winner to keep Norwich City on track for automatic promotion in the Sky Bet Championship. Graham Dorrans gave the Canaries an early lead as his right-footed free-kick deflected off Josh Vela into the net. Adam Le Fondre looked to have rescued a point and extended Bolton's unbeaten run to four games.
Manchester United beat Manchester City 4-2 in the Manchester derby at Old Trafford on Sunday. Louis van Gaal's side are now four points clear of their arch rivals in fourth place in the Premier League. Gary Neville believes United are getting closer to being 'the real deal'
England beat South Africa 21-14 in the final of the Tokyo Sevens. Phil Burgess, Charlie Hayter and Tom Mitchell scored the tries in the decider. It is England's first title since February 2013 and puts them fourth in the series.
Tracey Neville is Phil Neville's twin and sister to Gary Neville. She is the head coach of England's netball team at this summer's World Cup in Australia. Neville has performed impressively as the boss at Manchester Thunder. She was parachuted into the top job on an interim basis last month.
Wing's Chinese restaurant is in Manchester city centre, and attracts a certain type of clientele. The restaurant's owner – Mr Wing himself – is never afraid to push for as much publicity as possible, and is often snapped in the photographs with the city's celebrities at his five-star venue. Wing's has been'recommended in the Mitchelin Guide for the past eight years', according to their website.
Arsenal beat Liverpool 3-0 in the Premier League on Saturday. Arsene Wenger's side have won seven of their last eight games in all competitions.

Gers suffered the first defeat of Stuart McCall's six-game reign on Thursday night as they slumped 3-0 at Queen of the South. Rangers had recently secured victories over Scottish Championship rivals Hearts and Hibernian.
