Novak Djokovic lost the Miami Open final to Andy Murray on Sunday. The Serbian player shouted at his backroom team after losing the second set. He grabbed a towel from a ball boy who was caught up in the crossfire during the confrontation. The ball boy seemed startled by the loud exchange and apologised to his parents.
Sepp Blatter has received the full backing of African football's president Issa Hayatou. Blatter is seeking a fifth term in office to extend a reign that began in 1998. FIFA vice president Prince Ali bin al-Hussein, Michael van Praag and Luis Figo are standing against him.
Atletico Madrid beat Real Sociedad 2-0 at the Vicente Calderon on Tuesday night. Mikel Gonzalez and Antoine Griezmann scored either side of half-time to put Atletico ahead. David Moyes' side had not conceded a single goal in their previous four games.
Cristiano Ronaldo scored his 300th goal for Real Madrid in the 2-0 win at Rayo Vallecano. The 30-year-old becomes only the third player in Madrid's history to achieve the feat. Ronaldo has netted 161 of his goals in the Santiago Bernabeu and 61 between minutes 76 and 90.
Gary Mabbutt was rushed to hospital after waking up at 1am to find leg had gone cold. Ex-Tottenham and England star's diabetes had led to a clogged artery in the limb. Doctors warned him it was 'touch and go' on whether the leg would have to be amputated. Surgeons needed to replace main artery in his left leg with a vein and needed 112 staples.
Jennifer works out three times a week with her long-term trainer, Mandy Ingber. Sessions include 20-25 minutes of spinning, followed by 45 minutes of yoga.

The pair started a Twitter campaign to get the singer to perform at the reception. But he secretly replied to the pair saying 'let's do this' - on condition they kept it secret.

She said deputies and state workers from Child Protective Services were present to remove her 18-month-old son. Robinson spent six days in jail after being charged with resisting arrest, interfering with child custody and assaulting an officer.

Hall scored with his first touch just moments after coming off the bench to keep the Pilgrims on course for a place in the Conference North play-offs. Lewis, his on-off girlfriend in the popular ITV show, was watching on at York Street.

Guests wishing them well in his hometown will be largely a gathering of close family and friends. Murray has said: 'I don't have any celebrity friends so it wasn't something that was planned'
Dozhd TV, an independent network, fears the video may fall foul of Putin's 'gay propaganda' laws. If they had aired it without the warning, the company could have faced a fine of £13,200 under 2013's gay propaganda laws. But Dozhd, an opposition network, said it acted before being instructed by the Russian government.
Cara Lee-Fanus was rushed to St Peter's Hospital in Chertsey, Surrey. Doctors discovered bruises all over her body and burn marks on her head. Her mother, Kirsty Lee, 25, and her then boyfriend Alistair Wayne Bowen, 35, appeared at Guildford Magistrates' Court today. The pair were jointly charged with causing or allowing the death of a child and causing serious physical harm to a child.
Richie Benaud was laid to rest at a small private funeral in Sydney's eastern suburbs on Wednesday. The cricketing legend was farewelled by a group of just twelve people at a secret ceremony organised by his wife, Daphne. The 84-year-old former Test captain and internationally renowned cricket commentator wished for a small, dignified ceremony attended only by immediate family. Prime Minister Tony Abbott made the offer of a state funeral, which Mrs Benaud politely declined.

The 44-year-old slipped and fell from Hassans Fall lookout at Lithgow on Tuesday afternoon. She was bushwalking with a male friend and her two children, aged 12 and 13, when she dropped her phone at the lookout, which is almost 1,100 metres above sea level. She is believed to have suffered serious head, spinal and chest injuries when she plunged 30 metres. It took two hours for police, paramedics and the Lithgow Volunteer Rescue Squad to rescue her.
Rolando Aarons may have played his last game this season. The 19-year-old was in contention to play for the club's under-21s against Derby on Wednesday. It is understood he has succumbed to injury once again.
Sally and Stephen Morley are one of some 1,500 couples in Britain who have had babies using EmbryoScope technology. The technology allows medics and parents to watch the cell dividing. It also allows experts to select the best embryos based on how they form. This narrows a mother’s chance of miscarrying.
Barcelona face Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League on Wednesday. Luis Enrique has played down Neymar's angry reaction to being substituted against Sevilla. Neymar scored a superb free kick to make it 2-0 to Barca after Lionel Messi's opener.

He was arrested at his Watsons Bay home - in Sydney's east - on the weekend for allegedly assaulting his girlfriend. Bouris, 33, is best known as the son of Wizard Home Loans founder Mark Bouris and has appeared as an advisor on The Apprentice. He is the hotelier of Morgans Boutique Hotel in Darlinghurst after beginning his career at the company his father started.
In a survey conducted by Direct Line, adults in the UK were questioned on what common events make them feel stressed. Not being able to sleep, losing your keys, and being stuck in traffic ranked as the top three emergencies that Brits find most straining. Sleepless night was the top occurrence, with almost half (46%) of Brits citing that this causes anxiety.

Brendan Rodgers has insisted that Sterling will not be sold this summer, even if he fails to agree a new long-term contract at Anfield.

Dominic Solanke doubled the Blues' lead in the second half to make it 3-1. Jeremie Boga and Ola Aina completed the scoring for the Blues.

The 31-year-old has scored seven goals and set up one more in 22 Premier League appearances this term for Manchester City. Inter also working on new deals for Mauro Icardi and Mateo Kovacic.

Chelsea and Manchester City are both willing to pay the clause for Gaya. Gaya is a key player for Valencia, having played 27 league matches this season.
Lauren Hill, 19, was diagnosed with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) shortly after her 18th birthday. She played for Mount St. Joseph's women's basketball team in Ohio and raised $1.5m for cancer research. But as her condition worsened, she became an honorary coach and moved to Cincinnati Children's Hospital. As news of her death became public, thousands of people took to social media to pay their respects. LeBron James, 30, posted an emotional farewell letter to Lauren via Twitter on Friday. He praised her for her 'leadership, courage, power, leadership, etc etc!' and'strength'The Cleveland Cavaliers player signed off the letter - which was posted to his Twitter page - 'Sincerely, LeBron James'
National Bar Association is calling for Officer Clarence Habersham, 37, to be arrested for falsifying a report about the actions of Michael Slager, 33, during the death of Walter Scott. Call comes after Slager is thought to have falsified reports on the circumstances that led to Scott's death. Scott, 50, a Coast Guard veteran, was pulled over for a broken tail light last Saturday by Slager who shot him five times in the back as he ran away.
Pop star, 41, wanted to build a two-storey extension under the garden and glass studio at the top of his house. Led Zeppelin guitarist Jimmy Page, who lives next door, was upset that building work in Williams' garden would cause disruption to his property, built in the 1870s by Victorian architect William Bruges. Williams responded by withdrawing the blueprints but has now returned with a fresh set of plans.

Hamburg are the only club with a perfect Bundesliga record, having played every season in the top division since 1963.

Hibernian stand to make £1m from anticipated sell-out home gates against Rangers and the 11th place club in the Premiership - currently Motherwell. Under SPFL rules, play-off sides must hand over 50 per cent of their profits for distribution among lower league clubs within seven days. Hibs chairman Rod Petrie has garnered support from Hearts and Motherwell for a resolution to slash the profits levied from play-offs finalists from 50 to 25 per cent. The issue will go to the vote at the SPFL AGM next Thursday.

Suma, a 36-year-old orangutan, suffers from arthritis. She was first diagnosed with the painful condition in 2013 after keepers noticed some stiffness in her movements. Doctors had to anaesthetise Suma in order to check how her condition has progressed over the past two years. X-rays were taken in areas where the ape has arthritis, her hips and ankles.

Quinn Patrick was on a fishing trip with his dad at Snow Lake, Indiana when the pair caught a Bowfin. The Bowfin propels itself from the ground and slaps the youngster straight in the face with its large tail. Bowfin are native to North America and are commonly found in east America, south Ontario and Quebec.
The Curl-crested Jay is native to South America and resides at the Criadouro Onca Pintada breeding centre in Brazil. The bird is known to be a good mimic of other birds and man-made sounds. Videoed behind a fence, the bird initially makes a sinister noise like a distorted voice before creating an almost digital sound.

A professor in New York invited her 11-year-old autistic son to one of her classes, during which he got up on a chair and drew the world map from memory. The world map was highly accurate and included details such as political borders and tiny coastal islands.

The Blues have won three Premier Leagues, four FA Cups, three League Cups, one Europa League and one Champions League.
UEFA have ruled that the final 18 seconds of England Women's U19 European Championships qualifier against Norway will be replayed after a refereeing mistake. The Elite Round Group 4 qualifier will be restarted at 9:45pm at Seaview stadium in Belfast on Thursday with the match resuming with England retaking a penalty in the 96th minute at 2-1 down. England will qualify for the European Championships if the penalty is scored and the match is drawn 2-2.
Strong storms rumbled through the Southern Plains early on Thursday, missing major population centers but offering a preview of bad weather that could hit Chicago, Detroit and other big cities in the Midwest later in the day. Hail of up to 4 inches in diameter smashed buildings and cars and high winds tore off roofs and downed trees, as wild weather hit 12 states. The storm system, which stretches from Texas up to the Great Lakes and down to North Carolina, has the potential to be the biggest severe weather event so far this spring.

Supporters are threatening to boycott the next home match against Spurs in protest at Mike Ashley's running of the club and perceived lack of ambition. The Potters' current playing surface is the joint smallest in the Premier League - along with QPR's Loftus Road and Tottenham's White Hart Lane. The Premier League wish to standardise pitch sizes at 105m x 68m.

Richie Benaud has died in a Sydney hospice surrounded by his wife Daphne and family. He had been receiving radiation treatment for skin cancer since November when he was admitted. Benaud played a pivotal role in the formation of World Series Cricket in the 1970s and was one of the world's most recognised commentators. He was the mainstay in Australian cricket television commentary until the past two summers - a car accident in 2013 sidelined him before he announced in November last year he had skin cancer.

Lauren Hill was diagnosed with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma shortly after her 18th birthday. Doctors told her she wouldn't make it past December. She played four games with her team at Mount St. Joseph University in Cincinnati and raised more than $1.5 million for research into the cancer. But as her condition worsened, she became an honorary coach and earlier this year, she moved to Cincinnati Children's Hospital, where she passed away on Friday morning.

He has pleaded not guilty to weapons charges in Louisiana and is awaiting extradition to California. He sent a letter to reporter Molly Hennessey-Fiske, a reporter for the Los Angeles Times who has been covering proceedings against Durst after his mid-March arrest in Louisiana. The letter states that Durst'said nothing about charges, crimes or trials' but rambles on about Durst's thoughts on life in southern California.

Christian Benteke believes it would be risky to think Aston Villa can be safe from relegation. The Belgian striker has scored eight goals in six games for Tim Sherwood's side. Aston Villa face Liverpool in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley on Saturday.
Branislav Ivanovic was struck on the head by a cigarette lighter thrown from a section of home supporters at Loftus Road. QPR are reviewing CCTV footage and have promised to ban those involved.
Jamie Vardy scored an injury-time winner as Leicester beat West Brom 3-2 at The Hawthorns. Darren Fletcher opened the scoring for the Baggies after just eight minutes. David Nugent equalised for the Foxes in the 80th minute with a header. Robert Huth put Leicester back on level terms before Vardy's winner.
Leicester City beat West Brom 3-2 on Saturday to boost their Premier League survival bid. Robert Huth and Jamie Vardy scored late goals for the Foxes at The Hawthorns. Nigel Pearson believes his side's fate is still firmly in their own hands.
Jamie Vardy scored an injury-time winner against West Brom. Darren Fletcher and Craig Gardner scored for the Baggies. Robert Huth equalised for the Foxes in the first minute of injury time.
Sunderland are 15th on 29 points with seven games remaining in the Premier League. Aston Villa are 16th with Christian Benteke scoring a hat-trick in a 3-3 draw against Queens Park Rangers on Tuesday. Hull are 17th on 28 points and sit above the relegation zone on goal difference. Crystal Palace are isolated on that list as a team without major incentive. Burnley have been dealt a reasonable hand but can they capitalise? Have QPR improved enough away from home to take any confidence to Leicester?
Chris Ramsey watched his side hold off Chelsea for 88 minutes at Loftus Road. QPR boss then witnessed Cesc Fabregas score a late winner in the 88th minute. Ramsey crouched down on the touchline to collect his thoughts after the goal.
Dick Advocaat has refused to rule out staying at Sunderland beyond the end of this season. The 67-year-old has signed a nine-game deal with the Black Cats and celebrated his first home match with a 1-0 victory over North-East rivals Newcastle last week. Sunderland are three points clear of the bottom three in the Premier League.
Carlton Cole's contract expires at the end of the season. The 31-year-old is unsure if he will be offered a new deal. West Ham striker says he has not spoken to Sam Allardyce about his future.
Tottenham will play in the 2015 AT&T MLS All Stars game on July 29. The annual showpiece will take place at Dick's Sporting Goods Park, the home of the Colorado Rapids. Tottenham return to the US after a three-match tour last summer.
Cheikhou Kouyate has warned West Ham must be ready to face champions Manchester City on Sunday. Manuel Pellegrini's side have lost four of their last six Premier League games, including 4-2 at Manchester United last week. West Ham have failed to find consistency in the second half of the season to drop out of contention for the European places.
Lionel Messi wants Celtic to play in the Champions League next season. Barcelona lost 2-1 on aggregate to Slovenian outfit Maribor in the play-off round in August. Messi has played at Celtic Park three times in Europe during his career.
Marko Arnautovic scored a 95th minute equaliser for Stoke City. Aaron Cresswell had given the home side an early lead at Upton Park. West Ham manager Sam Allardyce admits his side are suffering from a psychological problem.
Former West Brom striker Jeff Astle died aged 59 in 2002 from 'industrial disease' linked to repetitive head injuries sustained playing football. The FA and PFA promised a 10-year study to investigate the connection between head injuries and early on-set dementia after a coroner found Astle’s brain'resembled that of a boxer's'A Mail on Sunday investigation last year revealed the research was never carried out. Greg Dyke has vowed there will be no repeat of the FA's failure to deliver potentially life-saving research.
Daniel Wass has been watched by Chelsea, Liverpool and Newcastle. Schalke and Inter Milan have also shown interest in the 25-year-old.
Rangers' final-day clash with Hearts has been moved back to Saturday, May 2. The Scottish Professional Football League made the decision after Sky decided to screen the match live. All five Championship matches that weekend will now kick-off simultaneously at 12.15pm. The Hearts v Rangers match will be televised live on Sky Sports.
Celtic face nearest rivals Aberdeen at Pittodrie on Sunday, May 10. Parkhead side have two Friday night fixtures against Dundee and St Johnstone. Ronny Deila's side will not play a Saturday league tie this season.

After the game, Real Madrid defender was asked by the Spanish media if he had bitten the Atletico Madrid striker. The Real player denied the claims, saying: 'There is no controversy, no bite, no nothing'Atletico Madrid travel to Galicia to face Deportivo this weekend in La Liga.

Barcelona have reached the landmark in 202 Champions League matches since 1992. Lionel Messi is joint-most goalscorer in the competition with Cristiano Ronaldo.

The England international is expected to meet Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers on Thursday. He will be reminded of his professional responsibilities and warned about the consequences of taking a drug that has been called 'hippy crack'
Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break cycling's hour record on June 7. The four-time Olympic champion will race at the Lee Valley VeloPark in London's Olympic Velodrome. Wiggins finished his Team Sky career in the Paris-Roubaix one-day race on Sunday. The current Hour record is 52.491km, set by Rohan Dennis in February.
Matt Prior's ONE Pro Cycling team has been confirmed in the list of entrants for the first Tour de Yorkshire. The inaugural event will run over three stages starting in Bridlington on May 1.
George Bailey will join Sussex for the second half of their NatWest T20 Blast campaign. Bailey will take over from Sri Lanka great Mahela Jayawardene, who will be Sussex's overseas player for their first seven Blast group fixtures. Bailey has captained his country in both limited-overs formats.

Sevilla equalised in the second half through Ivan Banega and Kevin Gameiro. Barcelona are now two points behind Real Madrid at the top of La Liga.

Murray was playing in only his second Grand Slam tournament, while Sears was travelling with her tennis coach father Nigel. The pair got back together in 2010 following a brief split and got engaged last November.

Captain Carl Hayman admits his side 'have a lot of work to do' to secure third consecutive title. No side has ever won three European titles on the trot, though Leicester and Munster have previously registered back-to-back triumphs.

He applied for citizenship after receiving funding from Moldovan billionaire Igor Iuzefovici and has now received his passport from the small eastern European state.

Hughes was sent off and then banned for three weeks after the incident at Franklin's Gardens. North was left unconscious by the clash; a third blow to the head in the space of two months.

Family and friends, along with his then girlfriend Sarah Harper, broke down as they listened to the frantic seven-minute 911 emergency call made by witnesses who tried to save Lane's life. Luna's lawyer, Jim Berry, made a shock admission that his client had fired the bullet that killed Lane but added the teen was'reckless' and was only trying to'scare the jogger'

She is in her 70s with an endearing laugh and a royal blue scarf she has knitted especially for Saturday's FA Cup semi-final against Arsenal at Wembley. Lady Sasima is a super-rich Harvard Business School graduate who became the first female on the Thai Airways board. She believes the incident was provoked by the political activities of her daughter and son-in-law. 'There's no use having security. If someone really wants to kill me, they can kill me any time,' she says.

Philippe Coutinho joined Liverpool from Inter Milan for £8.5m in 2013. Coutinho has been nominated for the PFA Player of the Year award this term. Inter sporting director Piero Ausilio has admitted he is'sad' by the club's decision to sell Coutinho.
Luke Shaw thought he had done OK against Arsenal in the FA Cup last month. Louis van Gaal substituted the £28million defender, telling him he was not fit enough to play for United. He has not played since and was withdrawn from the England squad for games against Lithuania and Italy because of question marks over his fitness.
Newcastle United have won just two games under John Carver since Alan Pardew's sacking. Carver says he's enjoying his role at St James' Park and believes he's getting the best out of his players. Newcastle have lost their last five Premier League games and are on 35 points.
Chris Zebroski has been jailed for four years and four months for four charges of robbery, attempted robbery and assault. The 28-year-old admitted four charges relating to two incidents at Swindon Crown Court. Former Cheltenham, Bristol Rovers and Millwall striker has been sacked by Newport County.
Wales climbed to 22, their highest-ever position in football's world order, in the April rankings to move within eight places of England. Chris Coleman's side are unbeaten in Euro 2016 qualifying and would be within touching distance of the finals in France if they beat Belgium in June.
Leeds beat St Helens 41-16 to go six points clear at the top of Super League. Ash Handley scored a hat-trick of tries in the win over the reigning champions. The 19-year-old winger has scored six tries in just six Super League appearances.
Mesut Ozil is playing his best football since joining Arsenal in the summer of 2013. The German star says he is now back to his best since returning to fitness in January. Ozil was a key player in Germany's World Cup win over the summer.
Ramiul Sheikh, 50, was violently knocked to the ground after desperately trying to outrun the animal in the Murshidabad district of the country. Footage was captured by frightened onlooker, Sushovon Das on Tuesday when a herd of elephants invaded.
Piper PA-31 was trying to land at Fort Lauderdale Executive Airport on Sunday. Pilot declared an emergency, but the plane crashed into a wooded area close to the runway. The cause of the crash is not yet known, and the victims have not been named.
Rademenes is the resident feline nurse at an animal shelter in Bydgoszcz, northern Poland. The green-eyed moggy was rescued by the shelter in October after he contracted an inflamed respiratory tract infection. Rademenes was left at the shelter because his owner thought he was too unwell to be saved.
Video shows ex-trainer John Hargrove using the N-word seven times while talking on the phone with a female friend. In the five-minute video he discusses an incident in which five black men allegedly threw a rock at the woman speaking on the other line that she said hit the back of her head. SeaWorld spokesman Fred Jacobs said the company was given the video by an 'internal whistle-blower' last weekend and that his employment would have been terminated 'immediately' if they had known 'he engaged in this kind of behavior'
Author Martin Fletcher claims the devastating fire was not an accident. Heginbotham was linked to eight other fires before the Valley Parade blaze that killed 56. West Yorkshire Police said they would review any fresh evidence surrounding the tragedy.
The fire began around 11:30 a.m. Sunday on Tupper Street in downtown Buffalo. Police evacuated two buildings as smoke came out of manholes. A Buffalo Fire Department official told WGRZ the second of three explosions sent one of the manhole covers 200 to 300 feet into the air.
The video maker holds two stacked cups up to the camera and rotates through the various hairstyles. He then stacks a third cup, which has a number of outfits drawn onto it, including a jacket, a t-shirt and a bikini. The filmmaker claims to have been influenced by Japanese comics.
The jury that sentenced Aaron Hernandez to life in prison on Wednesday want the world to know that they gave the ex-New England Patriots star a fair trial. The seven women and five men who voted to find the 25-year-old guilty of murder this week say it was a heart-wrenching decision, but one they made in confidence. On Thursday, the jury and alternate jurors say down with CNN's Anderson Cooper to talk about the trial that has consumed their lives for the past three months. Only one juror, Rosalie Oliver, didn't know of the tight end who had a $40million contract with the local NFL team.
Brian the lar gibbon, who is 50-years-old, was videoed by Amanda Dorman from South Lanarkshire, Scotland. The video was shared over 130,000 times before The Lad Bible page picked it up.
Gemma the pit bull was filmed at home in California being fed some treats. But in a bid to trick her, her owner throws a broccoli spear into the mix. Immediately the canine pulls a look of disgust as she chomps on the vegetable.
Dullel Kassab fled to Raqqa in Syria with her children last year. The children's paternal grandparents say they are worried Kassab, 28, is 'brainwashing' the children, after their father was killed near the Syria-Turkey border. Kassab's Twitter paints a picture of their life in the city where the children cannot go to school and airstrikes hit blocks away from their apartment. The 28-year-old has a new husband, as the Islamic State does not permit unmarried foreign women to stay in Raqqa.
Sculpture depicts Yu The Great, the founder of China's first Xia Dynasty in 2070 BC, meeting his wife. The bronze tells the story of how the leader met his wife, after the couple were supposedly brought together by a mythical nine-tailed fox. Over the years tourists have kept touching Yu's hand, the fox's back, and his wife's exposed breast - leading to them becoming worn.
Kristina Patrick from Alaska filmed her German Shepherd Pakak performing a very skillful trick. Video footage shows the pup lying on her back with a tennis ball neatly clutched between her front paws. She then proceeds to lift it into the air being careful not to drop it.
Piermayr is a free agent and had been playing for Colorado Rapids. The 25-year-old had a spell with Inverness Caledonian Thistle in 2011.
Jessica Ennis-Hill won heptathlon gold at the London 2012 Olympics. The 29-year-old has not competed since 2013 as she took time off to become a mother.
Aaron Ramsey has scored 25 goals for Arsenal since the start of last season. The Welshman has dedicated his last two goals to his late Gran Eileen who passed away a few weeks ago. Ramsey took time out from preparations for today's FA Cup semi-final against Reading.
Stains the dog had its coat trimmed to resemble a lion when its owners sent it to the groomers to get a trim. Stains is a sheep-herding breed and his thick coat, which is best suited for colder climates, had become uncomfortable in the recent sunshine. Its owner decided that what the dog really needed was a new look and opted to have half its coat shaved.
Manchester City are interested in signing Evangelos Patoulidis. The 14-year-old is regarded as one of the best talents to emerge from Anderlecht's youth set-up. The Belgian starlet rejected a move to Barcelona's La Masia academy when he was 12.
Manchester City will resist any attempt by Valencia to pull out of a £24million deal for Alvaro Negredo. Negredo joined Valencia on loan last summer and the agreement included a compulsory purchase clause that triggered a permanent move to the Mestalla as soon as he played for the La Liga club. There had been suggestions that Valencia were trying to finance a deal for Radamel Falcao.
The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid of the midas and the redhead. It was first bred in Taiwan around 1986. The man massages and plays with his fish for at least 15 minutes each day.
Aaron Galloway, 23, was on a half-term city break to Prague when he left his camera on the seat as he landed in the Czech Republic capital. He went on eBay to find a replacement and was astonished to see his own camera for sale with just 35 minutes left on the auction. He messaged seller Fernando Miguel Andrade Viseu, who confessed to the theft - and admitted being a Ryanair flight attendant. The Portuguese-born thief begged Aaron not to tell police and said he would lose his job.
Mauricio Pochettino believes Europa League participation could hamper Tottenham's top four hopes. Spurs have failed to qualify for next season's Champions League. But the club could yet secure another season in Europe's elite club competition. Tottenham face Newcastle United in the Premier League on Sunday.
Rory McIlroy and Tiger Woods were paired together for the final round of the Masters. Jordan Spieth won the coveted green jacket for the first time in his career with a four-shot victory.
Angelique Kerber beat Madison Keys 6-2, 4-6, 7-5 in the Family Circle Cup final. The German won six of the last seven games to claim the title. This was Kerber's fourth WTA title and first since Linz in 2013.
Maria Sharapova has pulled out of Russia's Fed Cup semi-final against Germany with a leg injury. Venus Williams has withdrawn from USA's World Group play-off against Italy due to personal reasons.
Jon Flanagan will speak to Liverpool about a new contract at the end of the season. The 22-year-old's deal is set to expire this summer. Flanagan impressed so much last season that he forced his way into the England squad. Brendan Rodgers is a big fan of the Liverpudlian and wants to keep him at the club.
Sania Mirza and Martina Hingis beat Casey Dellacqua and Darija Jurak 6-0, 6-4. The 28-year-old is the first Indian woman to reach the top of the WTA doubles rankings.
Lewis Hamilton won the Chinese Grand Prix ahead of his Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg. Rosberg accused Hamilton of being selfish by driving too slow and compromising his second position. Former world champion Mika Hakkinen says Hamilton was within his rights to look after himself. Hamilton is bidding to win a third World Championship title this season.
Nico Rosberg accused Lewis Hamilton of being'selfish' in China. Mercedes boss Toto Wolff is confident the matter has been laid to rest. Hamilton was absolved of any blame by Wolff and Mercedes non-executive chairman Niki Lauda.
Toto Wolff says Mercedes may have to make 'unpopular calls' for their drivers. Mercedes boss says the team will have to deal with pressure from Ferrari this season. Mercedes have won two of the first three races of the new Formula One season.
Nico Rosberg criticised Lewis Hamilton after Sunday's Chinese Grand Prix. Mercedes team-mate claimed Hamilton selfishly slowed during the race, drawing him back into a chasing Sebastian Vettel in his Ferrari. Hamilton claims Rosberg was not quick enough to catch him even if he tried. Mercedes boss Toto Wolff and Niki Lauda insist Hamilton was not at fault.
Tom Varndell scored a hat-trick as Wasps beat London Welsh 40-13. Ashley Johnson, Sailosi Tagicakibau and Alapati Leiua also crossed for Wasps. Chris Elder scored a try on his Aviva Premiership debut for the Exiles.
Lewis Hamilton and Nico Rosberg had a heated press conference after the Chinese Grand Prix. Rosberg claimed Hamilton had been'selfish' by slowing down while leading the race. Hamilton denied he had done anything wrong following Rosberg's accusations.
Aaron Cook's application to switch allegiances to Moldova has been approved. The 24-year-old from Dorset is ranked No 2 in the world in the sub-80kg class. Cook has been granted Moldovan citizenship and will fight for them in Rio 2016.
Raheem Sterling has been pictured smoking a shisha pipe with team-mate Jordon Ibe. Liverpool star is not the first Premier League star to have been involved in such controversy. Jack Wilshere, Diego Maradona, Paul Merson, Saido Berahino and Robin Friday have all been involved.
Rangers have been fined £5,500 by the Scottish Football Association. The club admitted the previous board breached 'dual ownership' rules by allowing Newcastle chief Mike Ashley into Ibrox. Ashley owns 9.82 per cent of the Glasgow giants but is prohibited from going over 10 per cent.
Real Madrid could be set to play in a grey and yellow away kit next year. The away kit will feature yellow trim and a greyed-out badge.
Leigh Griffiths scored a 19-minute hat-trick as Celtic beat Kilmarnock 4-1. Kris Commons and Leigh Griffiths came off the bench to spark Celtic into life. Darryl Westlake's deflected strike gave the visitors a shock lead against the run of play.
Leicester City are three points from safety in the Premier League after back-to-back wins. Nigel Pearson has urged his players to focus on their own job and not worry about relegation rivals.
Michael Phelps is aiming to compete in a fifth Olympics next year in Rio de Janeiro. The 18-time Olympic champion won't swim in the world championships this summer. Phelps said he won't be swimming at the world meet in Russia in August as part of the punishment set forth by the sport's U.S. governing body. Phelps pleaded guilty after his first drunken driving arrest in 2004.
Michael Phelps is entered in five events at the Arena Pro Swim Series in Mesa, Arizona. It will be his first meet since serving a six-month ban following a drunk-driving conviction. Phelps was suspended last year by USA Swimming after his arrest on drunk driving charges.
US President Barack Obama visited Jamaica this week and met world-class sprinter Usain Bolt. Obama said he 'had to say hi' to Bolt, the fastest sprinter of all time, when he became the first American President to visit the island nation since Ronald Reagan in 1982. Obama praised Bolt saying 'nobody's ever been faster than this guy. Ever...of all the billions of people'Crowds across Jamaica cheered for President Obama on Thursday as he made multiple stops.

Edwin van der Sar is convinced Louis van Gaal will bring glory days back to Old Trafford. United head to Chelsea on Saturday in top form, having won six successive matches. Van Gaal is looking to strengthen in the summer with Mats Hummels, Nathaniel Clyne and Kevin Strootman on his radar.
Louis van Gaal has won a battle to install floodlights at the club's Carrington training ground. The Manchester United boss was stunned to find players could not train after dark at the swish complex on the outskirts of the city when he arrived last summer. The installation of the lights will also allow Van Gaal extra time to work with his charges in bleak winters.
Maria Sharapova will play for Russia against Germany in the Fed Cup semi-finals. World No 2 will be part of the Russian team facing Germany on April 18-19 in Sochi. Playing in the team event helps her become eligible for next year's Olympics.
Andy Murray will marry Kim Sears in his hometown of Dunblane on Saturday. The pair have been together for 10 years after meeting at the 2005 US Open and announced their engagement last November. Murray will sacrifice a traditional honeymoon to jet off to Barcelona after his nuptials to kick-start his clay court season.

Usain Bolt will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas next month. The six-time Olympic gold medallist will compete on May 2 and 3. Bolt insists he always does 'his best to make his country proud' while wearing Jamaica colours.

Thomas Muller, Manuel Neuer and Pep Guardiola were pictured at the airport ready to board their flight back to Bavaria. Bayern boss Karl-Heinz Rummenigge said defeat was price the five-time European champions paid for a string of injuries.

Kick It Out welcomed the successful prosecution of a supporter who racially abused Jason Brown. John Wild was issued with a three-year banning order and ordered to carry out community service, pay compensation and cover court fees after being found guilty of racially abusing Brown while he was playing for Dartford in a Vanarama Conference fixture at Bristol Rovers last October. Brown, 32, welcomed the outcome of the case but, in doing so, also criticised a number of bodies, including Kick It Out, The Football Association and the Professional Footballers' Association.

The 25-year-old returned home with an unidentified man and a dog last October and was remanded to appear in court on April 13, but failed to show prompting police to issue a warrant. Police were carrying out checks on her phone for suspected drug trafficking when they discovered the three videos which allegedly show her having sex with a dog.

Stephen Taylor, 54, went missing in the Solent after leaving Lee-on-Solent at 11.30am yesterday. He was in touch with his partner Michelle Fuller, 49, throughout the day. But when he failed to return home late in the evening she alerted police. Coastguard helicopter, rescue teams and lifeboats were launched to search off Hill Head. It is believed there may have been a sighting of Mr Taylor, from Gosport, at 10.50pm.

The notes are thorough from start to finish with numbers for appearances, goals, transfer fees and other interesting tidbits to keep the millions of listeners well informed. Tottenham's Kyle Walker and Arsenal's Calum Chambers are also in contention for the position.
The creatures were spotted at Blairgowrie Pier but are fast on the move to their proper migration spot at Rye Pier in a few weeks time. Spider crabs migrate once a year in the Port Phillip Bay area in Southern Victoria, piling on top of each other to create a moving mound.

But the then-Barcelona coach was spooked by the Russian's habit of hiring and firing managers. Guardiola opted to join Bayern Munich instead and has maintained their dominance in the Bundesliga.

Lewis Hamilton won the Chinese Grand Prix but came under fire from Nico Rosberg. Mercedes team-mate Rosberg claimed Hamilton was slowing on purpose in the race. Hamilton was exonerated by Toto Wolff and Niki Lauda after a post-race debrief. Rosberg claims he would not have done anything different under the circumstances that materialised. YouTube user Elman511 cracked open the over-sized egg that was laid by one of his hens, exclaiming: ‘The big egg has another normal egg in it!’ While the instance is extremely rare, it’s caused when the hen is in the process of forming an egg in her oviduct and another oocyte – the ovum or egg cell that becomes the yolk of the egg – is released too soon.
Surveillance footage from Philadelphia's 15th Street Station shows one passenger lose his balance as he tries to skirt past somebody on the platform at 6.40 on Wednesday night. But almost instantaneously, a man in an Eagles jacket runs over and throws himself onto the tracks to save him. Within a minute, transport officials arrived to deliver first aid to the men, who are expected to survive any injuries.

BMW is recalling 91,800 Mini Coopers to fix a defect that may prevent the air bag on the front passenger side of the cars from deploying in a crash. The problem affects the 2005 to 2008 models of the Mini Cooper and Cooper S. BMW says the airbag may not work properly because of a error that might prevent the vehicles' mat detection system from sensing a passenger during a severe crash. Only one person has been injured so far as a result of the defect.

Australian Josh Kerr took home the prize for the most impressive wipe-out. The 31-year-old was attempting to surf the notorious 'Box' at Margaret River's main break on Wednesday. The Box is renowned for its challenging shallow surf break directly over the reef, but also for its world-class waves. Adam Melling, Owen Wright and John John Florence also succumbed to the powerful break with extraordinary crashes.

Cooperative weather and the efforts of hundreds of firefighters helped beat back flames Sunday that had threatened hundreds of homes near a Southern California dam. Evacuation orders were lifted just before dawn for about 300 homes in an area along the border of the cities of Norco and Corona, about 35 miles southeast of downtown Los Angeles. The fire burned in the Prado Dam Flood Control Basin, where vegetation has not burned in decades.

Villagers in Shaanxi Province, central China, dug a 46m well in order to get fresh drinking water. But when they pumped it to the surface they found it was so polluted it could be set on fire. Locals said they could smell gas and petrol coming from the well, and blame a leak from a local petrol station. Local officials say they have now launched an investigation into how the water became so polluted.

Many Clouds won the Grand National at Aintree on Saturday. Leighton Aspell's mount carried the biggest weight to victory since Red Rum in 1974. Many Clouds owner Trevor Hemmings flew in by helicopter from his Isle Of Man home.
Olly Barkley has signed a new contract with relegated London Welsh. The 33-year-old has previously played for Bath, Gloucester, Racing Metro, Grenoble and the Scarlets. Welsh are set to return to the Championship next season after finishing bottom of Aviva Premiership.
Balthazar King received treatment from a vet on the track for at least an hour before being taken to an equine hospital. Ruby Walsh warned the field to go wide at the Canal Turn as vets tended to the stricken gelding.
Leighton Aspell won the Grand National on Many Clouds on Saturday. The 38-year-old became the first rider since Bryan Marshall to land the biggest jumps race of the year in successive years on different horses. Many Clouds won the National for trainer Oliver Sherwood and Aspell.
Brian O'Driscoll believes Roman Abramovich style investment is needed to turn English clubs back into a European force. Saracens are the only English team left in the Champions Cup semi-finals against Clermont Auvergne.
Christian Wade failed to turn up to a charity event for Matt Hampson Foundation. Wasps team-mate Andy Goode accused the 23-year-old of having 'bad values'Goode tweeted: 'Bad values from @ChristianWade3 agreeing to come to @Hambofoundation then saying he’s too tired, poor culture & no trust'Wade, who missed out on the RBS 6 Nations, is recovering from a hamstring injury.
Saracens host Clermont Auvergne at Stade Geoffroy-Guichard in St Etienne on Saturday. Saracens captain Brad Barritt is back to anchor the Sarries midfield against the Top 14 giants. Wesley Fofana, Julien Bonnaire and Billy Vunipola will be key to Sarries' game plan.
Bath have announced the signing of England Sevens international Jeff Williams. The 26-year-old will move to the Recreation Ground for next season. Williams has scored 36 tries on the World Series circuit.
Ankit Keshri died after colliding with a team-mate during a club match in Kolkata. The 20-year-old suffered a cardiac arrest following an on-field injury on Friday. He regained consciousness but died in hospital on Monday after passing away. India legend Sachin Tendulkar has paid tribute to 'promising' youngster.
Ian Bell says he never expected England to win the series in the West Indies. Ian Bell scored a magnificent hundred in the first Test, but England failed to see out the win. West Indies hung on for a draw on an unresponsive pitch in Antigua last week. Bell was full of praise for Jason Holder and Jerome Taylor.
Declan Fitzpatrick has been forced to retire from rugby on medical grounds. The 31-year-old prop had 'experienced a number of concussive episodes' in recent seasons. Fitzpatrick won seven caps for Ireland, the last of which was against New Zealand.
Liam Plunkett and Mark Wood impressed in the nets on Sunday ahead of the second Test against West Indies. Moeen Ali has joined up with the England squad after missing the first Test in Antigua through injury.
Saracens face Clermont Auvergne in the Champions Cup semi-final on Saturday. Jonathan Davies has warned Saracens they are'sharpening the blade' ahead of the game. The French outfit thrashed Northampton 37-5 in the last-eight tie at the Stade Marcel-Michelin.
Lancashire's Liam Livingstone scored a reported world-record 350 for Nantwich Town against Caldy on Sunday. The 21-year-old all-rounder plundered 34 fours and 27 sixes in his remarkable 138-ball innings. Lancashire believes the innings is the highest-ever individual score in a one-day match.
Kevin Pietersen was dismissed for 19 on his return to the County Championship. The 34-year-old was making his first LV= County Championship appearance since June 2013. Sri Lankan Kumar Sangakarra made a century on his Surrey debut.
Mark Selby beat Kurt Maflin 6-3 in the first round of the World Championship. The 31-year-old won his maiden Crucible title last year, beating Ronnie O'Sullivan in the final. No first-time champion has returned to retain the trophy 12 months on.
Marcelo Bosch has signed a contract extension with Saracens. The 33 times-capped centre was the hero of Sarries' Champions Cup quarter-final win over Racing Metro.
The Scotland shirt will have BT on it rather than RBS from the summer. It is the biggest shirt sponsorship deal in the history of the Scottish Rugby Union. BT will pay £3.6m over three years for the naming rights of Murrayfield.
Mark Selby faces Kurt Maflin in the first round of the World Snooker Championship at the Crucible on Saturday. Selby won the title at the same venue in 2014, but no first-time winner has retained it the next year.
Michael Phelps won 100m butterfly at the Arena Pro Swim Series in Arizona. The 18-time Olympic gold-medallist won the race in Mesa with a time of 52.38 seconds. The 29-year-old will miss this summer's World Championships in Kazan, Russia.
Caster Semenya reclaimed the South African 800-meter title on Saturday. The former 800 world title-holder and 2012 Olympic silver medalist won in 2 minutes, 5.05 seconds. She said the World Championships in August were 'the aim'
Middlesbrough beat Arsenal Under-21s 3-2 at the Riverside Stadium on Monday. Gunners goalkeeper Deyan Iliev was sent off inside 15 minutes after scythed down Boro's Harry Chapman in the box. Emmanuel Ledesma converted the resulting penalty for Middlesbrough. Alex Iwobi then equalised for Arsenal, netting his sixth goal in his last four games.
Manchester United lost 1-0 to Chelsea at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game as Louis van Gaal's side lost. Juan Mata returned to Stamford Bridge for the first time since leaving the club in January last year.
Alex Hales completed a double century for Nottinghamshire against Yorkshire. The 26-year-old was unbeaten on 222 not out at stumps on Sunday. Hales scored his runs from 250 balls, with 37 fours and a six. Steven Patterson took two for 58 and Jack Brooks two for 90 for Yorkshire.
Tony Pulis has never managed to guide a team into the top half of the Premier League. The West Brom manager has never finished higher than 11th in the top flight. Alan Pardew, Sam Allardyce, Mark Hughes, Mauricio Pochettino and Garry Monk are all in the relegation zone.
Hull face Southampton at the KC Stadium on Saturday in the Premier League. Steve Bruce admits his side need 'crazy results' to avoid relegation from the top flight. The Tigers are currently two points above the bottom three after wins for QPR and Leicester.
Liam Phillips won the 2013 BMX world title and was the World Cup series champion in 2014. The 26-year-old plans to use 2015 to experiment with tactics ahead of Rio 2016 Olympics.
Aaron Cook's application to switch allegiances to Moldova has been approved. The 24-year-old has already received his passport from the small eastern European state.
Mike Ashley has been urged to invest in Newcastle United or risk losing a generation of fans. Thousands of Newcastle fans boycotted the club's last game, a 3-1 defeat at home to Spurs on Sunday. Protesters are calling for a repeat when Swansea travel to St James' Park on Saturday.
Alan Pardew's five-game winning run was crucial to Newcastle's season. Without that run, they would only be on 20 points and would be headed for relegation. Newcastle are currently bottom of the Premier League with 29 points.
Leicester beat Swansea 2-0 at the King Power Stadium on Saturday to go 17th in the Premier League. Leonardo Ulloa scored his first Premier League goal in 647 minutes for the Foxes. Leicester have scored two or more goals in a fourth consecutive top-flight match for the first time since May 2000.
Dele Alli signed for Tottenham for £5million from MK Dons in January. The 19-year-old was crowned Young Player of the Year on Sunday night. Alli is excited by the prospect of playing under Mauricio Pochettino next season.
Sam Allardyce is out of contract at the end of the season. Garry Monk has been touted as a potential replacement.
Ryan Hardie scored a brace on his full debut for Rangers against Dumbarton. The 18-year-old had made just four substitute appearances before facing the Sons. Mark Wilson opened the scoring for Dumbarton with a second-half strike. Haris Vuckic completed the 3-1 win for Stuart McCall's side in the second half.
Rangers currently lead the race for second spot in the Championship. Stuart McCall's side have a one-point advantage over Hibernian and a six-point cushion over Queen of the South. Rangers have dropped two points at Championship bottom side Livingston in their bid for promotion.
Yannick Bolasie scored a second-half hat-trick as Crystal Palace beat Sunderland 5-1 at the Stadium of Light on Saturday. Glenn Murray opened the scoring for the Eagles in the 48th minute with a close-range finish. Crystal Palace now have 25 points from a possible 36 under Alan Pardew and the table for 2015 alone has the Eagles soaring in fifth, two points behind champions elect Chelsea.
Dave King faces a challenge to convince the SFA he is a 'fit and proper' person to be chairman of Rangers. The South Africa-based businessman ousted the previous directors last month and plans a return to the Ibrox boardroom if he can overcome SFA obstacles. Rangers want SFA clearance for King before commencing with a cash-raising rights issue for existing shareholders.
Danny Ings, Mario Balotelli and Rickie Lambert are set to leave Liverpool this summer. Petr Cech could be out of reach for the Reds if Paris Saint-Germain make a move for the Chelsea goalkeeper. Memphis Depay is an ideal signing for Brendan Rodgers, but he must compete with Europe's elite side.
Aaron Cresswell has been linked with a move to Manchester City. West Ham boss Sam Allardyce has warned him.
Tehsin Nayani spent six years as spokesman for the Glazer family. His book, 'The Glazer Gatekeeper: six years speaking for Manchester United's silent owners', challenges popular perception about the US bosses who succeeded in a debt-burdening £800m takeover in 2005. Nayani reveals that the family were 'completely unruffled' by the mass protests that greeted their arrival.
Wojciech Szczesny turned 25 on Saturday after Arsenal beat Reading 2-1 in the FA Cup semi-final. He was joined at his London home by family and friends as well as one of his favourite rock bands, 'Lemon', who delivered a private performance. The Poland international was clearly touched by the efforts of his singer-songwriter girlfriend Mariana Luczenko.
Johann Gudmundsson equalised for Charlton Athletic in the first-half. Ross McCormack gave Fulham the lead after eight minutes with just eight minutes played.
Barcelona and Real Madrid could be looking to offload players this summer. Barca want limited departures from the first team this summer because they can’t sign players until January. At Real Madrid the need for a clear-out could make the exodus bigger than in most other seasons. Martin Odegaard is expected to go out on loan from Real Madrid to gain experience next season.
FC United of Manchester's new 5,000-capacity stadium is nearing completion. Broadhurst Park is a far cry from the glamour and glitz of Old Trafford, seven miles away across the city. It is a ground for the fans, paid for by the fans and will host Benfica on May 29.
Newcastle United host Tottenham Hotspur at St James' Park on Sunday. John Carver says he has the hardest job in football as head coach of Newcastle United. Fans are unhappy at how Newcastle are being run under Mike Ashley and have planned a boycott. Carver has urged fans to get behind the squad ahead of the game.
Mauricio Pochettino believes Harry Kane and Ryan Mason have not been able to show the same consistency since they returned from England duty. Kane has been one of the stars of the Premier League, scoring 29 goals in all competitions.
Ashley Young is finally feeling like a senior member of the Manchester United squad. The 29-year-old moved to Old Trafford in June 2011 from Aston Villa. Young now feels he has an important role under Louis van Gaal.
Juventus beat Monaco 1-0 in the Champions League quarter-final first leg. Gianluigi Buffon (37), Giorgio Chiellini (30), Stefan Lichtsteiner (31), Patrice Evra (33), Andrea Pirlo (35), Carlos Tevez (31) and Arturo Vidal (57) all started.
Manny Pacquiao took time out of his busy schedule to hang out with Saved by the Bell actor Mario Lopez, otherwise known as AC Slater, and NBA superstar Jeremy Lin. The Filipino boxer took to Instagram to show off his ripped torso ahead of his fight against Floyd Mayweather on May 2. Mayweather has admitted he has fallen out of love with boxing and will have just one more fight.
Newcastle keeper Tim Krul congratulated Sunderland striker Jermain Defoe on his goal at half-time in the Wear-Tyne derby. Sportsmail's Jamie Carragher and Danny Murphy have criticised Krul for his actions. Krul should have been so lost in his own despair, or anger, or disappointment, or fierce resolve to get back on terms.
Tomas Berdych advanced to the semi-finals of the Monte Carlo Masters. Milos Raonic retired with a foot injury during the quarter-final. The Czech will face either Grigor Dimitrov or Gael Monfils.
Enner Valencia is a transfer target for Chelsea in the summer. Jose Mourinho is ready to revive his interest in the West Ham striker. Chelsea have offered Patrick Bamford a new contract at Stamford Bridge. The 21-year-old has scored 17 league goals for Middlesbrough.
Reading face Arsenal in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley on Saturday. Steve Clarke insists his side must be 'perfect' to have any chance of beating the Gunners. The Royals boss has never beaten Arsene Wenger as a manager.
Amir Khan announced Chris Algieri as his next opponent last week. The welterweight has admitted he does not know who he will fight on May 30. Khan has been criticised on social media after rejecting a potential £5million pay day against Kell Brook at Wembley.
Jessica Ennis-Hill, Mo Farah and Greg Rutherford are set to return to the Olympic Stadium. The three-day extravaganza includes the world’s only two-day Diamond League meeting from July 24-25.
Wojciech Szczesny has lost his place to David Ospina after a number of errors this season. Arsene Wenger admits he's working hard in training to win back his place.
Manchester City players trained at their Etihad Campus base on Wednesday. Manuel Pellegrini's side face West Ham United on Sunday in the Premier League. Sergio Aguero, Yaya Toure and Samir Nasri are reportedly two players who could leave in the summer.
Adrian Heath is manager of the newest MLS team Orlando City. Former Everton and Manchester City midfielder has been in the league for eight years. He believes the MLS will be the world's 'third or fourth biggest league' in ten years.
David Villa cheered on former club Atletico Madrid during the Champions League quarter-final first-leg clash with city rivals Real Madrid. The 33-year-old joined MLS newcomers New York City FC after struggling to secure a regular first-team spot in the Spanish capital. Villa is enjoying life in New York and has been named club captain.
UFC women's champion Ronda Rousey visited Manny Pacquiao's camp in Los Angeles. She said she was 'truly honoured to meet such a humble and genuine person' in the Filipino boxer. The undefeated UFC bantamweight champion paid a visit to the Filipino's Los Angeles training camp.
Patrick Bamford scored in Middlesbrough's 2-1 win over Wolves on Tuesday. The 21-year-old has been on loan at Boro, Derby and MK Dons this season. Bamford is currently on a £7,500-a-week deal at the Riverside Stadium.
Rebecca Lowe was at Turf Moor to present Burnley's Premier League match against Arsenal. Lowe was joined by former Wimbledon midfielder Robbie Earle and retired MLS star Kyle Martino. Lowe herself is a lifelong Crystal Palace fan.
Floyd Mayweather will hold an open workout for the media on Tuesday night. The session will be streamed live across the world and you can watch it here from 12am UK (7pm EDT)Mayweather takes on Manny Pacquiao in Las Vegas on May 2.
Manny Pacquiao will be put through his paces at the iconic Wild Card gym in Los Angeles this evening. Floyd Mayweather Jnr was almost two hours late for his workout.
Obi Okele, the owner of Fusion Luxury Motors, was given the task of getting Mayweather the Bugatti. The super-car was delivered just 11 hours later and is worth an estimated £1.5million. Mayweather's mega-fight with Manny Pacquiao is just three weeks away and Mayweather continues to work in the gym.
Grigor Dimitrov beat Stan Wawrinka 6-1, 6-2 in Monte Carlo Masters quarter-final. The Swiss No 2 looked listless and disinterested in the match. The Bulgarian will now face Gael Monfils in the last eight.
Rafael Nadal beat John Isner in Monte Carlo Masters. Nadal will now face David Ferrer in the last eight. Roger Federer lost to Gael Monfils 6-4 7-6 (7/5)
Manny Pacquiao takes on Floyd Mayweather in Las Vegas on May 2. The fight is expected to draw revenue of around $400m (£273m) with both fighters picking up huge pay days. Kenny Bayless and Tony Weeks are both frontrunners to referee the bout. Mayweather recently revealed he is within three pounds of the welterweight limit.

Theo Walcott has just over 12 months remaining on his current £90,000-a-week contract. The 26-year-old has attracted interest from Liverpool and Manchester City. Walcott is scheduled to sit down with Gunners chiefs over the next fortnight.
Gareth Bale was often the brightest of Real Madrid's front three but his miss was still the clearest. Gareth Bale missed the best chance of the match early in the first half as Jan Oblak saved. Cristiano Ronaldo was confronted by a supporter at the end of the 0-0 draw.
Mario Mandzukic appeared to be punched and bitten by Real Madrid's Daniel Carvajal. The Croatian striker was the centre of attention in on-pitch scraps with Sergio Ramos and Raphael Varane during the Champions League quarter-final first leg at the Vicente Calderon. Paul Scholes has criticised the Atletico Madrid star for'making a meal' of many of his second-half clashes.

The 48-year-old was speaking at the Laureus Sports Awards in Shanghai.
Eight of United's first-team squad and six from City are from Spain or Spanish-speaking countries. David de Gea, Victor Valdes, Juan Mata, Ander Herrera (all Spain), Marcos Rojo, Angel di Maria, Antonio Valencia (Ecuador) and Falcao (Colombia) at United, and Willy Caballero, Pablo Zabaleta, Martin Demichelis, Sergio Aguero (all Argentina), Jesus Navas and David Silva (both Spain) at City. Nine English-speakers are expected to be in the two sides’ respective 18-man squads.
Tim Sherwood's Aston Villa beat Tottenham 1-0 at White Hart Lane on Saturday. Yannick Bolasie scored three as Crystal Palace beat Sunderland 4-1 at Selhurst Park. Arsenal kept up their impressive recent form with a narrow win over Burnley. Hull City remain in danger after a 2-0 loss at Southampton.
Wilfried Zaha made just four appearances for Manchester United in two years. The 22-year-old winger was signed by Sir Alex Ferguson in January 2013 for £10million. Zaha admits he felt 'worthless' during his two-year spell at Old Trafford.
Javier Pastore is the best player in the world, according to Eric Cantona. The former Manchester United forward was speaking at the Laureus World Sports Awards in Shanghai. Pastore has three goals and five assists this season compared to Lionel Messi's 45 and Cristiano Ronaldo's 51 for Real Madrid.
Real Madrid drew 0-0 with city rivals Atletico Madrid in La Liga on Tuesday. Barcelona face Paris Saint-Germain in their Champions League quarter-final on Wednesday. Arturo Vidal scored the only goal of the game to give Juventus the advantage over Monaco.
Chris Maguire converted an injury time penalty to salvage a draw for Sheffield Wednesday at Dean Court. Matt Ritchie put Bournemouth in front before Yann Kermorgant equalised midway through the second half. Kieran Lee put Sheffield Wednesday in front with a 36th minute header before Simon Francis was sent off for two yellow cards.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has bagged 17 Ligue 1 goals for Paris Saint-Germain this season. The 33-year-old is available for selection for the club's Champions League quarter-final second leg against Barcelona.
Eric Cantona believes Manchester United are 'kings of the city' again after beating Manchester City 4-2 on Sunday. The club legend believes Louis van Gaal is the right man for the job at Old Trafford. United have won their last six Premier League games - moving up to third in the table. Cantona was speaking at the Laureus Sports Awards in Shanghai on Tuesday.
Bournemouth drew 2-2 with Sheffield Wednesday at Dean Court on Saturday. Yann Kermorgant and Matt Ritchie scored in stoppage time to put Cherries ahead. Chris Maguire equalised for Sheffield Wednesday from the spot after a foul on Atdhe Nuhiu. Eddie Howe was at a loss as to why his Bournemouth side were not awarded a 'clear-cut' penalty.
Petr Cech has fallen behind Thibaut Courtois in Jose Mourinho's pecking order this season. The 32-year-old is expected to leave Stamford Bridge this summer with Arsenal and Liverpool among those linked. Cech posted a YouTube cover of 'Magnificent' by U2 to his YouTube channel on Tuesday.
Gonzalo Higuain and Marek Hamsik put the visitors firmly in control. Substitute Manolo Gabbiadini made it four just moments after replacing two-goal hero Hamisk. Nicklas Bendtner pulled a goal back for the hosts.
Porto beat Bayern Munich 3-1 in the first leg of their Champions League quarter-final. Julen Lopetegui's side beat Basle 5-1 on aggregate in the last round and are unbeaten in the competition.
Todd Phillips, a front-outside tire changer for Dayle Coyne Racing, was injured when he was struck by the car of Francesco Dracone, who had come in on Lap 25 for tyres and fuel. Dracone spun while exiting his put box, clipping Phillips' leg.
Arjen Robben has missed Bayern Munich's last three games with an abdominal injury. The Holland international has said he has felt 'physically disabled' during the last few weeks. Robben is expected to miss the upcoming Champions League tie against Porto.
Jurgen Klopp announced he would be leaving Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season. The German manager has won two Bundesliga titles, the German Cup and reached the Champions League final, in 2013 at Wembley.
Alvaro Arbeloa, Asier Illarramendi and Nacho gave adidas an exclusive tour of their state-of-the-art training complex. Real Madrid's first-team stars are allowed 24-hour access to the club's HQ. Each player has their own personalised room in the complex, which is part-owned by the council.
Manuel Pellegrini's side are currently fourth in the Premier League table. Some fans will now have to pay over £1,700 to watch Man City, up from just £885. The club claim the change is due to upgrades which have come in during the stadium's expansion.
Manchester City beat West Ham 2-0 in the Premier League on Sunday. David Silva received an elbow to the face by Cheikhou Kouyate in the second half. The Spaniard was taken off on a stretcher before being rushed to hospital. Manuel Pellegrini believes the incident was 'accidental'
Russia awarded 3-0 walkover after abandonment of Euro 2016 qualifier in Podgorica. Montenegro ordered to play next two matches behind closed doors and fined £36,280. Russia awarded 25,000 euro (£18,143) fine for their players' actions.
Manchester City's Under 18s lost 3-1 to Chelsea in the FA Youth Cup final first-leg. City captain Vincent Kompany, manager Manuel Pellegrini and head of youth development Patrick Vieira were in attendance to watch the game at the Academy Stadium.
Manchester United beat Manchester City 4-1 in the Premier League at Old Trafford. Marouane Fellaini, Ashley Young, Juan Mata, Ander Herrera and Juan Mata scored for the hosts. Sergio Aguero scored twice late on to make it 3-1.
Sheffield Wednesday chief executive Paul Aldridge will leave the Championship club at the end of next season. Aldridge joined the club as vice chairman and CEO in January 2011. Wednesday have brought in Adam Pearson and Glenn Roeder to work alongside head coach Stuart Gray.
Patrick Bamford won the Championship Player of the Year award on Sunday. The 21-year-old has scored 17 goals for Middlesbrough this season. Bamford is hoping to be part of Gareth Southgate’s England Under 21 squad for the European Championships.
Yoshinori Muto would be the first Japanese player to sign for Chelsea if he completes a move to Stamford Bridge this summer. Chelsea agreed a £200million sponsorship deal with Japanese tyre manufacturers Yokohama Rubber in February. The west London club are believed to have made an offer for the 22-year-old.
Moeen Ali has been named as an ambassador for Liverpool's official fan club in Pakistan. The lifelong Liverpool fan, 27, has been called up for England's final two Tests in the West Indies. The Pak fan club has branches in Lahore, Islamabad, Hyderabad, Karachi, Peshawar and Chakwal.
Hull KR beat Bradford Bulls 50-30 in the Challenge Cup at the Odsal Stadium. Josh Mantellato scored four tries and kicked 14 points for the Robins.
Monaco lost 1-0 to Juventus in Champions League quarter-final first leg on Tuesday. Alvaro Morata went down under Ricardo Carvalho's challenge and the referee pointed to the spot. Juventus midfielder Arturo Vidal stepped up to score from the spot in Turin. Monaco manager Leonardo Jardim described the decision as a 'huge injustice'

Gary Cahill is yet to win the Premier League with Chelsea since joining the club in January 2012. Cahill has won four cups with the Blues since joining in 2012, including the Champions League. Chelsea host Manchester United in the league on Saturday.

Laurent Blanc's side face Barcelona in the Champions League quarter-final. Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Marco Verratti are both back from suspension for the second leg. Luis Suarez scored twice in the 3-1 defeat in the first leg in Paris last week.
Bangladesh beat fellow World Cup quarter-finalists Pakistan by 79 runs. Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim scored centuries as Bangladesh made 329 for six. Pakistan could only muster 250 in reply. Pakistan will have the chance to level the three-match series on Sunday.
Andy Lee makes the first defence of his WBO middleweight belt against Peter Quillin. The Irishman won the title last year against Matt Korobov in New York. Lee is confident he has improved even further since winning the title. Quillin is a former champion but is yet to taste defeat as a professional.
Eddie Hearn has offered Carl Frampton £1.5m for a super-bantamweight super-fight with Scott Quigg. Quigg is the defending WBA champion and wants to fight Frampton in Manchester. Hearn unveiled a cheque with his offer to Sky TV cameras in a bid to force a deal. But Frampton's promoters, Cyclone Promotions, released a press release in response to the offer, claiming they were awaiting formal communication from Hearn’s Matchroom Sports.
Sean Reardon was stopped by police as he drove through Chico, California. He claims he was wrestled to the floor by two officers who then hit him with a baton or stick. The 30-year-old was twice over the legal limit for driving and had traces of methamphetamine and cocaine in his blood. Reardon claims he suffered respiratory failure and had to be put on a ventilator in hospital.
The Tour Down Under is a big part of the international cycling season and contributes more to the South Australian economy than the F1 Grand Prix. Adelaide is a much softer city than Sydney and has charm, colonial history, sophistication and space to breathe. A trip here is enough to convince anyone that Adelaide is the true food capital of Australia.
Bridget Olinda Garcia, 32, from Port St. Lucie, Florida, charged with child abuse. She had taken her 13-year-old son, 13, and three siblings on an errand when he jumped on the hood of the car. Garcia allegedly drove 200ft with her son on the car's hood before stopping. The boy was taken to hospital with non-life threatening injuries, police say.
Pilates instructor and YouTube star Cassey Ho combats body-shamers who comment on her videos. The 28-year-old says negative comments on her YouTube channel have made her cry on more than one occasion. Her new video, The 'Perfect' Body, examines whether conforming to society's standards is the key to happiness, while highlighting some of the cruel comments.

The 250-piece Lilly Pulitzer for Target collection sold out online and flew off of shelves at stores shortly after debuting on Sunday morning. More than 30,000 pieces have been listed for resale on eBay, many at higher price points, prompting angry customers who were unable to walk away with Lilly Pulitzer merchandise to boycott the second-hand sellers.

Blues have kitted out their Cobham training ground with state-of-the-art equipment. Players including Eden Hazard and Nemanja Matic have been pictured being put through their paces.

Commercial diver Johnny Debnam was free diving four metres beneath the ocean when he had his snuggle with the majestic, friendly creature. The stingray swum over him three times, enveloping him under his body as he glided on top. Mr Debnam says he felt completely at ease with the stingray, although he was aware of the risks.

Richie Benaud's small private funeral was attended by close family and friends in Sydney on Wednesday. Benaud died last Friday at the age of 84 of complications from skin cancer. Former Australia captain and commentator Ian Chappell and Shane Warne also attended the service.

Greece's Football Federation (EPO) could be suspended from international competition over government interference. FIFA and UEFA have strict rules aimed at protecting member federations' independence. The Greek government has put together a new set of regulations in an attempt to crack down on violence at sports events.

A 4WD burst into flames in the middle of an outdoor car park at Sydney airport's busy international terminal on Thursday morning. The red 4WD was fully engulfed in flames when authorities arrived and witnesses reported seeing fire spewing from the bonnet of the vehicle. The fire caused traffic delays throughout the international terminal due to heavy smoke.

He was unable to be revived, but a doctor at the scene said that it was likely he died of a heart attack. It's believed that the man is from Seymour in Victoria and was holidaying at the Bali resort. An autopsy has still to be carried out to find the exact cause of death.

Tegan Peters, 22, from Auckland New Zealand was'shocked' and 'disgusted' to find a ball that she thinks was purpose designed to harm animals or children near her home. The ball was deliberately covered in sharp pins in Ti Rakau Park, south of Auckland. Ms Peters said she noticed the ball as she was driving past and decided to pull over, thinking it could be a good present for her one-year-old Rottweiler-cross, Odin. ‘I picked it up and saw all the needles sticking out and got a real shock,' she said.

Insurers are checking people's social media accounts following a break-in to see if they announced they would be away from the property, and are using it as a reason not to pay out. Most firms include'reasonable care' clause in contracts, meaning they are not liable if people did not protect their property. Police have warned that would-be thieves will often check social networks to establish that people are out of their homes before striking.
Warren Sapp was arrested the night after the Super Bowl in Phoenix, Arizona, on a prostitution charge after an alleged incident involving two women. Britney Osbourne, 23, and Quying Boyd, 34, were both arrested along with Sapp. Sapp, 42, was charged with soliciting prostitution and two counts of assault. In a police video released on Monday, Sapp, cries, cackles and confesses about what exactly went down back on February 2 in the Renaissance Hotel. In the video, Sapp admits he paid for oral sex and that 'everyone got naked' after he 'put $600 on the table' in his hotel room.
Paul Warren Smith, 61, was identified as the man in a white Marshall Independent School District van seen in surveillance video tossing five, 3-week-old puppies over a chain-link fence just before noon on Saturday. All five puppies are healthy and uninjured; each will be put up for adoption when they are at least 8 weeks old. The puppies, which all appear to be a Labrador mix, are in the care of a Marshall High School employee.

They claim they were not asked for documents but were able to walk past empty cubicles. Schoolteacher Clinton Lakin, 46, said: 'Every passenger on that plane walked through without a passport check in Britain'

Rafael Benitez admits he tried to sign Andre Schurrle before he joined Wolfsburg. The Napoli boss won the Europa League as Chelsea boss in 2013. Napoli travel to Wolfsburg for the first leg of the quarter-final on Thursday.
Luis Suarez has scored 19 goals in all competitions for Barcelona this season. The Uruguayan admits he was nervous at playing alongside Lionel Messi and Neymar.
Werder Bremen beat bottom club Hamburg SV 1-0 in the northern derby. Franco Di Santo converted an 84th-minute penalty to keep Werder in the running for a Europa League spot. Hamburg's Valon Behrami was sent off after bringing down Zlatko Junuzovic. New Hamburg coach Bruno Labbadia made a losing return to the bench.
Arsenal beat Reading 2-1 in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley on Saturday. Alexis Sanchez's low shot squirmed agonisingly through the legs of Reading goalkeeper Adam Federici in extra time. Arsene Wenger accepted his side were 'a bit lucky' to beat the Championship side.
Divock Origi joined Liverpool after impressing at last summer's World Cup. The 19-year-old was loaned back to Ligue 1 side Lille for this season. Origi was recently voted the second most overrated player in a poll by France Football. Liverpool keeper Simon Mignolet has backed Origi to be a success at Anfield.
Jose Mourinho has the best clean sheets percentage record in Premier League history. The Chelsea manager has kept 101 clean sheets in 189 Premier League matches. Mourinho also heads the list of managers with the lowest average of goals conceded per game. Roberto Mancini and Arsene Wenger also have impressive defensive records.
Floyd Mayweather has shared a 15-second video to his 5 million Instagram followers. The 38-year-old boxer hits back at his supposed 'haters' ahead of his fight-of-the-century bout with Manny Pacquiao next month. Footage shows rows of diamond-encrusted watches, fleet of super-cars and carpets of cash. Video was shot by director James 'JP' Dayap, a proud member of Mayweather's The Money Team brand.
Atletico Madrid are in talks to sign Palermo's Paulo Dybala, according to reports in Spain. Argentine forward has attracted interest from a number of leading European clubs. Juventus, Roma, Inter Milan and Paris Saint-Germain are also interested in the forward. Mundo Deportivo have installed Barcelona as favourites to win the Champions League.
Manchester City have 'let themselves down' this season, says Joe Hart. Manuel Pellegrini's side are 12 points behind Premier League leaders Chelsea with five games to play.
Anderson Silva will meet with Brazilian taekwondo officials in the hope of competing in next year's Olympics in Rio de Janeiro. The 40-year-old mixed martial arts fighter is currently suspended by UFC after failing drug tests. Silva tested positive for two steroids in an out-of-competition test Jan. 9, and also failed a test after his UFC victory over Nick Diaz on Jan. 31.

Manchester United and Arsenal have also been linked with the forward. Barcelona beat Almeria 4-0, while Real Madrid beat Rayo Vallecano 2-0.

Sepp Blatter's smooth procession to a ridiculous fifth term as FIFA president continued at the Central American CONCACAF Congress in the Bahamas.

Eugene in the United States has been awarded the rights to host the 2021 IAAF World Championships. The decision was taken by the International Association of Athletics Federations Council, who decided to bypass the usual bidding process. Doha, home to the Aspire Dome, beat Eugene to the 2019 event.

Liverpool hope to convince Depay that he would get more regular football with them. PSV value Depay at £25million and rejected a £14million bid from Tottenham for him last summer.
Jessica Ennis-Hill has written to the IAAF to ask if Tatyana Chernova can keep her world title. Chernova failed a drugs test two years before she beat Ennis by 129 points in Daegu, South Korea. The Russian was found to have tested positive for a prohibited steroid at the 2009 World Championships.

The Italian boss is adamant his side can cope without the trio. Real Madrid boss could turn to Isco, Jese and Javier Hernandez in their absence.

Manchester City have increased season tickets for disabled fans by £345 to £975. Some disabled supporters say they are 'disgusted' with the club after the price hike. They claim the club are trying to force migration to other parts of the Etihad Stadium. City say they have increased the number of disabled bays to 238 and have invested in improving facilities.

On Friday it will be 100 years since 50,000 gathered at Old Trafford to contest a controversial FA Cup final. Many soldiers already wounded from war or in uniform for training earned the match its Khaki Cup Final tag. Some claimed the final should not have taken place at all following the outbreak of war the previous year.
Qatar have unveiled the design for their fifth World Cup stadium, the Al Rayyan Stadium. The 40,000-seater ground is built in 'the gateway to the desert' and features air conditioning for the comfort of players and fans. Fans in the stands will sit in a comfortable 24-28 degrees Celsius, while paths and walkways leading to the stadium will also be cooled.

John Hughes says he was ready to quit as Inverness manager after hearing of the controversy. The Caley Thistle boss says he felt so repulsed by the gut-wrenching predicament being endured by his young defender, before he was dramatically cleared.

The actress and her fiance Ashton Kutcher responded to the impending lawsuit with a tongue-in-cheek video claiming they will counter-sue for injuries sustained while watching Karo's music video. Kutcher pointed out that their accuser was also one-month old at the time and apparently fluent in English and Ukranian.
