Authorities were called to an industrial site in Wetherill Park, west of Sydney, shortly after 11am on Thursday where they worked to release three men. Police found the three men inside a shipping container on a property on Victoria Street. They had been unloading or loading timber when it fell on them. Two men died at the scene as a result and the surviving man was taken to nearby Fairfield Hospital in a serious condition.

Israel is developing a system to accurately detect tunnelling activity, it has been revealed. 'First of its kind' equipment developed by Elbit Systems working with Israeli Ministry of Defense. It will be able to detect activity at a distance using a series of sensors. System will cost around £2.3million ($3.5m) per mile to install, officials say.

The video shows the monkey sitting up on a sink having its eyebrows plucked with a pair of tweezers. A flare, a smoke bomb and fireworks were thrown into the cordoned-off area.
Ronaldo says he would love to play alongside his namesake Cristiano Ronaldo. The 38-year-old ended his playing career in 2011 but is now co-owning Fort Lauderdale Strikers. Ronaldo admits a return to top level football is past him but would pick the current Real Madrid talisman to play with.
Blackpool goalkeeper Joe Lewis wore an autographed shirt in last week's Championship match with Reading. The signed shirt was meant to be put aside for a club sponsor but Lewis had to wear it because Blackpool, who have no kitman, had no others to give the 27-year-old. Blackpool's relegation from the Championship was confirmed last week following Rotherham's 1-0 win over Brighton.

Blackpool drew 1-1 with Reading at Bloomfield Road on Tuesday night. Lee Clark admits Blackpool face a challenge to win back their stay-away fans after relegation. Blackpool are the first side in the Football League to be demoted following Rotherham's win over Brighton on Easter Monday.
Micky Adams became the 42nd manager to be dismissed this season. Micky Adams left his role with Tranmere, who are bottom of the Football League, on Sunday. Malky Mackay became the 17th Championship manager to go this season earlier in April. Arsene Wenger remains the longest serving boss with 18 years at Arsenal.

The 30-year-old centre-half was shown a yellow card after slipping on the turf in the first minute of the Champions League quarter-final second-leg. Juventus won the tie on aggregate, having led from the first-leg 1-0 through Arturo Vidal's penalty.

Chelsea are the worst behaved team in the Premier League when it comes to respecting referees, according to official figures. The table is compiled by Football Association delegates who attend every top-flight match and assess team behaviour towards match officials. Liverpool show the greatest respect towards officials, followed by Burnley and West Brom.

Professor John Warren discovered avocado trees switch from male to female in a matter of hours. The flowers close for the night and then the next morning they reopen - but now they use their'male anthers' to spread their pollen.

In that statement, addressed to the 34 Facebook friends he had at that time, Knight said he had agreed to pay damages of £20,000 to the Sky Bet Championship club. The 11 minute-long video also includes footage of the terror attacks and ISIS-inspired atrocities. It claims America 'thinks it's safe' because of it's geographical location. It goes on to state that for this reason, it believes it can invade 'the Muslim lands'

John Goodwin, 75, of Atkinson, New Hampshire, went on trial this week on six counts of aggravated felonious sexual assault. Prosecutors said that Atkinson repeatedly sexually assaulted a student, who is now 24 years old. Goodwin's lawyer acknowledged his client was 'touchy-feely,' but he didn't commit a crime. Goodwin was airlifted to a hospital with life-threatening injuries from the self-inflicted gunshot wound.
University of South Florida Institute of Anthropology and Hillsborough County Sheriff's Office have proposed building a 'body farm' in Lithia, Florida. Five to ten bodies from USF's After Life Body Donation Program would be buried or placed on two acres of the Walter C. Heinrich Practical Training Center. The nearest houses are about half a mile away from the site, and officials from the sheriff's office said the bodies would be surrounded by a seven-foot fence. Residents of Lithia are still reluctant to support the project, fearing that unwanted animals might happen upon the site.

Jiang Min says she has run out of cash and can't afford even food for baby Mengyu and her older daughter. Her husband left the family home in Shandong Province at the start of the year - telling them he was heading to Binzhou City to find work. He has not been heard from since and the family are now in poverty.
Daredevil Stan Cole, an Iraq veteran, captured the wall of wind in Loraine, Texas. He took the footage with his friend Ricky Bailey while the two were out in a tractor on Wednesday. Landspouts are the scientific term for tornadoes which are not part of a thunderstorm.

Study of 1,302 German couples found working men do just two hours of housework a day. This increases to 3.9 after they retire - but it is still far less than their stay-at-home wives. Chores included doing the laundry and the washing up, as well as running errands.

William Webb Ellis picked up a football and ran with it during a match in 1823, in an action said to be the beginning of the modern game of rugby. Rugby School is known as the spiritual home of the game, with the World Cup trophy named the Webb Ellis Cup in honour of the schoolboy. Today the school is still steeped in the traditions of the sport, alongside its rich history of'muscular Christianity' led by its most famous headmaster, Dr Thomas Arnold.

These range from bruises and sprains to fractures, torn ligaments and at worst, concussion and damage to the brain and spinal cord. Ventus X mouse has a built-in honeycomb grill to let the skin breathe and a rugged coating so sweaty gamers can continue to the accessory. Some realistic combat and multiplayer games tap into the body’s flight or fight response, causing adrenaline to surge through gamers’ bodies and prepare the body for physical activity. While clicking violently may not qualify as a work out, gamers can get sweaty, and this can make their mouse slippery.
Researchers from CNRS-GATE in Lyon and the University of California, analysed the behaviour of both sexes when the study participants were asked to choose between being paid on their individual performance or as part of a team. They also compared runners who were competing NCAA's Division 1, Division 2 and Division 3. They found that men were far more competitive at all levels than female runners. The study could have implications for other areas outside sport, such as in the workplace where greater gender diversity could bring advantages.

Material would make the next iPhone 60 per cent harder than the iPhone 6, Taiwan-based Economic Daily News reported. The metal is the same as that used to make professional sports bikes but has been altered by Apple to make it lighter. A deleted tweet by Musk says that the rocket appeared to be suffering from'stiction in the biprop throttle valve, resulting in control system phase lag'This means the valve controlling the flow propellent and oxidiser to the engine wasn't moving fast enough. As a result, the actions from rocket's computers couldn't be acted upon in time to correct the tilt of the booster.

The worst storm in a decade in NSW has killed three people, left 215,000 homes without power and caused commuter chaos with severe flash flooding. A staggering 312mm of rain fell in 24 hours in Dungog, in the Hunter region of New South Wales, where three elderly people were found dead - marking the heaviest rainfall the area has seen in 100 years. Four houses in the town were washed away in the raging murky storm waters while a horse was rescued from drowning by a woman in a tin boat.

Patrick Bamford is in talks with Chelsea over a new contract. The Chelsea youngster is currently on loan at Championship side Middlesbrough. The 21-year-old has scored 17 goals in their push for promotion from the SkyBet Championship. Bamford currently earns £7,500 a week at Stamford Bridge.
Sheffield Wednesday are ready to offer new contracts to Tom Lees and Keiren Westwood. Wednesday equalled their club record of 17 clean sheets in a season on Tuesday night. The record has stood since 1978-79 in the days when Jack Charlton was manager.
Chelsea will announce the signing of Brazilian wonderkid Nathan on Wednesday. The 19-year-old has been in London for talks with the Blues this week and passed a medical on Tuesday. Manchester City had hoped to tie up a deal after spotting the player at the World Under 17 Championships two years ago.
Victor Moses has returned to Chelsea for treatment after injuring his hamstring against West Ham. The Nigeria international is expected to be out for six weeks with the injury. Stoke are still interested in tying up a permanent deal for Moses in the summer. The Potters have opened talks with Evian over the possible transfer of Daniel Wass.
Andre Ayew is out of contract at Marseille this summer. The 25-year-old Ghana international is free to talk to foreign clubs. Swansea have made a contract offer to the forward. The Swans are also keeping tabs on Schalke's Christian Fuchs.
Arsenal are interested in signing Raheem Sterling from Liverpool. The 20-year-old is stalling on a new £100,000-a-week contract at Anfield. But the Gunners are having second thoughts over their interest in the England international. Sterling has been caught smoking shisha and inhaling nitrous oxide.
Swansea City have expressed an interest in Schalke full back Christian Fuchs. The 29-year-old is out of contract in the summer and is keen on a move to the Premier League. Fuchs is vastly experienced and renowned for his set-piece ability and crossing.
Gareth Bale has been linked with a move to Manchester United this summer. Real Madrid legend Zinedine Zidane has ruled out a move for the Welshman. Bale joined the Santiago Bernabeu outfit for a world record £86million from Tottenham Hotspur in 2013.
Manchester City have decided to listen to offers for Yaya Toure and Samir Nasri. Manuel Pellegrini is under intense scrutiny following Sunday's 4-2 defeat by Manchester United. City board refuse to give up on their manager just yet.
Helal Abbas, 55, lost bid to become mayor of Tower Hamlets in East London days after the claim appeared in an ethnic freesheet. Race was won by controversial figure Lutfur Rahman, 50, a controversial figure who has been accused of rigging his re-election victory last year.
Tottenham are in talks over a new contract for Nabil Bentaleb. The Algerian international's current deal expires in the summer of 2018.
A time lapse video shows the water creeping along the tracks at Bardwell Park in Sydney's south. At one point a worker in a high-vis jacket appears to look at the rising water to take a photo. Sydney's two-day total rainfall totalled about 225mm by 9am Wednesday.
Grace Joy Roseman died after she managed to move over the edge of her adjustable cot and a'safety' ridge cut off oxygen supply to her brain. West Sussex coroner Penelope Schofield issued a report expressing concern over the Bednest Bedside cot. She said urgent action must be taken to prevent future deaths. National Children's Trust has pulled the cot from sale and stopped all pending orders going out.
Rudy Gestede has revealed his desire to play in the Premier League next season. The 26-year-old has scored 20 goals in the Championship for Blackburn this season. Swansea, Crystal Palace, Hull and West Brom have all shown an interest.
Footage of the brief contest was captured on a property near the Amber Mountain National Park on the northern edge of Madagascar. It shows the males sizing each other up before one is forced to retreat following a violent battle for the attention of a female chameleon that isn’t seen in the video.
Dapper Laughs, the controversial persona previously 'killed off' by disgraced comedian Daniel O'Reilly, has arrived Down Under – chatting up air hostesses and mocking airport cleaners along the way. The British star documented his journey to Sydney, via Doha and Melbourne, in a video posted online. He came under fire last year after telling a female audience member at one of his shows she was 'gagging for a rape'Last month he unveiled a pilot for a new TV sitcom idea on his YouTube channel.
A man was shot dead in New York City Wednesday night as he fled from the scene of an alleged crime. Members of the New York Police Department claim the man, 30, opened fire in the Queens section of the city after they responded to a call from a bar that shots had been fired. A witness said they saw an officer running with their weapon drawn 'telling everyone to get out of the way'
Mauricio Pochettino will return to St Mary's on Saturday against Southampton. Tottenham manager decided to leave Southampton in order to take up the reins at White Hart Lane in the summer. The Argentine insists he has no desire to be popular among Saints fans.
Ronny Deila has called for referees to speak to the media after matches. The Celtic manager believes Scottish football would benefit from a more public disciplinary system. Inverness defender Josh Meekings will be allowed to appear in Scottish Cup final after ban was dismissed.
Alan Pardew is keen on bringing in a big name to declare the club's intentions. The Eagles boss is prepared to let star winger Yannick Bolasie leave for 'between 40 and 60 million pounds'Pardew has guided Palace out of the relegation mire since his January arrival.
Lorient beat Marseille 5-3 at the Stade Velodrome. Jordan Ayew and Andre-Pierre Gignac scored.
Josh Meekings will be allowed to play in Scottish Cup final against Falkirk on May 30. Inverness defender admitted he was fortunate not to have conceded a penalty and been red-carded against Celtic. SFA judicial panel decided it was not entitled to apply retrospective punishment.
Ronald Koeman has promised not to leave Southampton this summer for a bigger club. The Dutchman says he would not be interested in managing Cristiano Ronaldo at Real Madrid. Koeman's side only need a point to break their Premier League points tally set last season.
Carl Jenkinson says Jack Grealish should follow his heart when choosing Ireland or England. The West Ham defender is on loan at Aston Villa from Arsenal until the end of the season. Jenkinson was in the same predicament when he had to choose between Finland and England.
West Ham became the first Premier League club to reduce season ticket prices. Manager Sam Allardyce has labelled the move as the best business by any club in a long time. West Ham's cheapest adult season ticket will cost £289 when they move to the Olympic Stadium next year.
Pittsburgh Steelers star Le'Veon Bell will miss the first three games of the season. Bell will also be fined a game cheque for abusing the league's substance abuse policy. Bell plans to appeal the decision, says ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Tottenham are considering a state-of-the-art stadium with a retractable pitch. The new 65,000 capacity stadium could be better suited to the NFL than the 90,000-seat Wembley. The NFL is said to be within five years of having a permanent franchise in London. Tottenham say they are 'looking at options' in order to 'future-proof the design'
Mauricio Pochettino spent 16 months as Southampton manager before leaving for Tottenham. The Argentine manager has been in charge at both clubs for 16 months each. He is preparing to return to St Mary's for the first time since he left in October.
New England Patriots host Pittsburgh Steelers in the opening game of the 2015 NFL season on September 10. Seattle Seahawks will play Green Bay Packers in a rematch of their NFC Championship Game from last season. Atlanta Falcons host Philadelphia Eagles and San Francisco 49ers on Monday Night Football.
Aaron Hernandez, 25, was found guilty on Wednesday of first-degree murder in a deadly late-night shooting of Odin Lloyd, a 27-year-old landscaper and amateur weekend football player. Lloyd was shot six times in the middle of the night on June 17, 2013, in a deserted industrial park near Hernandez’s home. Hernandez's mother, Terri, and his fiancee, Shayanna Jenkins, cried and gasped when they heard the verdict. Hernandez later mouthed to them: 'Be strong. Be strong.'
Jimmy Graham has signed for the Seattle Seahawks from the New Orleans Saints. Michael Bennett labelled the tight end'soft' and 'overrated' after their playoff win over the Saints two years ago. 'I still feel the same way. Just because he's on my team I don't stop feeling that way,' Bennett said.
Charles Tillman has ended his 12-year career with the Chicago Bears. The two-time Pro Bowler has agreed a deal with the Carolina Panthers. Tillman was a stalwart of Lovie Smith's defense during his 12 years.
Dallas Cowboys defensive end Greg Hardy has been suspended without pay for 10 games for conduct detrimental to the National Football League. Domestic violence charges against Hardy, who signed with Dallas last month, were abruptly dropped in February after his accuser could not be found to testify. Hardy may appeal the NFL's decision within three days.
Stevan Ridley has signed a one-year deal with the New York Jets. The 26-year-old is the 15th player to join the Jets in a frantic free agency.
Sarah Thomas, who has worked exhibition games, will be a line judge for the 2015 season. The 41-year-old was in the league's officiating development program in 2013-14 and worked some team minicamps last year. She's already broken ground in the officiating field as the first woman to work college games in 2007.
LeSean McCoy was shipped to the Bills in exchange for linebacker Kiko Alonso. McCoy says Kelly's team has a college feel and that he doesn't like star talent. McCoy ran for 1,000 yards in four of six seasons with the Eagles and still spoke of his surprise at the move.
Denver Broncos cornerback Aqib Talib and his brother Yaqub are being investigated for aggravated assault. Talib was in trouble before and was wanted on charges of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon in 2011. He and his mother were accused of shooting a gun at his sister's live-in boyfriend.
Adrian Peterson is to meet with the NFL to discuss his reinstatement. The Minnesota Vikings running back played once last season. The 30-year-old was placed on the Commissioner's Exempt list due to a child abuse case.
Sarah Thomas is set to become the NFL's first full-time female official. The 42-year-old mother-of-three from Mississippi has officiated pre-season games as a line judge. Thomas will be one of eight new officials for the 2015 season.
Efe Obada will fly to Texas next month for rookie mini-camp. The 22-year-old played just five games for the London Warriors last season. He was mentored by Warriors defensive co-ordinator Aden Durde.
The Jacksonville Jaguars will bring the NFL Draft to London next month. A UK-based fan will announce their sixth and seventh round picks live on TV. The Jaguars are committed to playing one home game each year in London until 2016.
Badou Jack beat Anthony Dirrell on points to win the WBC super-middleweight title. The 31-year-old Swede will now face mandatory challenger George Groves for the title. Danny Jacobs stopped Caleb Truax in the 12th round to successfully defend his WBA title.
Nicola Adams has pulled out of this weekend's English National Championships. The Olympic gold medallist has been forced to withdraw after a burglary at her home in Leeds. Two cars, training kit and valuable personal possessions were taken during the break-in. Adams had been due to contest the women's 51kg flyweight division.
Floyd Mayweather faces Manny Pacquiao in Las Vegas on May 2. The bout is billed as 'The Fight of the Century' and is worth at least $180m and $120m. Joe Calzaghe believes there will be more pressure on Mayweather. The Welshman retired undefeated with an undefeated record of 46 wins and zero defeats.
Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao face off at the MGM Grand Garden Arena on May 2. Tickets will cost £6.60 and will go on sale through MGM Resorts call centre and box office on Friday at 8pm. Mayweather Promotions chief executive Leonard Ellerbe says the number of fans looking to attend the official weigh-in is'something we've never seen before'
Luke Rockhold beat Lyoto Machida by second-round submission in New Jersey. Rockhold now wants a title shot and a shot at MMA history in New York. Jacare Souza beat Chris Camozzi in the co-main event.
Lyoto Machida takes on Luke Rockhold in New Jersey on Saturday night. The 36-year-old is a former light-heavyweight champion in the division in which the limit is 205lb.
Luke Rockhold and Lyoto Machida face off in New Jersey on Saturday. Rockhold is bidding for his fourth consecutive victory since losing to Vitor Belfort. Machida is also coming off the back of a victory, against CB Dollaway in Brazil.
Conor McGregor says he would 'kill' Floyd Mayweather 'in less than 30 seconds'McGregor is preparing for his world title fight against Jose Aldo in July. Mayweather is currently in training for his $300m mega-fight against Manny Pacquiao.
Ronda Rousey wants to 'find a way' to return to the WWE. The UFC champion made her WWE debut at Wrestlemania 31 with Fast and Furious 7 co-star The Rock. 'I need to find a way (to return), but I have a lot of stuff going on. I'm fighting August 1st,' she said.
Jeff Novitzky has been appointed as the UFC's new Vice President of Athlete Health and Performance. He was also involved in the investigations into Barry Bonds, Marion Jones and Justin Gatlin.
Jimi Manuwa takes on Jan Blachowicz tonight at the O2 Arena in London. The Londoner suffered his first career loss to Alexander Gustafsson in August last year. He believes his 'aggression and killer instinct' will help him finish his opponent inside two rounds.
Mirko 'Cro Crop' Filipovic faces Gabriel Gonzaga in Poland on Saturday. Filipovic was beaten by a first-round head kick by Gonzaga at UFC 70 in 2007. Gonzaga said he does not consider the fight as a rematch because of the gap of eight years.
Conor McGregor says Jose Aldo doesn't want to be near him. The featherweight champion makes the eighth defence of his belt against McGregor in Las Vegas on July 11.
Paula Creamer has called for a Masters tournament for women at Augusta National. The world No 27 suggested a women's event could be staged the week following the men's showpiece in April.
Chad Mendes and Ricardo Lamas meet at the Patriot Centre in Fairfax, Virginia. Mendes is No 1 ranked and Lamas is No 4 ranked in the featherweight division. The bout could potentially determine the next challenger to the title.
Justin Rose returns to action at Zurich Classic of New Orleans this week. Rose finished joint second with Phil Mickelson behind Jordan Spieth at Augusta National. The 34-year-old has not been outside the top 15 on his last three outings at TPC Louisiana.
Conor McGregor is gearing up for a featherweight title challenge against Jose Aldo on July 11. The 26-year-old Irishman has already got a picture of a gorilla eating a heart inked upon his chest. McGregor claims Aldo lacks the same motivation as him.

Lindsey Vonn spoke about her relationship with Tiger Woods on the Late Night With Seth Meyers. The 30-year-old has been dating Woods since 2013 and has become close with his children. Vonn says Woods' children Sam and Charlie are 'great kids' and that he is a 'great father'
Sir Nick Faldo and Tom Watson will compete at The Open at St Andrews in July. Three-time winner Faldo will cross the Swilcan Bridge for the final time on the 25th anniversary of his victory on the Old Course. Watson will be joined by Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy and Phil Mickelson in the Champion Golfers' Challenge on Wednesday, July 15.
Bubba Watson showed off an incredible baseball style trick shot while practicing in China. The 36-year-old flicked the ball to someone in the tree before they dropped it. The ball flew straight down the middle, much to the excitement of his friend behind the camera.
Jim Furyk beat Kevin Kisner on the second play-off hole to win the RBC Heritage title at Hilton Head. The 2010 winner claimed a second title at Harbour Town after coming through a playoff against Kisner. The former US Open champion hit a final round 63 to finish 18-under in regulation play.
Kiradech Aphibarnrat beat Li Hao-tong in a play-off to win Shenzhen International. The 25-year-old produced a brilliant finish to claim his second European Tour title.
Thailand's Kiradech Aphibarnrat takes lead at the Shenzhen International in China. The 25-year-old fired six birdies in the space of nine holes to overtake American Peter Uihlein. Bubba Watson struggled to his second consecutive round of 74 to finish two over par.
Carly Booth is currently in Mauritius for a photo shoot with Golf Punk magazine. The 22-year-old is currently ranked World No 520 as she looks to make her ascent up the table.
Troy Merritt fired a 10-under 61 to equal the course record at Harbour Town Golf Links. Jordan Spieth bounced back from his opening 74 with a nine-under-par round to sit six under. Matt Kuchar is tied for second place with John Merrick, having followed his first-round 68 with a 66.
Rory McIlroy's foundation is hosting the Dubai Duty Free Irish Open. US Open champion Martin Kaymer, Luke Donald and Patrick Reed have all confirmed their participation in the tournament at Royal County Down. The tournament will feature five players who have been world number one and eight major champions.
Jordan Spieth finished the first round of the RBC Heritage on three over par. Spieth admitted lack of preparation affected his first round in South Carolina. Matt Every and Graeme McDowell shared the lead on five under after first round at Hilton Head.
Rory McIlroy battled with Fifty Shades of Grey star Jamie Dornan at a game of Circular Soccer. The World No 1 golfer defeated the film star 2-1 to take the crown, with the deciding goal coming from an impressive long-range finish. The 25-year-old was taking time away from golf after competing at the Masters in Augusta.
Sara Errani beat Agnieszka Radwanska 7-6 (8/6) 6-4 in two hours and eight minutes on Wednesday. World No 9 is the second top seed to exit at the Porsche Tennis Grand Prix in Stuttgart. Ana Ivanovic lost to Caroline Garcia for the third time this year on Tuesday.
Rafael Nadal lost to Fabio Fognini in the third round of the Barcelona Open. The world No 4 lost 6-4, 7-6 (8-6) to the Italian in front of a home crowd. Nadal was looking for his ninth career title on the Catalan clay court. The Spaniard has just one title to his name since winning his 10th French Open last year.
Bubba Watson is four shots off home hope Huang Wen-yi's lead at the Shenzhen International. The American had to settle for an opening-day 70 to sit in joint 17th place. Watson finished 38th at Augusta National on Sunday as Jordan Spieth won.
Jordan Spieth returns to golf just days after winning the Masters. The 21-year-old will play in the RBC Heritage Classic at Sea Pines Resort. Spieth has had two victories and two runner-up finishes in his past four events.
Rafael Nadal beat Nicolas Almagro 6-3 6-1 to reach Barcelona Open third round. World No 4 is looking to win his ninth career title on the Catalan clay court. Nadal will play Fabio Fognini of Italy or Andrey Rublev on Thursday for a place in Friday's quarter-finals.
There will be a capacity of 7,000 for July's match against France at London's Queen's Club, but well under 3,000 tickets may be available to the kind of supporters who created such an electric atmosphere in Glasgow. The rest will go to various organisations and governing bodies, with a considerable percentage going to well-heeled Queen's members. Andy Murray, who has won the AEGON title three times, will lead the GB team in the match that takes place from July 17-19.
Marin Cilic lost to Victor Estrella of the Dominican Republic in the Barcelona Open. The 2014 U.S. Open champion is struggling for fitness and form after a shoulder injury. Santiago Giraldo beat Joao Sousa of Portugal to reach the third round.
Ana Ivanovic lost 7-6 (8/6) 6-4 to France's Caroline Garcia in Stuttgart. World No 29 Garcia had already beaten Ivanovic two previous times this year. Russian Ekaterina Makarova beat the United States' Bethanie Mattek-Sands. Carla Suarez Navarro beat Russia's Evgeniya Rodina in her first round match.
Angelique Kerber of Germany beat Maria Sharapova 2-6, 7-5, 6-1 at the Porsche Grand Prix. Three-time champion had won her previous 13 matches in Stuttgart.
Jose Mourinho was given a tour of Wimbledon by former British No 1 Tim Henman. The Chelsea manager described SW19 as'more than a Grand Slam' due to its traditions and aura. Mourinho revealed that he felt like he was British when Andy Murray won Wimbledon two years ago.
Serena Williams beat Sara Errani 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3 in the Fed Cup play-off on Sunday. World No 1 Williams beat the Italian to take her career record over her to 8-0.
Kei Nishikori beat Teymuraz Gabashvili 6-3 6-4 in the second round of the Barcelona Open. The other seeds to advance to the third round were Roberto Bautista-Agut and Tommy Robredo. Rafael Nadal's first match will be a second-round clash with fellow Spaniard Nicolas Almagro.
Agnieszka Radwanska and Martina Navratilova have parted ways. The pair had announced in December that they would work together. The 2012 Wimbledon runner-up was knocked out in the first round in Stuttgart this week.
Rafael Nadal faces Novak Djokovic in the French Open at Roland Garros in June. The Spaniard has won nine of the last 10 French Open titles, and a tenth overall.
Queen's Club will host the Davis Cup quarter final against France. Andy Murray has won three titles at the All England Club in Baron's Court. The match will be the biggest home tie in three decades for Great Britain.
Jenson Button failed to start the Bahrain Grand Prix after an Energy Recovery System prevented him from making it to the start-line. Kimi Raikkonen secured a record seventh podium finish in Bahrain following his superb late salvo.
Jenson Button stopped on track in each of the practice sessions on Friday due to technical issues. The 35-year-old will start the Bahrain Grand Prix 20th and last. Fernando Alonso managed to get a McLaren into Q2 for the first time this season.
Azerbaijan will stage the European Grand Prix next season. Bernie Ecclestone has given Azerbaijan the all-clear ahead of its debut next season despite serious concerns over the country's human rights record. Human Rights Watch's 2015 report on Azerbaijan stated there had been 'a dramatic deterioration in its already poor rights record'Ecclestone maintains F1 has conducted its due diligence on Azerbaijan.
Novak Djokovic beat Tomas Berdych 7-5 4-6 6-3 in the Monte Carlo Open final. World No 1 is the first player to win the opening three ATP World Tour Masters 1000 events.
Lewis Hamilton qualified on pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix on Saturday. Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg was third six-tenths of a second behind the Briton. Hamilton has got pole position in every race this season and leads Rosberg by 17 points.
Jenson Button failed to start the Bahrain Grand Prix from the back of the grid. The British driver broke down in qualifying and was forced to watch the race from the sidelines. Button took to Twitter to update his fans following yet another car failure.
Lewis Hamilton took pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix on Saturday. Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel was beaten to pole by Hamilton by four tenths of a second. Hamilton's Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg qualified second and third. Jenson Button's McLaren broke down with him having done one sector of one lap.
Kimi Raikkonen's contract expires at the end of the current Formula One season. Ferrari team principal Maurizio Arrivabene has urged the Finn to improve his performances. The 35-year-old has finished fourth in the last two races in Malaysia and China.
Ferrari team principal Maurizio Arrivabene has revealed to using a carrot-and-stick method with Kimi Raikkonen to keep his desire to remain with the Maranello marque high. The Finn finished second behind Lewis Hamilton at the Bahrain Grand Prix on Sunday.
Nico Rosberg finished 0.115secs quicker than team-mate Lewis Hamilton in Friday practice. The Mercedes driver described Ferrari's pace as 'dangerous' and 'worrying'Rosberg trails Hamilton by 17 points in the drivers' standings ahead of Sunday's race.
Hamilton has yet to put pen to paper on a new contract with Mercedes. He says that only small details need finalising, but until the ink is dry there are no guarantees he will stay. That leaves the door ajar for Hamilton to team up with Sebastian Vettel at Ferrari.
Davy Condon was riding Portrait King in the Grand National at Aintree. The Irish jockey suffered spinal concussion in a fall at the third-last of the race. It was the second time within a year that the rider had suffered a similar injury. Condon has been advised to retire after seeing a specialist on Wednesday.
Ride Like The Wind is one of 34 colts which remain in the first Classic of the season run on Saturday, May 2. Trainer Freddy Head likens his 2,000 Guineas hope to last year's fifth-placed runner Charm Spirit, who landed three Group One races in 2014.
Jenson Button's McLaren suffered an electrical fault just three minutes into the first practice session on Friday. The 35-year-old was forced into a spin at turn one of the Bahrain International Circuit. Button finished in 19th place, sandwiched between Will Stevens and Roberto Merhi, with the best of his 19 laps almost 4.5 seconds off the pace of Nico Rosberg.
Robbie McNamara broke eight ribs, cracked six vertebrae and has no feeling in his legs. The jockey was due to partner last year's Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Lord Windermere in the Crabbie's Grand National at Aintree. McNamara says he is feeling 'great and optimistic' as he continues to recover from serious injuries.
McCoy has confirmed he will ride to the final race at Sandown on Saturday if he can secure mounts. There had been speculation that the soon-to-be-crowned 20-time champion jockey would end his career after riding in the AP McCoy Celebration Chase, in which he definitely partners Mr Mole, or the feature Bet365 Gold Cup.
Ian Wright will present AP McCoy with his 20th champion jockeys trophy at Sandown on Saturday. McCoy is a huge Arsenal supporter and has been invited to attend a home game before the end of the season.
Saracens host Northampton Saints at the AJ Bell Stadium on Saturday. Northampton were dumped out of the Champions Cup quarter-finals by Clermont Auvergne. Harlequins full back Ugo Monye is hanging up his boots at the end of the season.
Jack Cosgrove has agreed to join Edinburgh next season on a two-year deal. The 20-year-old Worcester Warriors prop has been capped nine times for the Dark Blues Under 20s side.
Ulster back Michael Allen will join Edinburgh at the end of the season. The 24-year-old joins Alan Solomons' side on a two-year deal. Allen has never lived outside of Ireland and admits he is a 'homebird'
Mariano Galarza played for Gloucester against Sale Sharks despite being ineligible. The Aviva Premiership side lost 23-6 at the A J Bell Stadium on March 29. Gloucester face a Rugby Football Union hearing on Monday, April 27.
Saracens No 8 Billy Vunipola, Toulon flanker Steffon Armitage and Clermont full back Nick Abendanon have all been shortlisted for the European Player of the Year award.
Davy McGregor suffered the ear injury while playing for Heriot's Racing Club against the Barbarians. The Irish hooker was caught by an opponent's hip or shorts - leaving a truly horrifying sight. McGregor is on his way to a plastic surgeon to try and salvage what was left of his ear.
Manu Tuilagi has been out of action since October with a groin injury. The Leicester Tigers centre has not featured for England since the three-Test summer tour of New Zealand in 2014. The 23-year-old is targeting a return to action in time for England's pre-World Cup preparations.
England full back Mike Brown could miss the rest of the season with concussion. The 29-year-old was knocked out in the RBS 6 Nations against Italy in February. Brown has continued to suffer headaches and has been advised not to play. Harlequins director of rugby Conor O'Shea has ruled Brown out of Saturday's match against Sale.
Mike Fitzgerald has helped the Chiefs win two Super Rugby titles. The 28-year-old will follow Waratahs wing Peter Betham to Welford Road next season.
Matt Giteau has not played for Australia since the 2011 World Cup in New Zealand. The 32-year-old fly half missed out on selection for the 2011 New Zealand World Cup. Australia will pick 'elite' players based abroad if they have 60 caps and seven years of professional service at home.
Andy Farrell says rugby union is going to be the sport of the year with the World Cup coming up in England. England must name a 31-man World Cup squad by August 31.
Players with 60 caps who have held professional contract with Australian Rugby for at least seven years will be eligible to continue their international careers even if they are signed to a club overseas. Australian Rugby Union reacted to the flood of top players heading abroad on Wednesday with a groundbreaking policy shift which will allow experienced Wallabies playing at foreign clubs to be selected for test matches.
England lead West Indies by 74 runs at stumps on day three of the second Test in Grenada. Alastair Cook got 76 in a century stand with Jonathan Trott (59) at the top before Gary Ballance's 77 boosted his 165-run partnership with Root. The score of 373 for six was also down to some impressive batting from the top order.
England captain Alastair Cook is 118 not out at stumps on day three of the second Test against the West Indies at the National Cricket Stadium in St George's, Grenada. Joe Root scored his sixth Test century for England and his first overseas. The Yorkshireman is the fifth England batsman to score six consecutive 50s in Test innings.
Marlon Samuels sent Ben Stokes on his way with a military-style salute. Stokes had given his wicket away just before the close of the third day when he smashed a Devendra Bishoo long-hop straight to deep square leg. The gesture was seen as good 'banter' by Geoffrey Boycott.
Alastair Cook and Jonathan Trott are the sixth English pair to score more than 100 runs together on 10 occasions. New Zealand all-rounder Corey Anderson could miss the Test series in England with a broken finger.
Stuart Broad took three wickets for 19 as England bowled West Indies out for 299. Alastair Cook and Jonathan Trott reached 74 without loss at stumps on day two. Broad backed Cook to hit a big hundred and put England in a winning position.
Aaron Finch had surgery on his left hamstring on Tuesday. The batsman sustained the injury playing for the Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League. The 28-year-old will be sidelined for up to three months.
Alastair Cook passed Alec Stewart's 8,463 runs to become England's second highest Test run-scorer. Stuart Broad bowled beyond 90mph for the first time since returning from surgery while claiming three wickets for 19.
Zara Phillips was due to make her Kentucky Horse Park debut on High Kingdom. The Queen's granddaughter pulled out of the three-day event after High Kingdom suffered a cut leg. Phillips won silver in the team Equestrian section of the eventing at London 2012. High Kingdom is entered for the Badminton Horse Trials, which begin on May 7.
San Antonio Spurs beat Los Angeles Clippers 100-73 in Game 3 on Friday. Kawhi Leonard scored 32 points as the Spurs took a 2-1 lead in the first-round series. Houston Rockets moved to within one win of a place in the next round with a 130-128 win over Dallas. Houston's James Harden and Dwight Howard set personal play-off bests in points and rebounds. Washington leads Toronto Raptors 3-0 with a 106-99 victory over the Raptors.
Alastair Cook's former team-mate Graeme Swann pointed out when the England captain's form took a turn for the worse. Adil Rashid was made to wait for his Test debut after much discussion on day one. Devon Smith became the first Grenadan ever to score a Test run in Grenada. Joe Root 'wasn't a massive fan' after the first time he faced James Anderson.
Ben Stokes and Marlon Samuels were involved in a heated exchange on day one of the second Test in Grenada. West Indies toiled to 188-5 after being bowled out for 188 on the opening day of the match by Stuart Broad. Stokes had earlier twisted his hip on the outfield and had lengthy treatment on the pitch.
Movistar rider Valverde sprinted to victory ahead of Julian Alaphilippe and Michael Albasini. Team Sky's Chris Froome fell in the closing 12km but fought on to finish the race.
Ronnie O'Sullivan beat Craig Steadman 10-3 in the first round of the World Snooker Championship. The five-time world champion had trouble with his shoes during the session on Tuesday. The 39-year-old could have faced a £250 fine for breach of dress code. But tournament officials decided there was no case of a dress code breach to answer.
Reanne Evans saw her 10-year reign as women's world snooker champion come to a shock end on Tuesday. The 29-year-old lost 4-2 in the semi-finals to Hong Kong's Ng On Yee, who went on to defeat England's Emma Bonney in the final.
Michael van Gerwen beat James Wade 7-0. World No 1 Anderson lost 7-1 to Stephen Bunting. Raymond van Barneveld beat Dave Chisnall 7-5. Phil Taylor drew 6-6 with Adrian Lewis.
Washington, Cleveland and Houston all earned 2-0 leads in their NBA first-round playoff series with victories on Tuesday. All five of the series that have played two games now stand at two-0, with the Wizards, Cavaliers and Rockets joining Monday's winners Chicago and Golden State with the early two-game buffer in the best-of-seven series. Washington's 117-106 victory at Toronto owed most to John Wall, who had 26 points and 17 assists, and Bradley Beal, who scored 28 points. Cleveland shook off a persistent Boston to win 99-91 at home, with LeBron James leading the way with 30 points and Kyrie Irving contributing 26.
Judd Trump beat Stuart Carrington 10-6 in the first round of the World Championship. The 25-year-old will now face Marco Fu in the next round on Thursday. Trump led Carrington 7-2 at the interval but Carrington closed the gap to three.
Paula Radcliffe said she 'was close to pulling out' of the London Marathon on Sunday. The 41-year-old feared a degenerative injury to her foot would rule her out. Radcliffe turned to German doctor Hans-Wilhelm Muller-Wohlfahrt, who has worked with the likes of Ronaldo, Michael Owen and Usain Bolt.
Ding Jinhui was on for a maxumum break of 147 before screwing back for the blue instead of the black. Ding potted 12 reds and 12 blacks to rack up 96 points but screwed back up the table to get position on the blue. The world No 3 realised what he had done and held his head in his hands before starting to giggle.
Chicago Bulls beat Milwaukee Bucks 91-82 to take 2-0 lead in first-round series. Jimmy Butler scored 31 points as Bulls beat Bucks for second straight game. Klay Thompson scored 26 points as Golden State Warriors beat New Orleans Pelicans 97-87.
Golden State Warriors beat New Orleans Pelicans 123-119 in overtime. Stephen Curry scored 40 points, including a 3-pointer in the final seconds of regulation. Chicago Bulls beat Milwaukee Bucks 113-106 in double overtime. Cleveland Cavaliers beat Boston Celtics 103-95 to lead series 3-0.

The Magpies slumped to a sixth straight defeat at home to Spurs last weekend amid an atmosphere of unrest after thousands of supporters boycotted the match in protest at a lack of ambition and investment from owner Mike Ashley. Fans group AshleyOut.com are encouraging supporters to 'Stand Up To Ashley’ when Swansea visit St James’ Park on Saturday.

Nigel Pearson is keen for the 34-year-old to stay but that may depend on their Premier League status. Leicester are currently 18th in the Premier League and face Burnley on Saturday.

Inverness Thistle beat Celtic 3-2 after extra-time in the Scottish Cup Final. Celtic wrote to the SFA to seek 'clarification' on the reasons for referee Steven McLean and his four assistants missing the first-half incident.

Brown was part of the Ibrox side which contested an Old Firm Scottish Cup final with two trophies already banked. Smith believes both men deserve to be remembered for what they did during his own highly successful second spell at Rangers.

Police believe the images may help track down key witnesses who may be able to help. The appeal is part of an ongoing Home Office inquiry into the disaster which claimed 96 lives.

Thiago Alcantara would never have signed for Manchester United even if David Moyes had wanted him. But the fact that Moyes wasn't keen on the transfer - 'not his type' said a club source - was probably an early indication that he wasn't the right fit for United. United's need for passing quality from deep midfield was apparent throughout Moyes' short time at the club. The kind of passing display Thiago delivered in Bayern Munich's 6-1 win over Porto on Wednesday has been precisely what United have been missing.
Southampton are the club punching heaviest above their weight in the Premier League in terms of performance compared with wages paid to players. Chelsea are 10 points clear at the top of the table but are only the third-highest payers with a wage bill of £192.7m. Third-placed Manchester United have the highest wage bill at £215.8m, based on last season's figures.

Top-seeded teams in eight groups will be the defending Champions League winner plus title holders in the seven highest-ranked countries. Arsenal, Atletico Madrid and Porto will drop in status in the August 27 draw. Real Madrid would also drop down if Barcelona wins the Champions League and Spanish league.

Kenny Bayless will referee Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao on May 2. The match is billed as the biggest and richest in boxing history. Bayless has overseen five of Mayweather's previous fights, including his pro debut against Roberto Apodaca in 1996. Oscar De La Hoya believes Mayweather will benefit from Bayless' appointment.
Andy Murray tied the knot with Kim Sears at Dunblane Cathedral on Saturday afternoon. Hundreds of well-wishers gathered on the streets around the cathedral to greet the couple. Murray tweeted his plans for the day through the use of emojis and it would appear he's counting on plenty of laughter, kissing and alcohol.
Glenn Roeder and Adam Pearson are part of a new management team at Sheffield Wednesday. Roeder is a former Watford, West Ham and Newcastle boss. Adam Pearson helped lead Hull City to the Premier League last season.
Xabi Alonso could become only the second player to win the Champions League with three different teams. The only other player to have done so is AC Milan legend Clarence Seedorf, who lifted the famous piece of silverware for Ajax, Real Madrid and Milan.
There are 23 current and former Premier League players still involved in Europe's top competition. Cristiano Ronaldo, Patrice Evra, Carlos Tevez, Paul Pogba, Dimitar Berbatov, Gerard Pique, plus Javier Hernandez who is on loan at Real Madrid are among them.
Tim Sherwood has had an inspired start in charge of Aston Villa. The club have reached the FA Cup final against Liverpool on Saturday.
West Ham lost 2-0 to Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday. Sam Allardyce was incensed that a foul by Eliaquim Mangala on Stewart Downing was missed. Referee Anthony Taylor took no action as the ball ran out of play. The Hammers boss launched a furious rant at fourth official Robert Madley on the touchline.
West Ham lost 2-0 to Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday. James Collins and Sergio Aguero scored comical own goals for the champions. Carl Jenkinson insists West Ham are determined to ensure their season does not end with a whimper.
Bayern Munich face Manchester City in the Champions League quarter-finals. Pep Guardiola is the man Txiki Begiristain would like to install at the Etihad Stadium in 2016. The 44-year-old is facing his first Champions League exit prior to the semi-final stages of his coaching career and at the hands of relatively inconsequential opposition too.
Martina Hingis lost 6-4, 6-0 to Agnieszka Radwanska in the Fed Cup against Poland. The 34-year-old was persuaded to play because of injuries in the Switzerland team. The Swiss star won five grand slam singles titles before her 18th birthday.
Memphis Depay is a target for Manchester United and Liverpool. The 21-year-old has been compared to a young Cristiano Ronaldo by Ronald de Boer. De Boer believes United could have the edge over Liverpool in a battle for the Holland star.
Arsenal's FA Cup semi-final victory over Reading clashed with a top Premier League fixture on Saturday. Both organisations blame each other for their respective rights holders, Sky and the BBC, scheduling the marquee Chelsea vs Manchester United league match. Luke Shaw enjoyed one of his better games against Chelsea in a season when he rates his own performances as C minus. Kevin Pietersen is the elephant in the room, even at England’s sleepy Sugar Ridge Hotel on the day after the first Test.
Liverpool have been given permission to install a 4.5metre fine mesh privacy screen at their Melwood base. The club had grown concerned over confidential team details being leaked prior to matches. Local residents wanted a designated area for fans to be able to watch training and did not want a screen up.
Steven Gerrard was denied the chance to end his Liverpool career in this season's FA Cup final against Aston Villa on his 35th birthday. Liverpool lost 1-0 to Aston Villa in Sunday's semi-final at Villa Park. Gerrard's final game at Anfield will come in the league against Crystal Palace on May 16.
Manchester United were defeated 1-0 by Chelsea at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Louis van Gaal's side are ten points clear at the top of the Premier League with six games to play. The Red Devils are considering an approach for Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba in the summer.
Eden Hazard has been named 'one of the three best players in the world' by Jose Mourinho. The Chelsea manager has praised the Belgian's exceptional talent and unwavering humility. Hazard scored the winner in the 1-0 victory over Manchester United on Sunday.
Brendan Rodgers could see up to 10 of his stars leave this summer. Steven Gerrard has already agreed to join MLS side LA Galaxy. Kolo Toure and Glen Johnson are both out of contract and set to go on a free transfer. Raheem Sterling is embroiled in a contract stand-off with Manchester City certain to make an offer.
Michael Conlan has booked his place at Rio 2016 Olympic Games alongside Paddy Barnes. Both Belfast boxers were in action for the Italia Thunder franchise in Venezuela on Saturday night. Conlan dropped his opponent in the first round en route to claiming a 49-45 victory on two of the judges’ cards while the remaining judge questionably scored the fight 48-47 in Yoel Finol’s favour. The 23-year-old leapt to No 2 in the WSB bantamweight rankings, claiming the second 56kg Olympic spot on offer.
Amir Khan could be set to face Manny Pacquiao in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. Khan has been so close to fighting Mayweather that he could smell the resin and hear the roar of the crowd. Khan is the stand-by for Mayweather had Mayweather refused the Fight of the Century. Mayweather will conclude his enriching six-fight contract with Showtime cable network in September.
Juventus are monitoring Raheem Sterling's situation at Liverpool. Manchester City, Chelsea, Real Madrid, Paris St Germain and Bayern Munich are all among Sterling's admirers. Juventus want at least £55m for Paul Pogba and have bid for Belgian Axel Witsel.
Aston Villa beat Liverpool 2-1 in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley on Sunday. Christian Benteke and Fabian Delph scored to reach the final against Arsenal. Tom Cleverley says Tim Sherwood's attacking style is paying off for Aston Villa.
Manuel Pellegrini should have given Frank Lampard more game time. Phil Jagielka is five games away from going a complete season without getting a single booking on club duty. Tom Cleverley has found a steely edge since Tim Sherwood took charge at Aston Villa.
David Moyes succeeded Sir Alex Ferguson as Manchester United manager in 2013. Rooney was heavily linked with a move to Stamford Bridge at the same time. Moyes gave a 16-year-old Rooney his professional debut at Everton in 2002.

Mayweather's cut is to be in excess of £80m before a range of other means of income from the fight are split by Mayweather Promotions.

Manchester United lost 1-0 to Chelsea at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game for the Premier League leaders. Wayne Rooney and Louis van Gaal were happy with their display.
Marouane Fellaini has been in superb form for Manchester United in recent weeks. Blues goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois believes his side have a plan to deal with his style of play. Blues face United at Stamford Bridge on Saturday afternoon in the Premier League.
Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game in the 38th minute to put the Blues ahead.
Eden Hazard opened the scoring for Chelsea with a low shot past David de Gea in the first half at Stamford Bridge. Didier Drogba scored a late consolation goal for Jose Mourinho's side.
Manchester United were denied a late penalty against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge. Ander Herrera went over under the challenge of Gary Cahill but referee Mike Dean adjudged the Spaniard to have dived. Jose Mourinho reignited talk of a campaign against Chelsea, even after taking a huge step towards the Barclays Premier League title.
Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game to move Chelsea within two wins of winning the title. Manager Jose Mourinho has warned his players they still have work to do.
Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 to move 10 points clear at the top of the table. Eden Hazard's goal was enough to give Jose Mourinho's side all three points at Stamford Bridge. Blues captain John Terry insists there is still work to be done if they are to clinch title.
Bournemouth drew 2-2 with Sheffield Wednesday at Dean Court on Saturday. Chris Maguire converted an injury time penalty to salvage a point for Sheffield Wednesday. Bournemouth have gone from top to third to second to top to second again in the space of one game.

Radamel Falcao hasn't scored or had a shot on target for Manchester United since January 31 against Leicester. Striker has failed to score in 10 Premier League games for United since joining on season-long loan from Monaco.
Andres Iniesta made his Barcelona debut during the 2002-03 season. Louis van Gaal was Barca manager at the time of Iniesta's debut. Iniesta has praised Van Gaal for helping him make the breakthrough into the first team.
Arsenal beat Reading 1-0 in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley Stadium. Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez opened the scoring for Arsene Wenger's side. Garath McCleary equalised for Reading with a deflected volley. But Adam Federici's goalkeeping error enabled Arsenal to regain the lead in extra time.
Manchester United are to introduce the living wage at Old Trafford in July. All Premier League clubs have agreed to pay full-time staff at least £7.85 an hour from 2016-17 season. But United officials have decided to implement the salary a year early. Chelsea became the first professional club in England to pay a living wage.
Manchester United host Manchester City in the Premier League on Sunday. Wayne Rooney is the leading United scorer in derby history with 11 goals. United have lost their last four meetings against their biggest rivals, but Rooney is determined to put an end to that sequence this weekend.
Everton beat Burnley 1-0 in the Premier League at Goodison Park on Saturday. Kevin Mirallas opened the scoring on his return to the first team for the Toffees. Ashley Barnes was sent off on the stroke of half-time for two fouls on James McCarthy and Seamus Coleman.
Rotor Volgograd have been wound up after going bankrupt. The Russian outfit beat Manchester United 2-2 in the UEFA Cup in 1995. Manchester United crashed out of the competition on away goals after a 0-0 draw in Russia. Rotor lost their professional status in 2005 but reformed a year later.
Steven Naismith has won the Barclays Spirit of the Game Award. The Toffees forward is the latest recipient of the award for his selfless charity work and contributions to the local community. The 28-year-old has worked with Job Centre Plus, Dyslexia Scotland and the Whitechapel Centre in Liverpool.
Roberto Martinez says Burnley's players remind him of his old side Wigan. The Spaniard says Sean Dyche has instilled a fearlessness into his squad.

Baines has scored 15 penalties from 16 attempts in the league this season. Roberto Martinez insists Barkley was within his rights to request penalty-taking duties.

Mayweather's promoter, Leonard Ellerbe, said Tuesday that tickets would be on sale this week. But MGM officials have been tight-lipped about their availability.

Brendan Rodgers leads Liverpool to the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa on Sunday. Rodgers believes cup glory would help his players develop a stronger winning mentality. The 42-year-old is looking to lead Liverpool to an eighth FA Cup victory and his first piece of silverware since replacing Kenny Dalglish as manager in 2012.
Stoke City are 17th in the Premier League Fair Play table. Mark Hughes believes Tom Jones' song 'Delilah' is costing them a spot in the Europe League via the Fair Play League. The Potters' faithful have been singing Jones' hit as their unofficial club anthem since the the 1980s.

Real Madrid kick off their La Liga campaign against Malaga on Saturday evening. Karim Benzema has been ruled out of Real Madrid's clash with Malaga.

Sean Goss levelled the scoreline in the 32nd minute by wriggling past Leicester's defence before scoring past the helpless Adam Smith. Robin van Persie and Jonny Evans both enjoyed gentle re-introductions into the game. Rafael and Adnan Januzaj both limped off in the 44th minute after sustaining rib injuries.

Monaco host Juventus at the Stade Louis II on Wednesday in the quarter-final first leg. Juventus are 15 points clear at the top of the Serie A standings and well poised after Arturo Vidal's penalty winner in Turin last Tuesday.

Manchester United, Chelsea and Liverpool are all interested in signing the 24-year-old. Southampton are willing to make Clyne one of the best paid players at the club.

Brook had been desperate to face Amir Khan at Wembley in June but his compatriot ruled out a fight until at least later in the year.

The Norwegian manager said it would serve no purpose for the defender to be given a retrospective suspension by the SFA. FIFA's head of referees Jim Boyce says the suspension of a player for an unpunished handball is wrong.
Manchester City will not compromise on quality in their search for homegrown players this summer. Manuel Pellegrini watched City's academy in their FA Youth Cup final against Chelsea on Monday. City need eight homegrown players for their first-team squad next season to meet guidelines set out by the Premier League and are in danger of losing at least four. Frank Lampard, Scott Sinclair and Micah Richards will all leave while Richard Wright is expected to follow.

Mauricio Pochettino has questioned the logic of blooding more academy players. Harry Kane, Nabil Bentaleb and Ryan Mason are all products of Spurs' youth system. The trio have taken giant strides in the senior set-up this season.
Tranmere are one point behind Cheltenham and two behind Hartlepool in the National League. Barnet and Bristol Rovers battle for automatic promotion to the Football League will go down to the last game.

John Helm was commentating on Bradford City’s game against Lincoln City when the fire broke out and still struggles to listen to his description of that fatal day. The tragic fire at Bradford City's Valley Parade stadium claimed 56 victims and injured 265 on May 11, 1985. Helm: 'There isn’t a jot of evidence to suggest the blaze was caused deliberately'
Bryan Habana scored the decisive try in extra-time against Leinster. Toulon were reduced to 14 men when Ali Williams was sin-binned for taking out Devin Toner in the air. Ian Madigan's long pass was intercepted by Bryan Habana in the 90th minute.
Sir Oliver Popplewell says police should look at eight other fires allegedly connected to the then club chairman to'see if there was anything sinister'New book claims Bradford's Valley Parade stadium was one of at least nine blazes at businesses owned by or associated with the club's then chairman Stafford Heginbotham.
Gerry Sutcliffe does not believe a new inquiry into the Bradford fire is justified. He says he knew Heginbotham 'flew by the seat of his pants' in terms of finances of the club. But he remains convinced by the conclusion of the inquiry by high court judge Mr Justice Popplewell that the fire was an accident.
Stuart McCall's father, Andy, was one of the 56 people killed in the Bradford fire. Stuart McCall and his father were reunited with their father in Wakefield hospital. Martin Fletcher, a Bradford fan who lost three generations of his family in the tragedy, believes the fire was not an accident and says he and his family are no longer willing to ‘live the myth’
Liverpool boxer Paul Smith is in line to take on Andre Ward on June 20. The fight will be staged in Oakland, California and will run over the 12-round distance. The 31-year-old has not fought since November 2013 and has not won a fight since.
Carl Froch has expressed his desire to fight Julio Cesar Chavez Jr in Las Vegas. Former middleweight world champion was stopped in nine rounds by Andrzej Fonfara. The 37-year-old has not fought since knocking out George Groves at Wembley last May.
Manuel Pellegrini's future at the Etihad Stadium is under scrutiny. Former Arsenal midfielder Patrick Vieira is highly-respected at the club. City's first-choice managerial option remains Bayern Munich boss Pep Guardiola. The Spaniard is set to remain with the German giants until the end of next season.
The Jungle Bar is being developed by Icelandic duo Búi Bjarmar Aðalsteinsson and Stefán Atli Thoroddsen through their company Crowbar Protein. It contains dates, sesame, sunflower and pumpkin seeds, chocolate and cricket flour. To make the bar, the team has cricket flour sent in, from farm-raised crickets that have been ground down. It is then mixed with the other ingredients to make the unusual bar. Cricket flour is useful because it contains a lot of minerals, vitamins and nutrients that are essential for the human body.
A Russian YouTuber has captured the terrifying moment a stream of soil flowed down a bank next to a main road, crushing trees in its powerful path and leaving toppled power lines in its wake. The eerie phenomenon is called an 'earthflow' and is a rare type of landslide. Alexander Giniyatullin kept a remarkably steady hand filming the scary scene in the Kemerovo Region of Russia.
Nicholas Tooth, 25, was playing for the Quirindi Lions against Narrabri Blue Boars in mid-north NSW on Saturday when he collapsed after hitting his head on an opponent's shoulder. He was treated at the ground before being airlifted to Newcastle's John Hunter Hospital in a critical condition but died in hospital late on Sunday. Tributes have poured in for the young man, who has been remembered as a 'great bloke' by friends.
Study found women read magazines 'infrequently' but checked Facebook every few hours. Women aged 17 to 25 were found to judge themselves alongside pictures of friends rather than celebrities in magazines.
Third-party warranty firm SquareTrade claims Galaxy S6 Edge can bend and shatter under 110lbs (50kg) of pressure. It also tested the HTC One M9 both deformed and broke at 120lbs (54kg)Samsung has now responded with its own video, demonstrating a three-point bend test on both models.
Video of the unidentified woman's robust display at the Arena Football League game has over 300,000 views on YouTube. The Flex Cam is a stadium tradition in which a camera rolls around the audience so that they can display their muscles.
Haim Kaplan captured the moment a group of baboons robbed a supply truck of its snacks. The 40-second-clip was recorded at the Ngorongoro Conservation Area in Tanzania. The man is forced to retreat as one makes a lunge at him and another jumps into the back of the truck.
Dr Sandra Lee is a dermatologist at the Skin Physicians & Surgeons practice in Upland, California, and a regular guest on The Doctors talk show. But online she is known simply as Dr Pimple Popper, a moniker she used when she started posting clips of her patients' extractions on her YouTube channel. The clips have earned her nearly 60,000 subscribers, and loyal fan base of zit squeezing enthusiasts on Reddit.
Bus monitor Karen Huff Klein, 71, was tormented by middle school students in Greece, New York in a difficult-to-watch 10-minute video in 2012. Now, one of the students has been accused of forcing a special-needs student to drink urine from a toilet while holding his crotch. The bullying was videotaped and posted on Snapchat. Mrs Klein said that the middle-schoolers who verbally attacked her 'didn't learn any lessons'
Hairdressers in the Taiwanese capital Taipei are giving furry customers outlandish makeovers. The craze involves having your pet pooch shaped into a sphere or a square - with the desired effect being a more eye-grabbing and clean-cut look.
Indonesian President Joko Widodo has confirmed executions of Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran are 'only a matter of time'The pair are set to face the firing squad alongside eight other drug felons as soon as all appeals have concluded. The pair lost their most recent appeal for clemency however three of the other death row prisoners are still awaiting the results of their appeals.
John Lahiff, 70, was playing golf on Monday at the Palmer Sea Reef Golf Course, owned by Clive Palmer. He believes he accidentally stood on a sunbaking crocodile on the 11th hole, causing the croc to swiftly retaliate. He received puncture wounds on his leg and foot, including one down to the bone. Mr Lahiff says he has no qualms about returning to the green, explaining he will be sure to steer clear of crocodiles in future and ensure he doesn't hit balls in the water.
Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route opened to the public today in Japan. It is located between a 65ft high snow cavern and the winding track of Murodo in Tateyama. Over a million people visit the walls every year, but numbers dropped to 910,000 last year.
Balestrino was captured in all its spooky wonder by a drone. The ancient Tuscan settlement, based 40 miles south east of Genoa, is shrouded in mystery. Little is known about the origin or history of the town that dates back to the 11th century A.D. Residents were forced to flee their homes in the town more than 60 years ago due to earthquakes.
Manchester City are four points clear at the top of the Premier League table. Manuel Pellegrini and Txiki Begiristain may have big plans to revamp the team in the summer. Yaya Toure and Samir Nasri are among the high-profile casualties. But what if Liverpool reel them in over the next six matches?
St Catherine's Island, off the coast of Tenby, Pembrokeshire, will now be accessible via footbridge for the first time. The Welsh fort, which defended Britain from French invasion, will be joined to the mainland thanks to a 328ft footbridge. Currently, the fort can only be reached by crossing a beach during low tide, which happens for only six hours per day.
Scott Kaiser filmed the back of the large pelican sitting on a post overlooking the water in Santa Barbara, California. Bird lifts its head all the way back and opens its mouth to show off the size difference between the two parts of its beak.
Adam Prowse, 34, of Torquay, was captured on camera dancing to a series of songs from Michael Jackson’s Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough to Pharrel Williams' Happy. The Royal Mail worker has been dubbed 'the happiest postman in the world'
Patrick Miller and Damien Rigden stayed at a 'horrendous' hotel in Cyprus. Patrick Miller, a self-employed personal trainer, created the video for friends back home. The three-and-a-half minute video, titled ‘Never let him book a hotel again’, shows dirty rooms, antiquated or broken amenities and a swimming pool no one would dare to enter. Patrick said in the video he allowed Damien to book the room, and they thought they would be staying at a four-star hotel for three nights.
Julie Stauch, Sean Bagniewski and Vidhya Reddy all appear on the video. They are part of a diverse group of people - from young mothers and people preparing for retirement, to Spanish-speaking brothers preparing to start a business and an Asian-American college graduate looking for her first job. But far from being 'everyday Americans', they are directly involved with the Democrat party - just like Jared Milrad and Nate Johnson, from Chicago, Illinois.

The cultural centre is hoped to be housed in former arts and crafts school, La Llotja, following an refurbishment of the now abandoned building.
Incredible footage was shot at Domodedovo Airport in Russia. It shows a man lying in the foetal position seemingly away with the fairies.
Lewis Moody is undertaking a 100km trek to the North Pole to raise £250,000 for charity. Plane forced to make emergency landing due to poor visibility between Svalbard and ice camp Barneo. Moody, 36, and his fellow trekkers were unharmed in the incident.
The dog named Teeny is captured on video sat opposite Eric Ko – a trainer with over ten years’ experience – of the Dogaroo centre in Hong Kong. The pair hold onto push-up bars with their front paws and hands respectively and wait for the trainer's command before getting into position.
Study found the cracking is caused by the rapid formation of a gas-filled cavity within a slippery substance called synovial fluid that lubricates the space between the finger bones. A knuckle cracks in less than 310 milliseconds and water rushing together causes a white flash. Experiment was made possible by magnetic resonance imaging and a study co-author's finger.
Zoo keepers place food in barrels to stimulate the lions, as it replicates the challenges faced when the animals feed in the wild. The animal, hoping to beat two other lions to the food, reaches in too far and gets its head stuck. The other lions chase after the barrel as the distressed animal runs around in a circle.
Cats and People is based in Moscow and invites cat lovers to bring their pets along with them when they go for a cup of tea. All of the cats that live at the cafe were rescued from a local shelter and have each been vaccinated and chipped. Customers are allowed to adopt the cats but only if they meet certain requirements after an extensive interview.

England cricket team's involvement with multi-billion-pound fraudster Allen Stanford has been defended by West Indies legend Sir Curtly Ambrose. Ambrose was one of the West Indies stars, along with Sir Viv Richards and Richie Richardson, who accompanied Stanford when he flew by helicopter to the Lord's nursery ground in 2008 to launch his five-year deal with England that ended with his arrest and subsequent 110-year jail sentence.
Sky Sports' drastic cost-cutting is being blamed for the demise of the Victory Shield, the home nations international Under 16 tournament. The FA announced this week that England are pulling out of the event with immediate effect. Sky allegedly withdrew their title sponsorship as well as reducing live coverage and wanting further changes to the format and another backer found.
Premier League have turned down a bid from Guinness to replace Barclays as title sponsor. Guinness offered the top flight a huge deal of £135m over three years, a £5m-a-year increase on the payments from Barclays. Premier League clubs are now so wealthy through their TV deals that they can afford to turn down a title sponsorship worth £45m a year. Gary Neville was desperate to get away from Stamford Bridge to get to Nicky Butt's wife's birthday party.

Tura Pitt suffered burns to 65 per cent of her body when she was caught in a bushfire in 2011. The 27-year-old was competing in an ultra-marathon through WA's Kimberley region in September 2011. Ms Pitt revealed she still struggles to overcome her ordeal during a speech on Wednesday. The motivational speaker said just the smell of a barbecue brought back the traumatic moment she was trapped for four hours. She ran her first marathon last month since the fire and clocked a faster time than before she was injured.

Broadcasters could miss out on millions if viewers stream Mayweather vs Pacquiao for free. Live streaming apps such as Periscope and Meerkat have raised the prospect that Sky and US broadcasters Showtime and HBO could miss millions as viewers stream the content between their devices without paying. This opens up the possibility of live sports being streamed across social networks for free, despite broadcasters paying millions of pounds to obtain the rights.

The man, known only as Jason, uploaded the video to YouTube of his unique way of popping a cyst - using a needle, a pair of pliers and a screwdriver. His sister-in-law inserts the needle into the cyst and holds it in place with pliers as he winces. She then begins the horrifying process of hammering the needle deeper into the growth. Dr Arun Ghosh, a private GP in Liverpool, condemned Jason's method of popping his cyst.

Qatar won the final round of voting 14-8 against the USA in the executive committee ballot. The MoS analysis suggests that Qatar spent an astonishing £17.2 billion directly and indirectly on the way to victory. Much of this outlay was on goods and services for Qatar — including aerospace orders, a football club, sponsorship agreements, land and general exposure. There were also millions of pounds of cash payments made to a huge range of football officials from secret slush funds controlled by Qatar’s executive committee member Mohammed bin Hammam.

When the watch was dropped so the display hit the floor first, the screen shattered instantly.

Many of the families were separated when relatives were deported to Mexico after living in the U.S. without documentation. The gate had only been opened to those affected once before, in 2013.

The SPFL are entitled to take 50 per cent of the gate proceeds from the six play-off ties for redistribution among the clubs. Motherwell want to offer free tickets for season ticket holders.
The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham wants dog owners to pick up their pets' droppings and use bins provided. They want owners to submit a DNA sample from the inside of the animal's cheek so it is registered on a database. The council would then use stored information to match the animal responsible with any errant mess found on the streets.

He took her to a care home while he went to Africa for three weeks. But when he returned to pick her up he was told social services had intervened and ruled she could not go home with him.

The Prime Minister 'flatly rejected' the plans, claiming they were drawn up by civil servants on the orders of Mr Alexander. Rodrigo Gularte, 42, asked 'Am I being executed?' as he was being chained up to be transported to the jungle clearing on Nusakambangan island. He and seven other death row inmates were killed by firing squad in the early hours of Wednesday morning. Irish priest appointed to be Gularte's spiritual advisor in his final hours said he talked to Gularte for an hour and a half late on Tuesday night to prepare him for the executions. The convicted drug trafficker was confused about his fate and complained about hearing voices.
Arshdeep Kaur, 14, and her mother Shinder, 38, were travelling from their home in Punjab, northern India, to visit relatives when a group of about half a dozen men began harassing them. The incident took place on a near-empty bus near Moga, some 50 miles from the Pakistani border, in Punjab province. The men grabbed Arshdeep and made several attempts to'molest' her, but instead of defending them, the bus staff joined in the sexual assault.
14 soldiers accused of abusing children as young as nine as they begged for food. French defence ministry has vehemently denied covering up the scandal following revelations it was made aware of the allegations in July last year when it received a leaked UN report.
Ba Van Nguyen was able to fly a CH-47 Chinook, the largest helicopter in the South Vietnamese army, with his three young children and wife out of the city and into the South China Sea. The USS Kirk was too small to allow the helicopter to land, and so he hoovered over as his family jumped out. He then flew back out to sea and jumped from the helicopter seconds before it crashed and sent shrapnel flying everywhere.

The boy had been 'pancaked' between two floors, according to Andrew Olvera, who is heading the team from the U.S. Agency for International Development.
Jeffrey Okafor, 24, is accused of stabbing Carl Beatson-Asiedu to death outside a nightclub. The 19-year-old victim, known as DJ Charmz, had been leaving Club Life Nightclub in Vauxhall's Goding Street. He was leaving with a group of friends after performing a set when a group approached them, court hears. Peter Lama, also 19, was stabbed in the buttock by his friend Abu Mansaray. Jermaine Coker was chased by Junior Ademujimi-Falade but escaped but managed to return to club. Minutes later, Mr Beatson Asiedu was seen staggering along the road before collapsing in the road.

Carl Thompson, 32, has gained an astonishing 30 stone in just three years and is now bed-bound at 65 stone. He is confined to the ground floor flat where he lives alone in Dover, Kent, kept company by a team of NHS carers who come to bathe him and cook for him every day. The 32-year-old spends £200 a week on takeaways and online food shopping. He has not had a job since he was 17 when he worked in a food factory.

The 34-year-old promised to document her travels on a Cal 40 sailboat after being handed inspiration from a retired professor. Liz, who studied Environmental Studies at the University of California in Santa Barbara, jumped at the chance.

Home Secretary said new legislation is urgently needed to update powers of MI5 and GCHQ. But, based on current polling, Parliament would be left deadlocked - with balance of power held by Scottish nationalists opposed to updating the law. If MPs cannot agree on a replacement, Britain’s spies will be unable to track the communications of Islamic State and other terrorists.
Anonymous scientist Bionerd has attracted thousands of subscribers to her YouTube channel for her visits into the Chernobyl exclusion zone, the site of a devastating nuclear explosion 29 years ago on April 26, 1986. She says the most scared she's felt during her six visits was getting dangerously close to a rabid fox and walking by abandoned, dilapidated buildings.
