Eve Stratford, 22, was found with her throat slashed in her Leyton home in 1975. Lynne Weedon, 16, was attacked and raped in an alleyway near her home in Hounslow at 11pm on September 3. Both murders were linked in 2007 after matching DNA was discovered on the victims.
The tiny nipper - measuring just 5.5 inches long - was caught during a 2010 government research trip and its body remained frozen while biologists went about identifying it. This week scientists revealed the dinky creature is a pocket shark - a miniature variation of the more popular kinds. The first pocket shark was found 36 years ago in the Pacific Ocean off the coast of Peru and it's been sitting in a Russian museum since.

Hormone replacement therapy increases a woman's risk of breast cancer up to eight years after she has stopped treatment, scientists have warned. The new findings come from one of the world's largest studies into the effects of HRT - used to ease effects of menopause. The Women's Health Initiative in the US and the Million Women Study in the UK have both revealed strong evidence that HRT increases risk.

The 1954 Bentley R-Type Continental Fastback was estimated to sell for £200,000. But it ended up being sold for £739,212 - a record for the auction house. It was originally commissioned by Welsh racing driver R D Weatherall and painted in his racing colour of purple - the license plate still bears his initials. The Bentley eventually sold to an anonymous British car collector - who faces the task of restoring the car to its former glory.

George, currently 102, proposed on Valentine's Day and will marry for the third time on June 13. The pair will have a combined age of 195, smashing the previous world record of 188 years set by a couple in 2013.

Now the 28-year-old has had to stop kissing her husband of four years, because the saliva on his lips can trigger a painful flare-up. Her condition means that external exposure to water is the main problem, rather than drinking liquid.

Diet Pepsi will no longer contain the sweetener aspartame due to customer fears over its safety. The controversial sweetener has been linked to a range of health problems, although research has shown it to be safe. Diet Pepsi, Caffeine-Free Diet Pepsi and Wild Cherry Diet Pepsi will now contain sucralose, another artificial sweetener commonly known as Splenda.
The discovery was made by researchers in the Atlantic forest of Serra do Japi in the State of São Paulo, Brazil. Called Hylodes japi, it was found to mate underground in secret chambers. Males and females typically find a spot to mate in about five minutes. And the male will cover up the eggs to protect them from predators.

Tony McCoy has been champion jump jockey in Britain and Ireland since 1996. McCoy has ridden in more than 17,000 races and fallen an estimated 1,000 times breaking almost every bone in his body at least once. McCoy announced his retirement in February but it was only the passing of the Grand National and last rides at Cheltenham that made reality hit home.

The game dates back to Australia's goldfields and the first recorded games are believed to have taken place in the late 1790s. Two-up is allowed on ANZAC Day across Returned Servicemen League clubs (RSL) and pubs. New tests pinpoint genetic'markers' in the tumour and determine its aggressiveness. After surgery, the cancer cells are sent to a lab where they are screened. Women can be told within days whether they have a high or low risk of the disease returning. For some women, the test can accurately tell if the risk is as low as five per cent. This is as good as if not better than the odds for those who have chemotherapy.

But on Friday the Iowa Supreme Court determined McKee had actually only won $1.85 because of how the symbols had aligned in the game. The unanimous court ruled that the casino did not have to pay McKee because the game's rules stated that the maximum award was $10,000 and that bonus awards were not allowed.

Dr Adrian Quarterman, of Dundee University, is working on a laser which will convert sun beams into energy. The satellites will orbit the earth, covered in mirrors to help it harvest the sunlight and convert it into laser light. Energy it creates, using semi-conductors, can be shot back down to earth. If it works, it could mean solar power could even become viable in Scotland.

Xie Xu met his 19-year-old classmate Zhang Chi when the pair began attending school together at Daxu High School in Xuzhou, a large city in the northern province of Jiangsu, in China. Zhang suffers from muscular dystrophy, a condition that weakens skeletal muscle which often makes it very difficult for those with the disease to walk or carry their own weight. Each day Xie carries Zhang from their rooms to the school, and back again, and helps him with daily tasks such as getting meals and washing clothes.

The antibiotic-resistant bacteria can cause potentially fatal infections in bloodstream and urine. Duchess of Cambridge hopes to have her baby at the Lindo Wing, where Prince George was born.

Royals pitcher Yordano Ventura was handed a seven-game suspension, fellow starter Edinson Volquez given five games and Lorenzo Cain and reliever Kelvin Herrera got two games each. The father-of-three was bitten some eight times by two hundred-pound cane corsos while jogging in Metamora Township, 45 miles northwest of Detroit, in July. The two have been in custody for months and were facing a second-degree murder charge before making the plea deal.

Electronic devices such as mobile phones are responsible for 30 per cent of all parental distractions.
Footage captured on a CCTV camera near an office in Shimla, India, shows the playful monkey first jumping onto a ledge to watch pedestrians wander past. The teenager wanders past the monkey, who eyeballs him from a ledge as he gives it the middle finger. Much like a human, the monkey interprets the gesture as an insult and responds by throwing himself at the teenager. He is sent sprawling onto the ground, while the monkey bounds back up again to the ledge.

The 10-second video, obtained by Daily Caller reporter Kaitlin Collins, is titled ‘Lessons from Dan Blizerian’In the clip, the two men sit at a table opposite one another with money fans in their hands, playing what appears to be Liar's Poker - a game where players use dollars bills instead of cards and track the serial numbers on the banknotes. The goal of the game, according to Investopedia.com, is to bluff the opponents into believing that your bid does not exceed the combined sum of all of your bid. Capital One became the first provider to scrap its cashback offer for new customers. Company said it made perks 'no longer sustainable' after announcement of EU cap on processing fees. European Parliament voted in favour of a cap at 0.2 per cent of transaction value for debit cards and 0.3 per cent for credit cards.
North Sentinel Island belongs to India and is located in the Bay of Bengal. It has remained untouched by modern civilisation for centuries, despite being populated for an estimated 60,000 years. It is too dangerous to approach the islanders due to their hostility to outsiders, meaning they are rarely photographed up close and almost never seen on video. Indian authorities have gone as far as making it a crime to try to make contact with the Sentinelese.

Alvarez is a leader with Fight For $15, an international movement to raise minimum wage laws and acquire the right to unionize. Scientists in Colorado have found evidence for a new solar season cycle. Every two years it appears 'bands' of magnetic field move to the surface. This combines with the existing 11-year solar cycle, causing even more powerful coronal mass ejections (CMEs), and solar flares that can endanger Earth.

A Queensland man ordered some computer equipment be delivered from Griffith University at Nathan in Brisbane’s south to a parcel locker at Sunnybank- located less than five kilometres apart. The package was picked up from the sender in Nathan, Queensland, on Monday, April 20 at 12:26pm. It was then sent 934kms to an Australia Post facility in Chullora, NSW, to be processed, and arrived on Tuesday, April 21, at 1:19pm. The next day it was sent all the way back to Queensland, and was processed at a facility in Underwood on Wednesday, April 22, at 6:35pm.

New NHS guidelines urge GPs to draw up end-of-life plans for over-75s, as well as younger patients suffering from cancer, dementia, heart disease or serious lung conditions. They are also being told to ask whether the patient wants doctors to try to resuscitate them if their health suddenly deteriorates. The NHS says the guidance will improve patients' care, but medical professionals say it is 'blatantly wrong' and will frighten the elderly into thinking they are being 'written off'

Scientists at the University of Bristol quizzed 40 heterosexual male and female students. They asked them to rate the attractiveness of three groups of people who were sober, tipsy and drunk. Sober subjects and those who had 'had a few too many' were rated as far less attractive than a 'tipsy' subject. But too much booze leads to 'excessive and unattractive' changes in facial expressions.

Broccoli chemical sulforaphane is known to block inflammation and damage to cartilage associated with arthritis. But patients would have to eat several pounds of the vegetable every day to derive any significant benefit. UK drug company Evgen Pharma has developed a stable synthetic version of the chemical.

Holden issued a stop delivery notice to car dealers and urged owners of the Holden Colorado- SUV or ute- to have their cars checked out immediately. Models said to be affected were made in Thailand between September 2013 and January 2015. Holden said the issue is caused by an alternator cable making unnecessary contact with a steel bracket on the battery tray. Under certain driving conditions the movement of the engine could cause the cable to rub through the insulation, potentially causing a short circuit.

Intrepid Travel cancels all bookings to Nepal until May 11 in the wake of the earthquake. Those planning on travelling before this date with existing bookings have been offered a full refund or alternative trip. British Foreign Office has advised tourists to check with their travel provider before heading to Nepal.

David Duane Watson, a 46-year-old Tucson firefighter, was arrested without incident Saturday on charges he killed his ex-wife, Linda Watson, 35, in 2000. Police say the dispute continued after Watson's murder as her mother Marilyn Cox, 63, tried to obtain visitation rights over the girl. Three years after her daughter went missing, Cox and her neighbor Renee Farnsworth, 53, were shot dead in the driveway of Linda Watson's home. Watson has been charged in all three homicides with police cited DNA evidence.

A film crew were just off New Zealand's Stewart Island when they attempted to put a camera on the dorsal fin of the massive ocean predator. The great white decided to nudge the boat and bite at the thin rope that tethered the dinghy to the main boat. The two men that can be seen on the boat are shark experts Jeff Kurr and Andy Casagrande. They are panicking as the great white uses it's strong jaws and tail to shake the boat, causing it to sway dangerously.

The prosecution is trying to prove that Holmes was not mentally ill and knew exactly what he was doing the night of July 20, 2012, when he opened fire during the midnight premiere of the Batman film 'The Dark Knight Rises'If the 12 final jurors, chosen from a pool of 9,000, decide he was mentally ill at the time of the shooting, he will be committed indefinitely to a state psychiatric hospital.

Professor Alice Roberts and Dr Michael Mosley examine the links between gender and the brain. According to popular mythology, men tend to be more obsessed by cars and obscure facts. Women, on the other hand, are said to be better at empathy and understanding what another person is feeling.

Despite plummeting temperatures and rain, crowds had started to form outside Tribhuwan International Airport as darkness fell on Saturday night. Many visitors had already booked return journeys but had crowded outside the airport in the hope of boarding the next available flight back to India. Others had been left stranded after some flights out of the capital city were cancelled.

Buildings including the Dharahara Tower, which was built in 1832, was almost completely destroyed by the quake. Buildings in Patan and Bhaktapur, on the outskirts of the capital, were also devastated by the shocks.

Grimes Cottage is a heritage-listed 1830s Colonial Georgian residence with three storeys and six bedrooms. Whaling captain George Grimes built the home along with a row of early 1840s terraces depicted in artist Conrad Marten’s work in 1843. The 416sqm inner city block property has a large northerly garden with footsteps down to the heart of the historical area of The Rocks.

Doctors in Kurdistan are allegedly performing abortions on young Yazidi girls who have been released after being held as sex slaves by ISIS fighters. The young girls, some barely teenagers, are some of around 40,000 people kidnapped at gunpoint when Islamic State fighters attacked Yazidi villages last summer. The women who have escaped now face being shunned by their strict religious communities, and many are trying to hide the physical evidence of their time in captivity.

Authorities also said crews still are searching for five people missing in the water following the Dauphin Island regatta on Saturday - which included more than 100 sailboats and as many as 200 people. The storm rolled through the area about 4pm and a man was plucked from the waters by the Coast Guard around 9pm, Petty officer Carlos Vega said. Coast Guard Capt. Duke Walker told AL.com that ten vessels were capsized or incapacitated during the storm.

More than 72,000 camp inmates and prisoners of war died at Bergen-Belsen concentration camp in northern Germany. British soldiers liberated the camp on April 15, 1945. Today, seventy years on, hundreds of people laid flowers and flags as memorials. German president Joachim Gauck said the British soldiers were 'ambassadors of a democratic culture who were not looking for revenge'

He has drawn parallels between modern-day Britain and the Roman Empire in 100BC when Julius Caesar was ruler. Dr Penman has suggested Britons have lost the drive for innovation that helped huge social, economic and industrial changes during the Victorian era.

The Dragon King dinosaur skull is being sold by Hong Kong-based experts Evolve. It is more than 95 per cent complete bone, is 9.2ft (2.8 metres) long and 4.6ft (1.4 metres) wide. The skull belonged to a male Triceratops that lived 66 million years ago. The fossil - first found in Montana in 1992 - is expected to fetch $1.8 million (£1.2 million) at auction.
Colin Farrell says he's no longer the womaniser we once knew, and hasn't dated in four years. The 38-year-old actor says that he's now focusing on resurrecting his acting career and being a good father to his two sons James Padraig, 11, and Henry Tadeusz, five. He is also the face of the new Dolce & Gabbana fragrance Intenso.
Supreme Court's. arguments on Tuesday over same-sex marriage will cap more than. two decades of litigation and a transformation in public. attitudes. Justice Anthony Kennedy, the court's pivotal member on gay. rights, has been marching in this direction with opinions dating. to 1996. In his most recent gay rights decision for the court in. 2013, Kennedy deplored. that U.S. law for making gay marriages 'unequal'
Japanese photographer Uruma Takezawa spent 1,021 days on the road, to capture amazing images on an odyssey that took him to 103 countries on four continents. The results are a spectacular set of dramatic images, which form part of an exhibition at New York's Foto-Care Gallery.

He has also been linked to Adel Abdel Bari, another Egyptian-born jihadist and senior al-Qaeda operative. Security services are believed to be investigating his influence on the London Boys terror cell of which Enwazi was a part.
Rochelle Holmes, 26, ballooned to 20st 5lbs and smoked 20 cigarettes a day. She spent £30 a week on takeaways and kebabs and never learned to cook a proper meal. She was so overweight she became out of breath walking up stairs. Doctors told her she was at risk of suffering a stroke at just 23. She shed 8st after changing diet and exercising and is now a size 12.
Corinthian Colleges will shut down all of its remaining 28 ground campuses, displacing about 16,000 students. The closures include Heald College campuses in California, Hawaii and Oregon, as well as Everest and WyoTech schools in Arizona and New York. It collapsed last summer amid a cash shortage and fraud allegations and its closures are believed to be the biggest shutdown in the history of US higher education.
Susannah Ross, 20, told friends she was going trekking last week. But she has not been heard from since the disaster on Saturday. She was due to continue to India for a yoga course in June. Many Britons were climbing Mount Everest at the time of the disaster. Others were staying in the capital Kathmandu or trekking through rural areas.
Geoff Haigh, 61, from Oldham, Greater Manchester, wanted to marry his long-term partner Heather, 54, after being diagnosed with terminal pancreatic cancer. The couple settled on a venue close to their home as it was not too far from their home. But, instead of having the magical day they had planned, the couple were left reeling after a number of bungles thwarted the ceremony from running smoothly. Guests were forced to listen to the song 'Wonderful Life' 10 times in a row due to a blunder. Their marriage certificate was recorded with the wrong date on, rendering it invalid.

Horseshoe-shaped glass walkway in Chongqing extends 87.5ft from the edge of a cliff, allowing visitors to feel as though they are walking on air with the valley floor 2,350ft below their feet. It is the longest cantilever bridge in the world, beating Arizona’s Grand Canyon Skywalk by 16.4ft.
Scientists took CT scans of teeth found at two prehistoric sites in northern Italy. They found they belonged to ancestors of modern humans who were part of a group known as the Protoaurignacian culture. The arrival of this modern human culture led to the rapid disappearance of Neanderthals.
Home Secretary Theresa May's attempt to deport the 53-year-old serial criminal failed. Judges rejected the bid because of the risk of 'unacceptably savage' abuse he faced in Libya. It means he will be able to continue his drink-fuelled offending spree in Britain.
A hue of blue inspired by the waters of Hawaii is a prominent feature of the Obama state china service being unveiled by the White House. Michelle Obama's office says the first lady chose what's being called 'Kailua Blue' to distinguish her family's china from the red, green, blue and yellow used on more recent state services. The solid white dinner plates are edged in gold; the service plates have a wide gold rim and the presidential coat of arms at the center.
Valerie Jackson, 35, from Las Vegas, suffers Netherton's syndrome. Her son, four-year-old RJ, is one of just 70 people in the world who suffers the rare condition. His skin appears red and inflamed, and is often covered in dry skin that appears like scales on his body. His mother has to regularly cover him in creams to try and prevent his skin drying out. While out shopping recently, she was surrounded by armed police, who had been called by a member of the public. They reported fears Mrs Jackson had been abusing her son, who has been treated like an outcast.

Sandhya Chalise, who lives in a more remote area of the country, only reached Kathmandu's Bir Hospital two days after the 7.8-magnitude quake and by that point, blood had collected in the top of her brain. Gupta said the girl was just one of many people walking through the doors with head injuries at the overstretched hospital.

Michael O'Leary claims Ryanair will slash fares by as much as 15 per cent over next two years. Ryanair chief executive made the vow in an interview with French newspaper Le Journal du Dimanche. He said its average fare could be as low as €40 (approximately £26) next year. This would be a €6 (£4) decrease from Ryanair’s current average ticket price, he said. Mr O’Leary attributed the anticipated fare cuts to lower oil prices.

Now he has been charged with making and possessing indecent images of children. He will appear at Cambridge Magistrates' Court on May 5 after receiving a summons.
Nursultan Nazarbayev has been re-elected as president of Kazakhstan with 97 per cent of the vote. The 74-year-old former steel worker has ruled the oil-producing nation since 1989. He has been criticised by the West and human rights bodies for crackdowns on dissent.

Photographer Jeffrey Milstein has shot a fascinating project documenting black boxes, shedding light on what happens to the devices after tragic crashes. Despite the name, the boxes are usually red to help rescuers spot them among the wreckage of crashed planes and helicopters. The boxes, which record flight data and conversations between pilots, are incredibly important for discovering what led to a plane's crash. Mr Milstein gained access to air safety storage facilities where data recorders end up following an accident.
Renee Bergeron, 38, from Washington, dresses children with special needs as superheroes, dressing them up with capes, goggles, and wands in order to make them feel like they can do anything. Her first subject was her own son, Apollo, who was diagnosed with a rare heart defect when he was 18 months old and had to be fitted with a feeding tube at a young age.
St Patrick's Parish in Stephensville, Wisconsin has discontinued its Original Pig Rassle tournament after 44 years of the tradition. Global Conservation Group, an animal advocacy group, launched an online petition claiming the tournament was inhumane to the pigs. It garnered more than 81,000 signatures in efforts to cancel the event. The church announced in a statement that moving forward the parish's talents could be'spent in areas that are less controversial'

He stopped off in Hampshire where the Lib Dems held Eastleigh after Chris Huhne was jailed. A new study of Australians' spending habits reveals that 1.2 million either have a secret credit card or hide purchases from a partner. One in three don't pay off their bill each month and 96 per cent make at least one unplanned purchase a month. Generation Y were found to be the least trustworthy of the age categories when it came to their credit card spending.

Charlotte was instead offered a place at Shooters Grove Primary - two miles away.

Nicola Sturgeon said Labour leader Ed Miliband would soon 'change his tune'Her party is on course for a landslide north of the border and could hold the balance of power. Mr Miliband yesterday insisted he would not agree to a 'confidence and supply' deal with SNP. But he again refused to rule out relying on SNP votes to pass key legislation. Critics say that would mean a weak Labour government having to negotiate with SNP MPs.
Koningsdag - or King's Day - is a public holiday in the Netherlands and is traditionally marked with a royal procession either in the capital Amsterdam or in one of the country's major cities. Today, it was the turn of Dordrecht, a city in the south-west of country, which was once a major trading port, as well as a military hub.

More than 45,000 people have signed a petition calling for the advert to be pulled. It features a model in a bikini with the question: 'Are you beach body ready?' But the campaign has attracted the ire of many social media users and body image campaigners. The Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) said it has received 216 complaints about the ad.
Avalanche started on Mount Kumori, a 23,000-foot-high mountain just a few miles from Everest, and gathered strength as it tore across the world's highest peak. Eighteen people died in the avalanche, including four Americans, and 61 were injured, according to Nepal's mountaineering department. First survivors were flown off Everest by aid helicopters and began sharing their incredible stories of survival.
Russian vessel Oleg Naydenov caught fire in Las Palmas port on April 11. It was towed out to sea as a precaution and sank some 15 miles south of Gran Canaria. The Spanish government activated an environmental emergency alert and said one beach has been cleared of oil. Clean-up operations are ongoing on three other beaches near Maspalomas.

Dozens of people have been clambering around the debris of the Dharahara Tower in Kathmandu. They have been taking pictures amongst the rubble of the historic structure, which has been reduced to an enormous pile of red brick dust. It is unclear how many people were killed in the tower in the quake-hit city, but it was believed to have been filled with tourists. One rescuer said those taking photographs of themselves and friends were not 'understanding the tragedy'

Mark Hawkins, 49, reportedly barricaded himself inside the Greyhound-style bus in the parking lot of a Walmart in Salem, Oregon, after he was approached by police, who believed him to be wanted. Hawkins, who was being hunted in Lane County for failing to appear on a charge of delivery of a controlled substance, allegedly fired his weapon from the front of the large vehicle. The bullet struck a police dog named Baco in the head, prompting an exchange of gunfire between officers and Hawkins. At around 6.30pm, police shot at the suspect multiple times, and he was hit and wounded by nine bullets, causing him to slide out of the bus. He was then taken to a nearby hospital, where he later died.
Researchers say three quarters of extreme hot weather and 18% of heavy precipitation is being driven by global warming. They warn that as climate change pushes global temperatures higher, humans will be responsible for 40% of extreme rainfall events. Scientists claim it is the rarest and most destructive events that seem to be the most responsive to human influence.
At least five tornadoes were spotted across north and central Texas Sunday evening as part of a severe storm system sweeping the region. The storm started Sunday evening in Comanche County, Texas and moved northeast towards the Dallas/Fort Worth for the next several hours. More than five tornadoes were reported in the region, including a massive funnel cloud seen forming over Stephenville, 70 miles southeast of Forth Worth. Residents were urged to stay indoors and seek shelter because of flying debris and the possibility of 'complete destruction' when it touched down.
President Obama reportedly granted the CIA a waiver exempting the agency from providing proof of imminent threat to the US ahead of planned drone strikes in January. Without Obama's waiver, CIA operatives would have been forced to gather additional information and surveillance data on the al Qaeda-linked militants targeted in the January 15 strike, which may have delayed it, possibly sparing the lives of Dr Warren Weinstein, a 73-year-old economic adviser from the US, and Italian aid worker Giovanni Lo Porto. The CIA was seeking to destroy an al Qaeda compound in Pakistan when the two captives were killed.

Craig Lister, 54, was diagnosed with prostate cancer in 2012. He is now well and his tumours have shrunk, but he is still taking hormone treatment. Hormone therapy starves cancer cells by reducing levels of testosterone in the body. The majority of prostate cancers rely on the hormone to grow.

From pulling faces to complaining about waking up early for dawn service, tens of thousands of selfies from across the country have emerged on social media to mark the centenary ANZAC Day. Many had shared some special moments with their families and friends at football matches or a trip to the pub for two-up but others seemed to think the day was more about how they looked than commemorating others.

Residents on the east coast of Japan's Hokkaido Island had an unexpected change of scenery this morning after 1,000ft of seabed was forced to the surface overnight. The extra stretch of coastline on Shiretoko Peninsula near the town of Rausu has risen as high as 50ft from the sea surface. Geologists believe the emergence is a result of a landslide nearby, when melting ice and snow caused a section of land to drop, pivoting the underwater area into the air.
Loretta Lynch was sworn in as the 83rd U.S. attorney general on Monday, becoming the first African-American woman to serve as the nation's top law enforcement official. She said her confirmation as attorney general showed that 'we can do anything' and pledged to deal with cyberattacks and other threats facing the country. 'We can restore trust and faith both in our laws and those who enforce them,' Lynch said, apparently referring to race-riot clashes between protesters and police.

Tim Ward and his wife of 38 years, Brandy, were at home in Oso, Washington, on March 22, 2014, when tons of debris, soil and rock came crashing down from upland. Brandy was one of the 43 people crushed by the force of the natural disaster. Tim, who broke his pelvis, was buried under 25 feet of mud, but managed to call for help through a gap in the surface. A week later, he was informed he did not have 'landslide insurance' - and therefore did not qualify for payment to settle his mortgage.

The EOssc2 is described as an 'ultra flexible micro-car for mega cities' and is designed to connect to others to form a train. It can turn on the spot, shrink in size and even move sideways, like a crab, so it can park itself. Engineers at the DFKI Robotics Centre in Bremen, Germany, plan on enabling it to drive itself. The car has a top speed of 40mph (65 km/h) and its semi-autonomous features are possible because of inbuilt cameras and a LIDAR sensor on its roof.
Palaeontologists are referring to Chilesaurus diegosuarezi as a 'platypus' dinosaur because of its bizarre combination of characteristics, including its small skull and feet. The dinosaur from the Late Jurassic Period, around 145 million years ago, is named after the country where it was discovered. It belongs to the theropod group of dinosaurs - which includes the famous meat eaters Velociraptor, Carnotaurus and Tyrannosaurus, from which birds today evolved - but was a vegetarian.

Nasa scientists in California have revealed an interactive 3D map for Vesta using images from the Dawn spacecraft. The map lets you see features on the surface including craters, hills, mountains and even 'canyons'You can also measure elevation changes and see different measurement data. And a 'gaming mode' lets you fly around the largest asteroid in the solar system using your keyboard's arrow keys.

Mark 1 version of Reginald Mitchell's famous design was among the first built in March 1940. Spitfire P9374 was being piloted by Flying Officer Peter Cazenove over Dunkirk when it was hit by a single bullet from a German Dornier bomber. Plane was consumed by the sandy beach and remained there for the next 40 years. In 1980 the wreckage was discovered when part of it was spotted poking out from its sandy grave. Plane will be auctioned for charity on July 9 and is expected to fetch up to £2.5million.

Archaeologists have uncovered a ritual burial of 2,000-year-old human skulls. The bones were packed neatly into a cooking pot and set off at the side of the historic River Walbrook, in London, sparking the theory they could be the remains of Boudicca's rebels. Experts are questioning whether the remains were part of a gruesome ceremony. It had been thought they had got there after being eroded out of a Roman cemetery to the north - but new evidence suggests otherwise.

One in five people have never seen a hedgehog in their gardens, according to a new wildlife survey. Of those who do spot the tiny animals, only a quarter see them frequently. There are thought to be less than 1 million hedgehogs living in this country today, an estimated 30 per cent drop since 2013.

Map spans nearly two billion light years from side to side. Regions with many galaxies are shown in white or red, whereas regions with fewer galaxies are dark blue. It will help astrophysicists understand how matter is distributed in the universe and provide key insights into dark matter.
Scientists believe the hats, or 'pukao', were rolled up ramps to reach the top of the figures which measure up to 40ft (12 metres) tall. Some 1,000 carved Moai line the perimeter of the 12 mile (25km) volcanic island, which is the most isolated inhabited landmass on Earth with just 6,000 residents.
Brenda Finn, 30, from London, was 14 when she was diagnosed with alopecia universalis. She suffered from crippling anxiety and depression due to her hair loss. She was bullied at school for wearing a wig, shattering her confidence so much she left school. Her family paid for her to have eyebrows tattooed on, giving her the confidence to face the world again. Miss Finn is calling for medical tattooing to become available on the NHS, as she says it could have saved her years of emotional pain.

Elle Macpherson, 51, has revealed she carries a pH balance urine tester kit in her handbag. The body's pH value tells you how acidic or alkaline your body is, and many nutritionists say that having an alkaline body helps defend against sickness and disease. Elle is well-known for her healthy diet and even released her own superfood product, The Super Elixir.

The execution will likely take place in a clearing known as 'Death Valley' - a clearing on Nusakambagan. The Australian duo selected the spiritual advisers who will accompany them to their execution. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, 82, will be part of a decision which begins hearing arguments tomorrow on whether states are allowed to ban same-sex unions and refuse to recognize those made in other states. Ginsburg has been unusually open about her opinions ahead of the cases, cutting against a long-held tradition of not speaking out in advance. She will get the chance to make her views known in the upcoming case of Obergefell v. Hodges, for which arguments will be heard from Tuesday and a decision is expected this summer.

Greystone Park Psychiatric Center, in New Jersey, was built to house hundreds of mentally ill patients, but it eventually was home to more than 7,500 people. It has long been abandoned and has been left to fall into disarray, now known for its crumbling walls, flaking plaster and gaping holes in ceilings and staircases. However, preservationists are arguing that it should not be bulldozed and should instead be converted into a museum and housing.
Waze app allows users to tag locations of parked police vehicles, accidents, congestion, traffic cameras, potholes and more. Users can also share road reports on accidents, police traps, or any other hazards along the way, helping to give other users in the area a 'heads-up' about what's to come. Google acquired Waze in 2013 for a reported $1.1 billion.

Ancient civilisations such as the Romans, Greeks and Egyptians have had to deal with rowdy, drunken behaviour in public for thousands of years.

J.M. Giordano, who works at the City Paper, says Baltimore police'swarmed over' him and hit him repeatedly. The 41-year-old photographer says the incident happened around 12.30am when someone threw a rock at a police line and hit an officer's shield. He and a protester were standing next to each other when the police line suddenly marched forward and the two men didn't move out of the way quickly enough, each being knocked to the ground.
Researchers from National Chung Hsing University in Taiwan studied the expression of genes known to be associated with petal development. They found that in mature orchid flowers, the expression pattern suggests two protein complexes, called the 'L' complex and the 'SP' complex, compete to promote the formation of the lip and standard petals. They converted lips into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the L complex using gene silencing.
Research by wildlife charity the WWF identified 11 'deforestation fronts' where 80 per cent of projected global forest losses by 2030 could occur. The areas are the Amazon, the Atlantic Forest and Gran Chaco, and the Cerrado in South America, the Congo Basin, East Africa, eastern Australia, the Greater Mekong in South East Asia, Borneo, New Guinea and Sumatra. The fronts, which are at sustained and increased risk of deforestation, are home to indigenous communities that depend on forests for their livelihoods. But they are being lost to expanding agriculture, including livestock farming, palm oil plantations and soy production, as well as small-scale farmers.
Poppy Smart, 23, from Worcester, was first whistled at by builders on her way to work. But the whistles and accompanying sexist comments turned into a daily ritual. Marketing co-ordinator said it made her walk to work in Worcester city centre an 'awful experience'One of the workers even approached her on the pavement, blocking her way, before saying 'Morning love'Miss Smart recorded the constant whistling using her smartphone's video function.

The 511 elephant tusks, worth $6million (£4m), were seized at a major port in Chonburi province in eastern Thailand. The bust came after customs officials received a tip-off in Laos and Thailand and tracked the containers from Kenya. The ivory was shipped out of Kenya on March 24 and went through ports in Sri Lanka, Malaysia and Singapore before coming to Thailand.

MP passed dossier of information to Home Office in 1995 in hope it would kick-start police investigation. But paperwork was shelved by officials until it was discovered in 2013 and passed to Leicestershire Police. Labour MP Simon Danczuk is calling for Home Office to 'come clean' over dossier.
Harvard-led study has mapped taste buds on a tongue for the first time. Scientists examined the different cells used to identify taste and watched these cells capture and process molecules live. They were also able to spot blood vessels up to 240 microns - 240 millionths of a metre (0.0024mm) below the surface of the tongue. Penguins lost three of the five basic vertebrate tastes - sweet, bitter and the savoury, meaty taste known as umami - more than 20 million years ago and never regained them.

Brisbane, Melbourne and Perth also saw hoards of people congregate to show solidarity for the condemned duo. The two men refused to sign their execution warrants during official proceedings on Saturday, saying they believed it would be unjust to kill them.

Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) is scrapping paper counterpart that accompanies all UK plastic photocard licences. Information about penalty points for traffic violations such as speeding will be held only on DVLA’s database, and will have to be checked online, by phone or by post. But motoring groups fear switch to fully online system will make it more difficult for car hire firms which want to check a motorist's details.

She would stay up late studying, resulting in sleep deprivation and negative impact on her performance at school - which caused further depression and anxiety. She had seen a number of doctors over several years, but her father Ankush Nigam told the inquest that she had often refused treatment. She told her parents she was feeling suicidal in 2013 and had even said she would stand in front of a fast train on a Tuesday to take her life.

Kim Davies bought Llanwenarth House, near Abergavenny, Monmouthshire, for £675,000 in 2008. But he then made dozens of illegal alterations, including installing a whirlpool bath with shiny mosaic tiles, crystal chandeliers and spotlights in the ceiling. He also put in inappropriate kitchen fittings and replaced the Grade II-listed house's timber windows with modern ones. Davies, 60, initially denied five charges under the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. But shortly before his trial was scheduled to start at Newport Crown Court he pleaded guilty to illegally altering the house.
Last month, Nasa captured a 17 miles (27km) long iceberg being born in the West Antarctica's Getz Ice Shelf. The monster iceberg, larger than Manhattan, was spotted breaking away from the ice shelf by the U.S. National Ice Center (NIC)It is the 34th iceberg from the 'B' quadrant of Antarctica to be tracked by the NIC. B-34 appears to have fractured and moved out into in the Amundsen Sea sometime in mid- to late-February 2015.

Nanoheat Wireless Heated Mug is fitted with a rechargeable battery, nanoheater and heat sleeve. It can maintain the temperature of hot drinks at between 68°C and 71°C (155 and 160 °F) for up to 45 minutes. This gives you plenty of time to drink to finish the beverage before its gets too cold. It weighs a little over one pound (454g) and can be charged wirelessly or using a traditional USB cord.

Mobile phone companies charge up to 20p a minute to call supposedly free 0800 numbers. Charges will end from July 1 under proposals published by telecoms watchdog, Ofcom. EE claims the plan is ill thought out and will make an already struggling industry suffer.
Andrew Chan and Myruan Sukumaran will be executed at the stroke of midnight on Tuesday. The Bali Nine ringleaders will face 12 marksmen, with only three of them holding loaded guns, in the depths of the jungle on Nusakambangan Island in Java. The pair will be led from their isolated cells in Batu prison through the wildly dense tropical forest up a 3km steep winding track to a place called Nirbaya - or more appropriately known as Death Valley. They will be given white clothing to wear and a choice whether to be blindfolded before facing the firing squad who will be lined up anywhere from five to 10 metres in front of them.

The 25-year-old signed with the Dallas Cowboys last month and will be forced to sit out the first 10 games of the season and will not receive his salary for these games. Hardy was convicted last year of beating, strangling and threatening to kill his ex-girlfriend, Nicki Holder. Holder told police that Hardy choked her, slammed her against a bathtub, threw her to the floor and threatened to kill her after a fight at his Charlotte condo.
